;psbn& noitarepooC lanoigeR dna htworG rof stcepsorP :kooltuO cimonocE NAESA noitarepooC lanoigeR dna htworG rof stcepsorP :kooltuO cimonocE NAESA";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-04-07 17:43:23";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-04-25 09:42:41";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"18";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"amelia.litania@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:22;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"12389";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6659";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:57:"epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:58:"EPR for Plastics in Viet Nam: Challenges and Opportunities";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-04-01";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"4";s:7:"content";s:15726:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/RKCMPD/PSP-Viet-Nam/2022_March_PSP_31.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p><strong>ASEAN+3 Private Sector Initiatives to Reduce Marine Plastics - online event series</strong></p><p>The private sector in ASEAN+3 countries have been contributing significantly to the reduction of plastic waste and by consequence marine plastic debris in the region. Their efforts can range from both production and consumption (so-called &ldquo;upstream&rdquo;) level to recycling and waste management (so-called &ldquo;downstream&rdquo;) level. In Viet Nam, the new extended producers&rsquo; responsibility (EPR) approach has come into effect in January 2022, which will impact business operations on plastic packaging including PET bottle, EPS, PSP, PVC, plastic container tray, and film. According to the EPR principles, producers will be in charge not only to produce such commodities but will be held responsible until the waste stage of their life cycle. How to effectively implement this policy and create positive impacts on the environment will be the upcoming challenges for the country.</p><p>Tr&ecirc;n thá»±c táº¿, khu vá»±c tÆ° nh&acirc;n táº¡i c&aacute;c nÆ°á»›c ASEAN + 3 Ä‘&atilde; v&agrave; Ä‘ang Ä‘&oacute;ng g&oacute;p Ä‘&aacute;ng ká»ƒ v&agrave;o viá»‡c giáº£m thiá»ƒu r&aacute;c tháº£i nhá»±a v&agrave; giáº£m r&aacute;c nhá»±a biá»ƒn trong khu vá»±c. Nhá»¯ng ná»— lá»±c cá»§a há» c&oacute; thá»ƒ bao gá»“m cáº£ cáº¥p Ä‘á»™ sáº£n xuáº¥t v&agrave; ti&ecirc;u d&ugrave;ng (Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i l&agrave; &ldquo;thÆ°á»£ng nguá»“n&rdquo;) Ä‘áº¿n t&aacute;i cháº¿ v&agrave; quáº£n l&yacute; cháº¥t tháº£i (Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i l&agrave; &ldquo;háº¡ nguá»“n&rdquo;). Táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam, phÆ°Æ¡ng ph&aacute;p tiáº¿p cáº­n tr&aacute;ch nhiá»‡m má»Ÿ rá»™ng cá»§a nh&agrave; sáº£n xuáº¥t (EPR) má»›i c&oacute; hiá»‡u lá»±c v&agrave;o th&aacute;ng 01 nÄƒm 2022, sáº½ t&aacute;c Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘áº¿n hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng kinh doanh bao b&igrave; nhá»±a bao gá»“m chai PET, EPS, PSP, PVC, khay nhá»±a v&agrave; m&agrave;ng nhá»±a. Theo c&aacute;c nguy&ecirc;n táº¯c EPR, c&aacute;c nh&agrave; sáº£n xuáº¥t sáº½ kh&ocirc;ng chá»‰ chá»‹u tr&aacute;ch nhiá»‡m sáº£n xuáº¥t nhá»¯ng máº·t h&agrave;ng Ä‘&oacute; m&agrave; c&ograve;n chá»‹u tr&aacute;ch nhiá»‡m cho Ä‘áº¿n giai Ä‘oáº¡n tháº£i bá» trong v&ograve;ng Ä‘á»i cá»§a ch&uacute;ng. L&agrave;m tháº¿ n&agrave;o Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n hiá»‡u quáº£ ch&iacute;nh s&aacute;ch n&agrave;y v&agrave; táº¡o ra nhá»¯ng t&aacute;c Ä‘á»™ng t&iacute;ch cá»±c Ä‘áº¿n m&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng sáº½ l&agrave; nhá»¯ng th&aacute;ch thá»©c sáº¯p tá»›i Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i quá»‘c gia.</p><p>ERIA&rsquo;s Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), in collaboration with the Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI) of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE), will shed light on the opportunities and constraints to implement EPR on plastics in Viet Nam by engaging in a discussion with the private sector, who will be the key stakeholder in the process.</p><p>RKC-MPD cá»§a ERIA phá»‘i há»£p vá»›i Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam (VASI) cá»§a Bá»™ T&agrave;i nguy&ecirc;n v&agrave; M&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng (MONRE) sáº½ l&agrave;m s&aacute;ng tá» nhá»¯ng cÆ¡ há»™i v&agrave; háº¡n cháº¿ Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n EPR Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i nhá»±a táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam báº±ng c&aacute;ch tham gia v&agrave;o má»™t cuá»™c tháº£o luáº­n vá»›i khu vá»±c tÆ° nh&acirc;n, sáº½ l&agrave; b&ecirc;n li&ecirc;n quan ch&iacute;nh trong qu&aacute; tr&igrave;nh n&agrave;y.</p><p data-key="146"><span data-key="147">The forum will be an occasion for Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI), Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE) of Viet Nam, a Vietnamese business alliance, Vietnamese private companies, and international businesses operating in Viet Nam to stocktake the progress made and discuss the many ways private companies can contribute to combatting plastic waste and marine plastic debris, especially taking into consideration the new EPR scheme. RKC-MPD will reintroduce the Private Sector Platform (PSP) to the public, particularly to the private companies, to raise more awareness of the platform and attract a larger number of private companies to join the fight against marine plastics. </span></p><p data-key="148" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="149"> Diá»…n Ä‘&agrave;n sáº½ l&agrave; dá»‹p Ä‘á»ƒ Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam, Bá»™ T&agrave;i nguy&ecirc;n v&agrave; M&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng Viá»‡t Nam, li&ecirc;n minh doanh nghiá»‡p Viá»‡t Nam, c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n Viá»‡t Nam v&agrave; c&aacute;c doanh nghiá»‡p quá»‘c táº¿ hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam giá»›i thiá»‡u nhá»¯ng tiáº¿n bá»™ Ä‘&atilde; Ä‘áº¡t Ä‘Æ°á»£c v&agrave; tháº£o luáº­n vá» c&aacute;ch m&agrave; c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n c&oacute; thá»ƒ Ä‘&oacute;ng g&oacute;p trong viá»‡c chá»‘ng láº¡i r&aacute;c tháº£i nhá»±a v&agrave; r&aacute;c nhá»±a biá»ƒn, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t l&agrave; xem x&eacute;t chÆ°Æ¡ng tr&igrave;nh EPR má»›i. RKC-MPD sáº½ giá»›i thiá»‡u láº¡i Ná»n táº£ng khu vá»±c tÆ° nh&acirc;n (PSP) cho c&ocirc;ng ch&uacute;ng, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t l&agrave; c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n, Ä‘á»ƒ n&acirc;ng cao nháº­n thá»©c hÆ¡n vá» ná»n táº£ng n&agrave;y v&agrave; thu h&uacute;t má»™t sá»‘ lÆ°á»£ng lá»›n hÆ¡n c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n tham gia cuá»™c chiáº¿n chá»‘ng láº¡i r&aacute;c nhá»±a biá»ƒn.</span></p><p>Event Details</p><p>Date: Friday, 1 April 2022<br /> Time: 9 AM - 11 AM (Jakarta time, UTC+7))<br /> RSVP:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107</a></p><p><strong>NG&Agrave;Y V&Agrave; GIá»œ</strong></p><p>April 1st 2022, 09:00-11:00, Hanoi time (GMT+7)<br />Ng&agrave;y 01 th&aacute;ng 4 nÄƒm 2022, 09: 00-11: 00, giá» H&agrave; Ná»™i (GMT + 7)<br />RSVP: <a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107">https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107</a>&nbsp;</p><h2>Webinar Agenda</h2><p>Hosted by the RKC-MPD of ERIA and VASI, the Webinar will last 2 hours via Zoom platform with a moderated panel discussion.</p><table width="654"><tr><td width="203"><p>TIME</p></td><td width="451"><p>AGENDA&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td width="203"><p>9 AM &ndash; 9:15 AM</p></td><td width="451"><p>Start of Webinar by MC Ms Ellen Putri Edita (ERIA)</p><p>Welcome Remarks:</p><ul><li>Mr Michikazu Kojima, Senior Advisor to ERIA</li><li>Mr Pham Thu Hang, Deputy Director-General, Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI)</li></ul><p>NgÆ°á»i dáº«n chÆ°Æ¡ng tr&igrave;nh: C&ocirc; Ellen Putri Edita (ERIA)<br />Ch&agrave;o má»«ng c&aacute;c Ä‘áº¡i biá»ƒu v&agrave; báº¯t Ä‘áº§u Há»™i tháº£o<br />Ph&aacute;t biá»ƒu khai máº¡c:<br />&bull; &Ocirc;ng Michikazu Kojima, TÆ° váº¥n cáº¥p cao, RKC-MPD, ERIA<br />&bull; L&atilde;nh Ä‘áº¡o Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam</p></td></tr><tr><td width="203"><p>9:15 AM - 10:15 AM</p></td><td width="451"><p>Panel Discussion</p><p>Speakers:</p><ul><li>Mr Nguyen Thi, Principal Official of the Department of Legal Affairs (MONRE)</li><li>Presentation: Mr Fausto Tazzi, Vice President of the Vietnam Packaging Recycling Alliance (PRO Vietnam)</li><li>Presentation: Mr Long Nguyen, Deputy CEO of An Phat Holdings</li><li>Presentation: Mr Ekkasit Lakkananithiphan, the President of Dow Vietnam</li><li>Presentation: Mr Hideki Wada, Director of Vietnam Waste Planning Company</li></ul><p>Moderated by&nbsp;Dr Nguyen My Hang, Deputy Director of the Department of Science, Technology and International Cooperation (VASI), and Ellen Putri Edita</p><p>Äiá»u phá»‘i:<br />&bull; TS Nguyá»…n Má»¹ Háº±ng, Ph&oacute; Vá»¥ trÆ°á»Ÿng Vá»¥ Khoa há»c, C&ocirc;ng nghá»‡ v&agrave; Há»£p t&aacute;c Quá»‘c táº¿, Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam<br />Nhá»¯ng ngÆ°á»i tham gia há»™i tháº£o:<br />&bull; Bá»™ T&agrave;i nguy&ecirc;n v&agrave; M&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng (C&aacute;c quy Ä‘á»‹nh vá» EPR v&agrave; kh&oacute; khÄƒn táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam)<br />&bull; Li&ecirc;n minh T&aacute;i cháº¿ Bao b&igrave; Viá»‡t Nam (PRO Viá»‡t Nam)<br />&bull; C&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n Viá»‡t Nam<br />&bull; &Ocirc;ng Ekkasit Lakkananithiphan, Chá»§ tá»‹ch Dow Viá»‡t Nam<br />&bull; &Ocirc;ng Hideki Wada, Gi&aacute;m Ä‘á»‘c, C&ocirc;ng ty Quy hoáº¡ch Cháº¥t tháº£i Viá»‡t Nam</p><p>Má»—i th&agrave;nh vi&ecirc;n há»™i tháº£o sáº½ tr&igrave;nh b&agrave;y 8 ph&uacute;t vá» chá»§ Ä‘á» Ä‘&atilde; chá»n</p></td></tr><tr><td width="203"><p>10:15 AM -10:50 AM</p></td><td width="451"><p>Q&amp;A&nbsp;</p><p>Tháº£o luáº­n Há»i &amp; Ä&aacute;p má»Ÿ</p></td></tr><tr><td width="203"><p>10:50 AM -10:55 AM</p></td><td width="451"><p>Introduction of RKC-MPD&rsquo;s Private Sector Platform</p><p>ERIA má»i c&aacute;c Ä‘áº¡i biá»ƒu tham gia v&agrave;o ná»n táº£ng trá»±c tuyáº¿n</p></td></tr><tr><td width="203"><p>10:55 AM - 11:00 AM</p></td><td width="451"><p>Closing of the Webinar</p><p>&Ocirc;ng Michikazu Kojima, Cá»‘ váº¥n cao cáº¥p, RKC-MPD, ERIA</p></td></tr></table><p>The webinar will be in Vietnamese and English with simultaneous translation.</p><p>Há»™i tháº£o trá»±c tuyáº¿n Ä‘Æ°á»£c phi&ecirc;n dá»‹ch Ä‘á»“ng thá»i tiáº¿ng Viá»‡t v&agrave; tiáº¿ng Anh.</p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/RKCMPD/PSP-Viet-Nam/2022_March_Concept-Note-of-PSP-Viet-Nam-Event_Bilingual.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><img src="/uploads/media/Events/RKCMPD/2022_March_PSPVietNam.pdf" alt="" />CONCEPT NOTE</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:13:"Ms Hera Diani";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-04-01";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:19781:"EPR for Plastics in Viet Nam: Challenges and Opportunities EPR for Plastics in Viet Nam: Challenges and Opportunities ASEAN+3 Private Sector Initiatives to Reduce Marine Plastics - online event series
The private sector in ASEAN+3 countries have been contributing significantly to the reduction of plastic waste and by consequence marine plastic debris in the region. Their efforts can range from both production and consumption (so-called &ldquo;upstream&rdquo;) level to recycling and waste management (so-called &ldquo;downstream&rdquo;) level. In Viet Nam, the new extended producers&rsquo; responsibility (EPR) approach has come into effect in January 2022, which will impact business operations on plastic packaging including PET bottle, EPS, PSP, PVC, plastic container tray, and film. According to the EPR principles, producers will be in charge not only to produce such commodities but will be held responsible until the waste stage of their life cycle. How to effectively implement this policy and create positive impacts on the environment will be the upcoming challenges for the country.
Tr&ecirc;n thá»±c táº¿, khu vá»±c tÆ° nh&acirc;n táº¡i c&aacute;c nÆ°á»›c ASEAN + 3 Ä‘&atilde; v&agrave; Ä‘ang Ä‘&oacute;ng g&oacute;p Ä‘&aacute;ng ká»ƒ v&agrave;o viá»‡c giáº£m thiá»ƒu r&aacute;c tháº£i nhá»±a v&agrave; giáº£m r&aacute;c nhá»±a biá»ƒn trong khu vá»±c. Nhá»¯ng ná»— lá»±c cá»§a há» c&oacute; thá»ƒ bao gá»“m cáº£ cáº¥p Ä‘á»™ sáº£n xuáº¥t v&agrave; ti&ecirc;u d&ugrave;ng (Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i l&agrave; &ldquo;thÆ°á»£ng nguá»“n&rdquo;) Ä‘áº¿n t&aacute;i cháº¿ v&agrave; quáº£n l&yacute; cháº¥t tháº£i (Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i l&agrave; &ldquo;háº¡ nguá»“n&rdquo;). Táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam, phÆ°Æ¡ng ph&aacute;p tiáº¿p cáº­n tr&aacute;ch nhiá»‡m má»Ÿ rá»™ng cá»§a nh&agrave; sáº£n xuáº¥t (EPR) má»›i c&oacute; hiá»‡u lá»±c v&agrave;o th&aacute;ng 01 nÄƒm 2022, sáº½ t&aacute;c Ä‘á»™ng Ä‘áº¿n hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng kinh doanh bao b&igrave; nhá»±a bao gá»“m chai PET, EPS, PSP, PVC, khay nhá»±a v&agrave; m&agrave;ng nhá»±a. Theo c&aacute;c nguy&ecirc;n táº¯c EPR, c&aacute;c nh&agrave; sáº£n xuáº¥t sáº½ kh&ocirc;ng chá»‰ chá»‹u tr&aacute;ch nhiá»‡m sáº£n xuáº¥t nhá»¯ng máº·t h&agrave;ng Ä‘&oacute; m&agrave; c&ograve;n chá»‹u tr&aacute;ch nhiá»‡m cho Ä‘áº¿n giai Ä‘oáº¡n tháº£i bá» trong v&ograve;ng Ä‘á»i cá»§a ch&uacute;ng. L&agrave;m tháº¿ n&agrave;o Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n hiá»‡u quáº£ ch&iacute;nh s&aacute;ch n&agrave;y v&agrave; táº¡o ra nhá»¯ng t&aacute;c Ä‘á»™ng t&iacute;ch cá»±c Ä‘áº¿n m&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng sáº½ l&agrave; nhá»¯ng th&aacute;ch thá»©c sáº¯p tá»›i Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i quá»‘c gia.
ERIA&rsquo;s Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), in collaboration with the Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI) of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE), will shed light on the opportunities and constraints to implement EPR on plastics in Viet Nam by engaging in a discussion with the private sector, who will be the key stakeholder in the process.
RKC-MPD cá»§a ERIA phá»‘i há»£p vá»›i Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam (VASI) cá»§a Bá»™ T&agrave;i nguy&ecirc;n v&agrave; M&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng (MONRE) sáº½ l&agrave;m s&aacute;ng tá» nhá»¯ng cÆ¡ há»™i v&agrave; háº¡n cháº¿ Ä‘á»ƒ thá»±c hiá»‡n EPR Ä‘á»‘i vá»›i nhá»±a táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam báº±ng c&aacute;ch tham gia v&agrave;o má»™t cuá»™c tháº£o luáº­n vá»›i khu vá»±c tÆ° nh&acirc;n, sáº½ l&agrave; b&ecirc;n li&ecirc;n quan ch&iacute;nh trong qu&aacute; tr&igrave;nh n&agrave;y.
The forum will be an occasion for Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI), Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE) of Viet Nam, a Vietnamese business alliance, Vietnamese private companies, and international businesses operating in Viet Nam to stocktake the progress made and discuss the many ways private companies can contribute to combatting plastic waste and marine plastic debris, especially taking into consideration the new EPR scheme. RKC-MPD will reintroduce the Private Sector Platform (PSP) to the public, particularly to the private companies, to raise more awareness of the platform and attract a larger number of private companies to join the fight against marine plastics. 
 Diá»…n Ä‘&agrave;n sáº½ l&agrave; dá»‹p Ä‘á»ƒ Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam, Bá»™ T&agrave;i nguy&ecirc;n v&agrave; M&ocirc;i trÆ°á»ng Viá»‡t Nam, li&ecirc;n minh doanh nghiá»‡p Viá»‡t Nam, c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n Viá»‡t Nam v&agrave; c&aacute;c doanh nghiá»‡p quá»‘c táº¿ hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ng táº¡i Viá»‡t Nam giá»›i thiá»‡u nhá»¯ng tiáº¿n bá»™ Ä‘&atilde; Ä‘áº¡t Ä‘Æ°á»£c v&agrave; tháº£o luáº­n vá» c&aacute;ch m&agrave; c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n c&oacute; thá»ƒ Ä‘&oacute;ng g&oacute;p trong viá»‡c chá»‘ng láº¡i r&aacute;c tháº£i nhá»±a v&agrave; r&aacute;c nhá»±a biá»ƒn, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t l&agrave; xem x&eacute;t chÆ°Æ¡ng tr&igrave;nh EPR má»›i. RKC-MPD sáº½ giá»›i thiá»‡u láº¡i Ná»n táº£ng khu vá»±c tÆ° nh&acirc;n (PSP) cho c&ocirc;ng ch&uacute;ng, Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t l&agrave; c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n, Ä‘á»ƒ n&acirc;ng cao nháº­n thá»©c hÆ¡n vá» ná»n táº£ng n&agrave;y v&agrave; thu h&uacute;t má»™t sá»‘ lÆ°á»£ng lá»›n hÆ¡n c&aacute;c c&ocirc;ng ty tÆ° nh&acirc;n tham gia cuá»™c chiáº¿n chá»‘ng láº¡i r&aacute;c nhá»±a biá»ƒn.
Event Details
Date: Friday, 1 April 2022 Time: 9 AM - 11 AM (Jakarta time, UTC+7)) RSVP:&nbsp; https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107
NG&Agrave;Y V&Agrave; GIá»œ
April 1st 2022, 09:00-11:00, Hanoi time (GMT+7)Ng&agrave;y 01 th&aacute;ng 4 nÄƒm 2022, 09: 00-11: 00, giá» H&agrave; Ná»™i (GMT + 7)RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/epr-for-plastics-in-viet-nam-challenges-and-opportunities-tickets-294413969107&nbsp;
Webinar Agenda
Hosted by the RKC-MPD of ERIA and VASI, the Webinar will last 2 hours via Zoom platform with a moderated panel discussion.




TIME


AGENDA&nbsp;




9 AM &ndash; 9:15 AM


Start of Webinar by MC Ms Ellen Putri Edita (ERIA)
Welcome Remarks:

Mr Michikazu Kojima, Senior Advisor to ERIA
Mr Pham Thu Hang, Deputy Director-General, Vietnam Administration of Seas and Islands (VASI)

NgÆ°á»i dáº«n chÆ°Æ¡ng tr&igrave;nh: C&ocirc; Ellen Putri Edita (ERIA)Ch&agrave;o má»«ng c&aacute;c Ä‘áº¡i biá»ƒu v&agrave; báº¯t Ä‘áº§u Há»™i tháº£oPh&aacute;t biá»ƒu khai máº¡c:&bull; &Ocirc;ng Michikazu Kojima, TÆ° váº¥n cáº¥p cao, RKC-MPD, ERIA&bull; L&atilde;nh Ä‘áº¡o Tá»•ng cá»¥c Biá»ƒn v&agrave; Háº£i Ä‘áº£o Viá»‡t Nam

 .scitsalp eniram tsniaga thgif eht nioj ot seinapmoc etavirp fo rebmun regral a tcartta dna mroftalp eht fo ssenerawa erom esiar ot ,seinapmoc etavirp eht ot ylralucitrap ,cilbup eht ot )PSP( mroftalP rotceS etavirP eht ecudortnier lliw DPM-CKR .emehcs RPE wen eht noitaredisnoc otni gnikat yllaicepse ,sirbed citsalp eniram dna etsaw citsalp gnittabmoc ot etubirtnoc nac seinapmoc etavirp syaw ynam eht ssucsid dna edam ssergorp eht ekatkcots ot maN teiV ni gnitarepo sessenisub lanoitanretni dna ,seinapmoc etavirp esemanteiV ,ecnailla ssenisub esemanteiV a ,maN teiV fo )ERNOM( tnemnorivnE dna secruoseR larutaN fo yrtsiniM ,)ISAV( sdnalsI dna saeS fo noitartsinimdA manteiV rof noisacco na eb lliw murof ehT
.y;evarga&n hn;evargi&rt ;etucaa&uq gnort hn;etucai&hc nauq n;crice&il n;crice&b ;evarga&l ½ºás ,n;crica&hn °Æt c±»áv uhk i›»áv n­ºául o£ºáht c™»áuc t™»ám o;evarga&v aig maht hc;etucaa&c gn±ºáb maN t‡»áiV i¡ºát a±»áhn i›»áv i‘»á‘Ä RPE n‡»áih c±»áht ƒ»á‘Ä ¿ºáhc n¡ºáh ;evarga&v i™»áh ¡Æc gn¯»áhn »át gn;etucaa&s m;evarga&l ½ºás )ERNOM( gn»á°Ært i;crico&M ;evarga&v n;crice&yugn i;evarga&T ™»áB a§»ác )ISAV( maN t‡»áiV o£ºá‘Ä i£ºáH ;evarga&v nƒ»áiB c¥»ác gn•»áT i›»áv p£»áh i‘»áhp AIRE a§»ác DPM-CKR
.ssecorp eht ni redlohekats yek eht eb lliw ohw ,rotces etavirp eht htiw noissucsid a ni gnigagne yb maN teiV ni scitsalp no RPE tnemelpmi ot stniartsnoc dna seitinutroppo eht no thgil dehs lliw ,)ERNOM( tnemnorivnE dna secruoseR larutaN fo yrtsiniM eht fo )ISAV( sdnalsI dna saeS fo noitartsinimdA manteiV eht htiw noitaroballoc ni ,)DPM-CKR( sirbeD citsalP eniraM rof ertneC egdelwonK lanoigeR s;ouqsr&AIRE
.aig c‘»áuq i›»áv i‘»á‘Ä i›»át p¯ºás c©»áht hc;etucaa&ht gn¯»áhn ;evarga&l ½ºás gn»á°Ært i;crico&m n¿ºá‘Ä c±»ác hc;etucai&t gn™»á‘Ä c;etucaa&t gn¯»áhn ar o¡ºát ;evarga&v y;evarga&n hc;etucaa&s hn;etucai&hc £ºáuq u‡»áih n‡»áih c±»áht ƒ»á‘Ä o;evarga&n ¿ºáht m;evarga&L .gn;etucau&hc a§»ác i»á‘Ä gn;evargo&v gnort »áb i£ºáht n¡ºáo‘Ä iaig n¿ºá‘Ä ohc m‡»áihn hc;etucaa&rt u‹»áhc n;evargo&c ;evarga&m ;etucao&‘Ä gn;evarga&h t·ºám gn¯»áhn t¥ºáux n£ºás m‡»áihn hc;etucaa&rt u‹»áhc ‰»áhc gn;crico&hk ½ºás t¥ºáux n£ºás ;evarga&hn c;etucaa&c ,RPE c¯ºát n;crice&yugn c;etucaa&c oehT .a±»áhn gn;evarga&m ;evarga&v a±»áhn yahk ,CVP ,PSP ,SPE ,TEP iahc m“»ág oab a±»áhn ;evargi&b oab hnaod hnik gn™»á‘Ä t¡ºáoh n¿ºá‘Ä gn™»á‘Ä c;etucaa&t ½ºás ,2202 mƒÄn 10 gn;etucaa&ht o;evarga&v c±»ál u‡»áih ;etucao&c i›»ám )RPE( t¥ºáux n£ºás ;evarga&hn a§»ác gn™»ár Ÿ»ám m‡»áihn hc;etucaa&rt n­ºác p¿ºáit p;etucaa&hp gn¡Æ°Æhp ,maN t‡»áiV i¡ºáT .);ouqdr&n“»áugn ¡ºáh;ouqdl& ;evarga&l i»ág c£»á°Æ‘Ä( i£ºáht t¥ºáhc ;etucay&l n£ºáuq ;evarga&v ¿ºáhc i;etucaa&t n¿ºá‘Ä );ouqdr&n“»áugn gn£»á°Æht;ouqdl& ;evarga&l i»ág c£»á°Æ‘Ä( gn;evargu&d u;crice&it ;evarga&v t¥ºáux n£ºás ™»á‘Ä p¥ºác £ºác m“»ág oab ƒ»áht ;etucao&c »áh a§»ác c±»ál —»án gn¯»áhN .c±»áv uhk gnort nƒ»áib a±»áhn c;etucaa&r m£ºáig ;evarga&v a±»áhn i£ºáht c;etucaa&r uƒ»áiht m£ºáig c‡»áiv o;evarga&v ƒ»ák gn;etucaa&‘Ä p;etucao&g gn;etucao&‘Ä gna‘Ä ;evarga&v ;edlita&‘Ä 3 + NAESA c›»á°Æn c;etucaa&c i¡ºát n;crica&hn °Æt c±»áv uhk ,¿ºát c±»áht n;crice&rT
.yrtnuoc eht rof segnellahc gnimocpu eht eb lliw tnemnorivne eht no stcapmi evitisop etaerc dna ycilop siht tnemelpmi ylevitceffe ot woH .elcyc efil rieht fo egats etsaw eht litnu elbisnopser dleh eb lliw tub seitidommoc hcus ecudorp ot ylno ton egrahc ni eb lliw srecudorp ,selpicnirp RPE eht ot gnidroccA .mlif dna ,yart reniatnoc citsalp ,CVP ,PSP ,SPE ,elttob TEP gnidulcni gnigakcap citsalp no snoitarepo ssenisub tcapmi lliw hcihw ,2202 yraunaJ ni tceffe otni emoc sah hcaorppa )RPE( ytilibisnopser ;ouqsr&srecudorp dednetxe wen eht ,maN teiV nI .level );ouqdr&maertsnwod;ouqdl& dellac-os( tnemeganam etsaw dna gnilcycer ot level );ouqdr&maertspu;ouqdl& dellac-os( noitpmusnoc dna noitcudorp htob morf egnar nac stroffe riehT .noiger eht ni sirbed citsalp eniram ecneuqesnoc yb dna etsaw citsalp fo noitcuder eht ot yltnacifingis gnitubirtnoc neeb evah seirtnuoc 3+NAESA ni rotces etavirp ehT
seires tneve enilno - scitsalP eniraM ecudeR ot sevitaitinI rotceS etavirP 3+NAESA seitinutroppO dna segnellahC :maN teiV ni scitsalP rof RPE seitinutroppO dna segnellahC :maN teiV ni scitsalP rof RPE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-03-10 14:25:50";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-03-31 13:17:21";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:19:"hera.diani@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:23;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"12175";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6641";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:42:"the-future-of-education-and-skills-in-asia";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:42:"The Future of Education and Skills in Asia";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-03-10";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"3";s:7:"content";s:5565:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/The-Future-of-Education-%26-Skills-in-Asia_cover_800x408.png" alt="" width="800" height="408" /></p><p>The robust technological innovation has transformed a new pathway in the education ecosystem. New skills are required to compete in the current 4IR industry and development. Building the future of education systems requires the curricula as a solid foundation to foster the creation of new skills and abilities in the 4IR industry. In ensuring inclusion and equity in education, it is important to engage with the underprivileged, gender equality, and disability.&nbsp;</p><p>ERIA in partnership with The Asian Network will host a virtual conference on&nbsp;<em>&lsquo;The Future of Education and Skills in Asia&rsquo;</em>&nbsp;on March 10th, 2022. This virtual conference will gather 12 Leaders from Asia (Cambodia, Japan, India, Indonesia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam) sharing their expertise in Education, Entrepreneurship, Skills, and Technology for Good.</p><p>H.E Hang Chuon Naron, Minister of Education, Youths and Sports of Cambodia; Mrs Sofia Shakil, Director Economic programs of The Asia Foundation; Mrs Mariagrazia Squicciarini, Chief of Executive Office Social and Human Sciences Sector of UNESCO; Mrs Yuri Obara Belfali, Head of Early Childhood and Schools of OECD will also deliver special remarks in this virtual conference.&nbsp;</p><h2>Event Details</h2><ul><li>Date: Thursday, 10&nbsp;March 2022</li><li>Time: 2 PM- 6 PM (Jakarta time, UTC+7))</li><li>RSVP:&nbsp;<a style="width: 175px;"><p>5:00 PM- 5:45 PM</p></td><td style="width: 296.297px;"><p>ASEAN Chairmanship What Role to Play in the Education</p></td><td style="width: 274.703px;"><p><strong>Opening remarks</strong>: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hangchuon_Naron">H.E Hang Chuon Naron</a>, &nbsp;Minister of Education, Youths and Sports of Cambodia</p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Ravindra Ngo</span>, Founder of the Asian Network (Cambodia)</li><li><span style="text-decoration: title="Register to attend this event" href="https://www.runtheworld.today/app/c/education_skills_asia" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:26:"ERIA and the Asian Network";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-03-10";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2022-03-10";s:8:"keywords";s:6753:"The Future of Education and Skills in Asia The Future of Education and Skills in Asia The robust technological innovation has transformed a new pathway in the education ecosystem. New skills are required to compete in the current 4IR industry and development. Building the future of education systems requires the curricula as a solid foundation to foster the creation of new skills and abilities in the 4IR industry. In ensuring inclusion and equity in education, it is important to engage with the underprivileged, gender equality, and disability.&nbsp;
ERIA in partnership with The Asian Network will host a virtual conference on&nbsp;&lsquo;The Future of Education and Skills in Asia&rsquo;&nbsp;on March 10th, 2022. This virtual conference will gather 12 Leaders from Asia (Cambodia, Japan, India, Indonesia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam) sharing their expertise in Education, Entrepreneurship, Skills, and Technology for Good.
H.E Hang Chuon Naron, Minister of Education, Youths and Sports of Cambodia; Mrs Sofia Shakil, Director Economic programs of The Asia Foundation; Mrs Mariagrazia Squicciarini, Chief of Executive Office Social and Human Sciences Sector of UNESCO; Mrs Yuri Obara Belfali, Head of Early Childhood and Schools of OECD will also deliver special remarks in this virtual conference.&nbsp;
Event Details

Date: Thursday, 10&nbsp;March 2022
Time: 2 PM- 6 PM (Jakarta time, UTC+7))
RSVP:&nbsp;https://www.runtheworld.today/app/c/education_skills_asia

Agenda




Time (UTC+7)


Agenda


Speakers




2:00 PM- 2:45 PM


Session 1: Ensuring Inclusion and Equity in Education


Opening remarks: Sofia Shakil, Director Economic programs at The Asia Foundation
Speakers:

Sumit Argawal, Founder PR Signal (India)
Sorawit Paiboonrattanakorn, Founder Saturday School (Thailand)
Angela Chen, Co-Founder at Eskwelabs (Philippines)

Moderated by Rubeena Singh




3:00 PM- 3:45 PM


Session 2: Education and Skills- What Are the Right Skills to Have in the Future?


Opening remarks: Mariagrazia Squicciarini, Chief of Executive Office at UNESCO
Speakers:

Tippi Fernandez, COO &amp; Co-founder at Bagosphere (Philippines)
Alina Amir, CEO &amp; Co-founder Arus Academy (Malaysia)
Jessada Salathong, Chairperson MA in strategic communication &amp; Lecturer Chulalongkorn University (Thailand)
Linh Hoang, Co-Founder Ready to Lead (Viet Nam)

Moderated by Giulia Ajmone Marsan




4:00 PM &ndash; 4:45 PM


The Future of Education in Asia: Challenges and Opportunities


Opening remarks: Yuri Obara Belfali, Head of early childhood and schools at OECD

Su Fen Cheong, Founder PreSchool market (Singapore)
Neelesh Batia Co- Founder &amp; CEO Akadasia (Singapore)
Cheryl Ann Fernando, CEO Pemimpin (Malaysia)

Moderated by Ravindra Ngo




5:00 PM- 5:45 PM


ASEAN Chairmanship What Role to Play in the Education


Opening remarks: H.E Hang Chuon Naron, &nbsp;Minister of Education, Youths and Sports of Cambodia
Speakers:

Ravindra Ngo, Founder of the Asian Network (Cambodia)
Cheryl Ann Fernando, CEO Pemimpin (Malaysia)
Vannarith Chheang, President AVI (Cambodia)

Moderated by Giulia Ajmone Marsan

;psbn&.ecnerefnoc lautriv siht ni skramer laiceps reviled osla lliw DCEO fo sloohcS dna doohdlihC ylraE fo daeH ,ilafleB arabO iruY srM ;OCSENU fo rotceS secneicS namuH dna laicoS eciffO evitucexE fo feihC ,iniraicciuqS aizargairaM srM ;noitadnuoF aisA ehT fo smargorp cimonocE rotceriD ,likahS aifoS srM ;aidobmaC fo stropS dna shtuoY ,noitacudE fo retsiniM ,noraN nouhC gnaH E.H
.dooG rof ygolonhceT dna ,sllikS ,pihsruenerpertnE ,noitacudE ni esitrepxe rieht gnirahs )manteiV dna ,dnaliahT ,eropagniS ,senippilihP ,aisenodnI ,aidnI ,napaJ ,aidobmaC( aisA morf sredaeL 21 rehtag lliw ecnerefnoc lautriv sihT .2202 ,ht01 hcraM no;psbn&;ouqsr&aisA ni sllikS dna noitacudE fo erutuF ehT;ouqsl&;psbn&no ecnerefnoc lautriv a tsoh lliw krowteN naisA ehT htiw pihsrentrap ni AIRE
;psbn&.ytilibasid dna ,ytilauqe redneg ,degelivirprednu eht htiw egagne ot tnatropmi si ti ,noitacude ni ytiuqe dna noisulcni gnirusne nI .yrtsudni RI4 eht ni seitiliba dna slliks wen fo noitaerc eht retsof ot noitadnuof dilos a sa alucirruc eht seriuqer smetsys noitacude fo erutuf eht gnidliuB .tnempoleved dna yrtsudni RI4 tnerruc eht ni etepmoc ot deriuqer era slliks weN .metsysoce noitacude eht ni yawhtap wen a demrofsnart sah noitavonni lacigolonhcet tsubor ehT aisA ni sllikS dna noitacudE fo erutuF ehT aisA ni sllikS dna noitacudE fo erutuF ehT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-03-01 15:12:09";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-03-07 09:16:40";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:24;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"12002";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6606";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:111:"unpacking-the-rcep-agreement-public-private-dialogue-2-the-rcep-rules-of-origin-and-what-they-mean-for-cambodia";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:113:"Unpacking the RCEP Agreement, Public-Private Dialogue 2: The RCEP Rules of Origin and What They Mean for Cambodia";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-02-10";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"2";s:7:"content";s:3695:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/2022-January-10-RCEP-Rules-of-Origin-PPD-Photo-flyer.png" alt="" width="800" height="450" /></p><p>The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) marks the establishment of a free trade agreement amongst 15 states. RCEP will create new business opportunities and change the shape of trade in the region.</p><p>ERIA&rsquo;s Capacity Building Programme is organising a series of five Public-Private Dialogues, &#039;Unpacking the RCEP Agreement&#039;. Dialogue 2 will discuss the Rules of Origin that determines which goods originate from RCEP member countries, so can benefit from preferential tariff treatment. As RCEP consolidates ROO by making it easier for exporters to cumulate and rely on a single proof of origin, it will also facilitates the cross-border trade and speeds up delivery amongst RCEP countries. Glean insights together with our distinguished panel of speakers.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Thursday, 10 February 2022, 9 AM&nbsp;&ndash; 11 AM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><h2>Agenda (as of 8 February 2022)</h2><table style="width: 616px;"><tr><td style="width: 106.556px;"><p>9:00 &ndash; 9:10</p></td><td style="width: 494.444px;"><p><strong>Opening Remarks: </strong></p><p>H.E. SIM Sokheng, Secretary of State, Ministry of Commerce</p><p>Mr. Jeremy Gross, Director of Capacity Building, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 106.556px;"><p>9:10 - 09:40</p></td><td style="width: 494.444px;"><p><strong>Session 1: Setting the scene: The RCEP Rules of Origin Provisions</strong></p><p><strong>Moderator: </strong>Mr. Sven Callebaut, International Trade and E-Trade Adviser</p><p><strong>Presenters:</strong></p><ul><li>Ms. Deborah Elms,&nbsp;Executive Director, Asian Trade Centre</li><li>Mr UN Chantha, Director of Export Import Department, Ministry of Commerce</li></ul><p>&nbsp;Q&amp;A with the audience.</p><p>This session will provide a precise description of what the RCEP provisions are and whether Cambodia&rsquo;s legal and regulatory system is fit-for-purpose.</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 106.556px;"><p>09:40 &ndash; 10:30</p></td><td style="width: 494.444px;"><p><strong>Session 2: Private sector perspectives on opportunities for Cambodia in RCEP</strong></p><p><strong>Moderator:&nbsp;</strong>Mr Jeremy Gross, Director of Capacity Building, ERIA.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Panelists:</strong></p><ul><li>Mr Clint O&rsquo;Connell, Partner and Head of Tax and Customs, DFDL</li><li>Mr Robin Flint, First Secretary, Australian Embassy in Cambodia (currently seconded to MoC Cambodia)</li></ul><p>Q&amp;A with the audience. This session will enable different business interests to assess their level of preparedness and understanding of how the RCEP agreement could be a game changer in their industry.&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 106.556px;"><p>10.30-10:45</p></td><td style="width: 494.444px;"><p><strong>Session 3: Summary of discussions and key items of a continued Public-Private Dialogue on The RCEP Rules of Origin and What They Mean for Cambodia </strong></p><p><strong>By</strong>: HE SOK Siphana, Senior Advisor to the Royal Government of Cambodia</p><p>Q&amp;A with the audience.</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 106.556px;"><p>10:45 &ndash; 11:00</p></td><td style="width: 494.444px;"><p><strong>Closing remarks by ERIA </strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-rcep-rules-of-origin-and-what-they-mean-for-cambodia-tickets-256571340787" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-02-10";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:5923:"Unpacking the RCEP Agreement, Public-Private Dialogue 2: The RCEP Rules of Origin and What They Mean for Cambodia Unpacking the RCEP Agreement, Public-Private Dialogue 2: The RCEP Rules of Origin and What They Mean for Cambodia The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) marks the establishment of a free trade agreement amongst 15 states. RCEP will create new business opportunities and change the shape of trade in the region.
ERIA&rsquo;s Capacity Building Programme is organising a series of five Public-Private Dialogues, 'Unpacking the RCEP Agreement'. Dialogue 2 will discuss the Rules of Origin that determines which goods originate from RCEP member countries, so can benefit from preferential tariff treatment. As RCEP consolidates ROO by making it easier for exporters to cumulate and rely on a single proof of origin, it will also facilitates the cross-border trade and speeds up delivery amongst RCEP countries. Glean insights together with our distinguished panel of speakers.&nbsp;
Date and Time:
Thursday, 10 February 2022, 9 AM&nbsp;&ndash; 11 AM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda (as of 8 February 2022)




9:00 &ndash; 9:10


Opening Remarks: 
H.E. SIM Sokheng, Secretary of State, Ministry of Commerce
Mr. Jeremy Gross, Director of Capacity Building, ERIA




9:10 - 09:40


Session 1: Setting the scene: The RCEP Rules of Origin Provisions
Moderator: Mr. Sven Callebaut, International Trade and E-Trade Adviser
Presenters:

Ms. Deborah Elms,&nbsp;Executive Director, Asian Trade Centre
Mr UN Chantha, Director of Export Import Department, Ministry of Commerce

&nbsp;Q&amp;A with the audience.
This session will provide a precise description of what the RCEP provisions are and whether Cambodia&rsquo;s legal and regulatory system is fit-for-purpose.




09:40 &ndash; 10:30


Session 2: Private sector perspectives on opportunities for Cambodia in RCEP
Moderator:&nbsp;Mr Jeremy Gross, Director of Capacity Building, ERIA.&nbsp;
Panelists:

Mr Clint O&rsquo;Connell, Partner and Head of Tax and Customs, DFDL
Mr Robin Flint, First Secretary, Australian Embassy in Cambodia (currently seconded to MoC Cambodia)

Q&amp;A with the audience. This session will enable different business interests to assess their level of preparedness and understanding of how the RCEP agreement could be a game changer in their industry.&nbsp;




10.30-10:45


Session 3: Summary of discussions and key items of a continued Public-Private Dialogue on The RCEP Rules of Origin and What They Mean for Cambodia 
By: HE SOK Siphana, Senior Advisor to the Royal Government of Cambodia
Q&amp;A with the audience.




10:45 &ndash; 11:00


Closing remarks by ERIA

;psbn&.srekaeps fo lenap dehsiugnitsid ruo htiw rehtegot sthgisni naelG .seirtnuoc PECR tsgnoma yreviled pu sdeeps dna edart redrob-ssorc eht setatilicaf osla lliw ti ,nigiro fo foorp elgnis a no yler dna etalumuc ot sretropxe rof reisae ti gnikam yb OOR setadilosnoc PECR sA .tnemtaert ffirat laitnereferp morf tifeneb nac os ,seirtnuoc rebmem PECR morf etanigiro sdoog hcihw senimreted taht nigirO fo seluR eht ssucsid lliw 2 eugolaiD .'tnemeergA PECR eht gnikcapnU' ,seugolaiD etavirP-cilbuP evif fo seires a gnisinagro si emmargorP gnidliuB yticapaC s;ouqsr&AIRE
.noiger eht ni edart fo epahs eht egnahc dna seitinutroppo ssenisub wen etaerc lliw PECR .setats 51 tsgnoma tnemeerga edart eerf a fo tnemhsilbatse eht skram )PECR( pihsrentraP cimonocE evisneherpmoC etavirP-cilbuP ,tnemeergA PECR eht gnikcapnU";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-01-27 11:08:10";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-02-09 19:12:21";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"16";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:25;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11947";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6602";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:146:"oecd-eria-high-level-event-on-gearing-up-for-a-post-pandemic-world-designing-policies-for-an-innovative-and-sustainable-recovery-in-southeast-asia";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:147:"OECD-ERIA High-Level Event on Gearing up for a Post-Pandemic World: Designing Policies for an Innovative and Sustainable Recovery in Southeast Asia";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-02-08";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"2";s:7:"content";s:2432:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/2022_Feb_Flyer_OECD_ERIA_1.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p>Amid a global context of recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic, countries, industries and firms are faced with the intensification of two core transformational trends to society: on the one hand, the increased adoption of digital technologies can be key to spurring a leap in aggregate productivity and promoting the catch-up of actors that were previously lagging behind. On the other, it has become clear that innovation and systemic change will be crucial in confronting the challenge of climate change and achieving carbon neutrality for sustainable long-term economic growth. Governments can play a decisive role in designing industry, innovation and entrepreneurship policy mixes that allow firms to better navigate and thrive during these transitions.</p><p>The objective of this high-level panel is to approach these pressing questions with and among regional stakeholders in Southeast Asia. The discussion of recent analysis from OECD, ERIA, and partner organisations will also serve as a channel to gather feedback and ideas from actors in the region on the mechanisms that may help boost productivity, digital technology diffusion and integration of global value chains (GVCs) across Southeast Asia.</p><p><strong>Speakers</strong>:</p><ul><li><strong>Jaehan Cho </strong>(Director, Innovative Growth Policy Division, Korea Institute for Industrial Economics and Trade)</li><li><strong>Venkatachalam Anbumozhi</strong> (Director of Research Strategy and Innovation)</li><li><strong>Julia Tijaja</strong> (Former Director of ASEAN Integration Monitoring at the ASEAN Secretariat)</li><li><strong>Siah Hwee Ang</strong> (Professor of International Business and Strategy and Director of Southeast Asia Centre of Asia-Pacific Excellence, Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand)</li></ul><p>Moderator: <strong>Chiara Criscuolo </strong>(Head, Productivity, Innovation and Entrepreneurship Division, OECD)</p><p><strong>Date, time :</strong></p><p>Tuesday, 8 February 2022, 2 PM - 3:30 PM (Jakarta time, UTC +7)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="/uploads/media/Events/2022_Feb_Agenda-OECD-ERIA.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">AGENDA</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://meetoecd1.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_si1IoUnDSguNiBW5nhG9pQ" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER HERE</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:9:"OECD-ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-02-08";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4571:"OECD-ERIA High-Level Event on Gearing up for a Post-Pandemic World: Designing Policies for an Innovative and Sustainable Recovery in Southeast Asia OECD-ERIA High-Level Event on Gearing up for a Post-Pandemic World: Designing Policies for an Innovative and Sustainable Recovery in Southeast Asia Amid a global context of recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic, countries, industries and firms are faced with the intensification of two core transformational trends to society: on the one hand, the increased adoption of digital technologies can be key to spurring a leap in aggregate productivity and promoting the catch-up of actors that were previously lagging behind. On the other, it has become clear that innovation and systemic change will be crucial in confronting the challenge of climate change and achieving carbon neutrality for sustainable long-term economic growth. Governments can play a decisive role in designing industry, innovation and entrepreneurship policy mixes that allow firms to better navigate and thrive during these transitions.
The objective of this high-level panel is to approach these pressing questions with and among regional stakeholders in Southeast Asia. The discussion of recent analysis from OECD, ERIA, and partner organisations will also serve as a channel to gather feedback and ideas from actors in the region on the mechanisms that may help boost productivity, digital technology diffusion and integration of global value chains (GVCs) across Southeast Asia.
Speakers:

Jaehan Cho (Director, Innovative Growth Policy Division, Korea Institute for Industrial Economics and Trade)
Venkatachalam Anbumozhi (Director of Research Strategy and Innovation)
Julia Tijaja (Former Director of ASEAN Integration Monitoring at the ASEAN Secretariat)
Siah Hwee Ang (Professor of International Business and Strategy and Director of Southeast Asia Centre of Asia-Pacific Excellence, Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand)

Moderator: Chiara Criscuolo (Head, Productivity, Innovation and Entrepreneurship Division, OECD)
Date, time :
Tuesday, 8 February 2022, 2 PM - 3:30 PM (Jakarta time, UTC +7)
AGENDA
REGISTER HERE       Virtual Room Ms Lina Maulidina lina.maulidina@eria.org  OECD-ERIA 2022-02-08 0000-00-00 2022-02-08 8 February 2022 2202 yraurbeF 8 80-20-2202 00-00-0000 80-20-2202 AIRE-DCEO  gro.aire@anidiluam.anil anidiluaM aniL sM mooR lautriV       EREH RETSIGER
ADNEGA
)7+ CTU ,emit atrakaJ( MP 03:3 - MP 2 ,2202 yraurbeF 8 ,yadseuT
: emit ,etaD
)DCEO ,noisiviD pihsruenerpertnE dna noitavonnI ,ytivitcudorP ,daeH( oloucsirC araihC :rotaredoM

)dnalaeZ weN ,notgnilleW fo ytisrevinU airotciV ,ecnellecxE cificaP-aisA fo ertneC aisA tsaehtuoS fo rotceriD dna ygetartS dna ssenisuB lanoitanretnI fo rosseforP( gnA eewH haiS
)tairaterceS NAESA eht ta gnirotinoM noitargetnI NAESA fo rotceriD remroF( ajajiT ailuJ
)noitavonnI dna ygetartS hcraeseR fo rotceriD( ihzomubnA malahcatakneV
)edarT dna scimonocE lairtsudnI rof etutitsnI aeroK ,noisiviD yciloP htworG evitavonnI ,rotceriD( ohC naheaJ

:srekaepS
.aisA tsaehtuoS ssorca )sCVG( sniahc eulav labolg fo noitargetni dna noisuffid ygolonhcet latigid ,ytivitcudorp tsoob pleh yam taht smsinahcem eht no noiger eht ni srotca morf saedi dna kcabdeef rehtag ot lennahc a sa evres osla lliw snoitasinagro rentrap dna ,AIRE ,DCEO morf sisylana tnecer fo noissucsid ehT .aisA tsaehtuoS ni sredlohekats lanoiger gnoma dna htiw snoitseuq gnisserp eseht hcaorppa ot si lenap level-hgih siht fo evitcejbo ehT
.snoitisnart eseht gnirud evirht dna etagivan retteb ot smrif wolla taht sexim ycilop pihsruenerpertne dna noitavonni ,yrtsudni gningised ni elor evisiced a yalp nac stnemnrevoG .htworg cimonoce mret-gnol elbaniatsus rof ytilartuen nobrac gniveihca dna egnahc etamilc fo egnellahc eht gnitnorfnoc ni laicurc eb lliw egnahc cimetsys dna noitavonni taht raelc emoceb sah ti ,rehto eht nO .dniheb gniggal ylsuoiverp erew taht srotca fo pu-hctac eht gnitomorp dna ytivitcudorp etagergga ni pael a gnirrups ot yek eb nac seigolonhcet latigid fo noitpoda desaercni eht ,dnah eno eht no :yteicos ot sdnert lanoitamrofsnart eroc owt fo noitacifisnetni eht htiw decaf era smrif dna seirtsudni ,seirtnuoc ,cimednap 91-DIVOC eht morf yrevocer fo txetnoc labolg a dimA aisA tsaehtuoS ni yrevoceR elbaniatsuS dna evitavonnI na rof seiciloP gningiseD :dlroW cimednaP-tsoP a rof pu gniraeG no tnevE leveL-hgiH AIRE-DCEO aisA tsaehtuoS ni yrevoceR elbaniatsuS dna evitavonnI na rof seiciloP gningiseD :dlroW cimednaP-tsoP a rof pu gniraeG no tnevE leveL-hgiH AIRE-DCEO";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-01-25 09:35:30";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-02-02 09:53:19";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:26;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11918";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6594";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:46:"women-entrepreneurs-focusing-at-the-grassroots";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:47:"Women Entrepreneurs: Focusing at the Grassroots";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2022-01-27";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2022";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"1";s:7:"content";s:3517:"<p><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/2022_Jan_ERIA-CIIE.CO_Webinar_on_Women_Entrepreneurss.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p>ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series &ndash; Building Prolific Entrepreneurship Ecosystem in ASEAN with Insight from India -&nbsp;Episode #4</p><p>Rural women increasingly run their own enterprises, yet their socio-economic contributions and entrepreneurial potential remain largely unrecognized and untapped. For many rural women in India and ASEAN, entrepreneurship is part of a broader livelihood strategy, however, they&rsquo;re faced with pivotal barriers from access to resources, limited social and legal protection, to difficulties in entering new and lucrative markets to expand their businesses.</p><p>With the 4th episode of ERIA-CIIE.CO online discussion, we aim to introduce the Indian and ASEAN women entrepreneurship ecosystems to various stakeholders in the region, from the emerging social enterprise, startup &amp; incubator as well as policy. We will be focusing on key initiatives and challenges in the ecosystem for rural women entrepreneurs and sharing inspired ideas that leverage the livelihood/women economy and entrepreneurship in rural areas.</p><p>Join us as we discuss women entrepreneurs; focusing on rural women empowerment!</p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="/uploads/media/Events/2022_Jan_ERIA-CIIE.CO_Webinar_on_Women_Entrepreneurs.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CONCEPT NOTE</a></p><table style="width: 654px;"><tr><td style="border-color: #000000; Insight, CIIE.CO</p></td></tr><tr><td style="border-color: #000000; width: 197.542px;"><p>3:40 &ndash; 3:55 PM, IST or</p><p>5:10 &ndash; 5:25 PM, WIB</p></td><td style="border-color: #000000; width: 439.458px;"><p><strong>Q &amp; A</strong>&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td style="border-color: #000000; width: 197.542px;"><p>3:55 &ndash; 4:00 PM, IST or</p><p>5.25 &ndash; 5.30 PM, WIB</p></td><td style="border-color: #000000; width: 439.458px;"><p><strong>Closing Remarks and End of Webinar</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/women-entrepreneurs-focusing-at-the-grassroots-tickets-249093103177" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER HERE</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Amelia Litania";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-01-27";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4525:"Women Entrepreneurs: Focusing at the Grassroots Women Entrepreneurs: Focusing at the Grassroots ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series &ndash; Building Prolific Entrepreneurship Ecosystem in ASEAN with Insight from India -&nbsp;Episode #4
Rural women increasingly run their own enterprises, yet their socio-economic contributions and entrepreneurial potential remain largely unrecognized and untapped. For many rural women in India and ASEAN, entrepreneurship is part of a broader livelihood strategy, however, they&rsquo;re faced with pivotal barriers from access to resources, limited social and legal protection, to difficulties in entering new and lucrative markets to expand their businesses.
With the 4th episode of ERIA-CIIE.CO online discussion, we aim to introduce the Indian and ASEAN women entrepreneurship ecosystems to various stakeholders in the region, from the emerging social enterprise, startup &amp; incubator as well as policy. We will be focusing on key initiatives and challenges in the ecosystem for rural women entrepreneurs and sharing inspired ideas that leverage the livelihood/women economy and entrepreneurship in rural areas.
Join us as we discuss women entrepreneurs; focusing on rural women empowerment!
CONCEPT NOTE




TIME


AGENDA&nbsp;




&nbsp;2:30 &ndash;2:40 PM, IST or
4:00 &ndash; 4:10 PM, WIB


Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks
Giulia Ajmone Marsan
Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA&nbsp;




&nbsp;2:40 &ndash; 3:40 PM, IST or
4.10 &ndash; 5:10 PM, WIB


Panel Discussion 
Speakers:

Ajaita Shah,&nbsp;Founder and CEO of Frontier Markets, India
Chetna Sinha,&nbsp;Founder-Chairperson of the Mann Deshi Bank and Mann Deshi Foundation, India
Denica Riadini-Flesch,&nbsp;Founder and CEO of SukkhaCitta, Indonesia
Lida Loem,&nbsp;Co-founder and Technical Advisor at SHE Investments, Cambodia

Moderated by Trisha Ghoshal
Specialist &ndash; Insight, CIIE.CO




3:40 &ndash; 3:55 PM, IST or
5:10 &ndash; 5:25 PM, WIB


Q &amp; A&nbsp;




3:55 &ndash; 4:00 PM, IST or
5.25 &ndash; 5.30 PM, WIB


Closing Remarks and End of Webinar

What would be the state of Indonesia-Japan economic cooperation during the pandemic? What are the opportunities that can be seized together? What are the challenges? How does Japanese investment in the region help the economic recovery efforts? And how do we bring cooperation to the next chapter?&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Opening Remarks:</strong></p><ol><li>&nbsp;<strong>Dr Dino Patti Djalal</strong>&nbsp;&ndash; Founder and Chairman of Foreign Policy Community of Indonesia (FPCI)</li><li><strong>Prof Hidetoshi Nishimura&nbsp;</strong>&ndash; President of Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li><li>&nbsp;Mr&nbsp;<strong>M. Jakarta time) / 4 PM - 5.30 (UTC+9; Japan time)&nbsp;</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="Register via Eventbrite" href="https://bit.ly/nextAJCO" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p><p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/2022_Jan_The%20NextChapterofASEANandJapanEconomicCooperationinthePost-PandemicEraPOSTER2.png" alt="" width="800" height="1132" /></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:18:"Ms Isabella Italia";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2022-01-10";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4149:"The Next Chapter of ASEAN and Japan Economic Cooperation in the Post-Pandemic Era The Next Chapter of ASEAN and Japan Economic Cooperation in the Post-Pandemic Era Foreign Policy Community of Indonesia, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), the Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry of Japan (METI), and the ASEAN-METI Economic Cooperation Committee will convene a virtual public forum as a part of the Dialogue for Innovative and Sustainable Growth between Japan and ASEAN (DISG) titled 'The Next Chapter of ASEAN and Japan Economic Cooperation in the Post-Pandemic Era' on 10th of January 2022.  The public forum will discuss the next step of ASEAN-Japan economic cooperation. What would be the state of Indonesia-Japan economic cooperation during the pandemic? What are the opportunities that can be seized together? What are the challenges? How does Japanese investment in the region help the economic recovery efforts? And how do we bring cooperation to the next chapter?&nbsp;
Opening Remarks:

&nbsp;Dr Dino Patti Djalal&nbsp;&ndash; Founder and Chairman of Foreign Policy Community of Indonesia (FPCI)
Prof Hidetoshi Nishimura&nbsp;&ndash; President of Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)
&nbsp;Mr&nbsp;M. Arsjad Rasjid P.M.&nbsp;&ndash; Chair of Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (KADIN Indonesia)

Keynote Speech:
 H.E. KÅichi Hagiuda &ndash; Minister of Economy, Trade, and Industry of Japan
Speakers:

&nbsp;Prof Fukunari Kimura&nbsp;&ndash; Chief Economist of Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)
&nbsp;Dr Nuki Agya Utama&nbsp;&ndash; Executive Director of the ASEAN Centre for Energy (ACE)

Moderator:&nbsp;
Dr Dino Patti Djalal&nbsp;&ndash; Founder and Chairman of Foreign Policy Community of Indonesia (FPCI)  Date and Time:
Monday, 10 January 2021, 2 PM - 3:30&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta time) / 4 PM - 5.30 (UTC+9; Japan time)&nbsp;

fo retpahC txeN ehT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2022-01-04 15:19:46";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2022-01-10 16:24:33";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:24:"isabella.italia@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:28;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11558";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6519";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:77:"the-1st-conference-on-asian-inclusive-smart-cities-in-the-post-covid-19-arena";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:77:"The 1st Conference on Asian Inclusive Smart Cities in the Post Covid 19 Arena";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-24";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:948:"<p>At this international conference, we will discuss the vision of Asian smart cities of the post-COVID world. In many Asian regions where the demographic dividend has been disappearing, promoting top-down urban development is becoming obsolete. Rather, we think that making the metropolitan area that has accumulated history smarter from the bottom up by utilizing the Digital Transformation Technologies. At this conference, based on open democratic communication, we will discuss the idea, way of thinking, technology, and methodologies from various angles to realize an &ldquo;Asian smart city&rdquo; that includes various people with different cultures, religions, values, etc.</p><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>24 - 25 November 2021, 08:00 AM - 15:00 PM (WIB) or 10:00 AM - 17:00 PM (Japan Time)</p><h2><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/30n4YAl" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></h2>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:15:"ERIA Contact Us";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-24";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-25";s:8:"keywords";s:2123:"The 1st Conference on Asian Inclusive Smart Cities in the Post Covid 19 Arena The 1st Conference on Asian Inclusive Smart Cities in the Post Covid 19 Arena At this international conference, we will discuss the vision of Asian smart cities of the post-COVID world. In many Asian regions where the demographic dividend has been disappearing, promoting top-down urban development is becoming obsolete. Rather, we think that making the metropolitan area that has accumulated history smarter from the bottom up by utilizing the Digital Transformation Technologies. At this conference, based on open democratic communication, we will discuss the idea, way of thinking, technology, and methodologies from various angles to realize an &ldquo;Asian smart city&rdquo; that includes various people with different cultures, religions, values, etc.
Date and Time
24 - 25 November 2021, 08:00 AM - 15:00 PM (WIB) or 10:00 AM - 17:00 PM (Japan Time)

seitiC tramS evisulcnI naisA no ecnerefnoC ts1 ehT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-11-15 16:41:17";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-11-15 16:49:16";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:17:"contacus@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:29;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11546";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6511";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:125:"eria-webinar-series-10--entrepreneurship-start-ups-and-innovation-e-s-i-in-asean-and-east-asia-for-the-post-pandemic-recovery";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:131:"ERIA Webinar Series #10- 'Entrepreneurship, Start-Ups and Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for the Post-Pandemic Recovery'";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-25";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:2731:"<p><strong><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/2021-Nov-ESI-10-v1.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></strong></p><p><strong>Episode #10: </strong><strong>Fostering Next-Gen Entrepreneurs and Innovators &ndash; 2021 In Retrospect: Looking Back and Empowered Forward</strong></p><p>Throughout this series on Entrepreneurship, Startups and Innovation (E-S-I), it has been evident that the vibrancy of these ecosystems are crucial for economic recovery and growth beyond the pandemic. Of great importance is the continued partnership between the public sector, educational institutions and the private sector. &nbsp;</p><p>The ongoing development of entrepreneurial skills and mindsets, the curation of safety nets to encourage creativity and innovation, these are just some of the required ingredients to the fostering of next generation entrepreneurs and innovators.Join us in conversation to get inspired and glean insight from our 5 speakers in this series finale.&nbsp;</p><table><tr><td width="141"><p><strong>TIME</strong></p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>AGENDA</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td width="141"><p>2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM</p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Giulia Ajmone Marsan</strong></p><p>Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td width="141"><p>2:05 &ndash; 3:00 PM</p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>Panel Discussion </strong></p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Pranpreya Sriwannawit Lundberg,&nbsp;</strong>Policy Specialist. Office of National Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation Policy Council (NXPO), Thailand</li><li><strong>Yukako Idehara,&nbsp;</strong>Planning and Coordination Manager, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li><li><strong>Adam Corrall,&nbsp;</strong>General Manager, Asia, Australasian Premium Partners, Vietnam</li><li><strong>Agata Zborowska,&nbsp;</strong>Chief Operating Officer, ConceptionX, United Kingdom</li><li><strong>Ji Eun Chung,&nbsp;</strong>Chief Executive Officer, CODIT, Republic of Korea</li></ul><p>Moderated by OOI Tiat Jin (TJ)</p><p>Founder &amp; Principal Consultant, Curated Connectors, Singapore</p></td></tr><tr><td width="141"><p>3:00 &ndash; 3:10 PM</p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>Q &amp; A</strong></p><p>Moderated by Lina Maulidina Sabrina</p><p>Programme Officer, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td width="141"><p>3:10 &ndash; 3:15 PM</p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>Closing Remarks and End of Webinar</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://bit.ly/3kuh1SW" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:4:"ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-25";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-25";s:8:"keywords";s:4473:"ERIA Webinar Series #10- 'Entrepreneurship, Start-Ups and Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for the Post-Pandemic Recovery' ERIA Webinar Series #10- 'Entrepreneurship, Start-Ups and Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for the Post-Pandemic Recovery' Episode #10: Fostering Next-Gen Entrepreneurs and Innovators &ndash; 2021 In Retrospect: Looking Back and Empowered Forward
Throughout this series on Entrepreneurship, Startups and Innovation (E-S-I), it has been evident that the vibrancy of these ecosystems are crucial for economic recovery and growth beyond the pandemic. Of great importance is the continued partnership between the public sector, educational institutions and the private sector. &nbsp;
The ongoing development of entrepreneurial skills and mindsets, the curation of safety nets to encourage creativity and innovation, these are just some of the required ingredients to the fostering of next generation entrepreneurs and innovators.Join us in conversation to get inspired and glean insight from our 5 speakers in this series finale.&nbsp;




TIME


AGENDA
&nbsp;




2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM


Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks
&nbsp;
Giulia Ajmone Marsan
Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA




2:05 &ndash; 3:00 PM


Panel Discussion 
Speakers:

Pranpreya Sriwannawit Lundberg,&nbsp;Policy Specialist. Office of National Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation Policy Council (NXPO), Thailand
Yukako Idehara,&nbsp;Planning and Coordination Manager, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)
Adam Corrall,&nbsp;General Manager, Asia, Australasian Premium Partners, Vietnam
Agata Zborowska,&nbsp;Chief Operating Officer, ConceptionX, United Kingdom
Ji Eun Chung,&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer, CODIT, Republic of Korea

Moderated by OOI Tiat Jin (TJ)
Founder &amp; Principal Consultant, Curated Connectors, Singapore




3:00 &ndash; 3:10 PM


Q &amp; A
Moderated by Lina Maulidina Sabrina
Programme Officer, ERIA




3:10 &ndash; 3:15 PM


Closing Remarks and End of Webinar

hcraeseR";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-11-04 11:49:17";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-11-04 14:41:13";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:20:"sarah.tavia@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:31;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11467";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6507";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:94:"ccs-japan-cooperation-programme-workshop-on-trade-in-services-agreement-negative-list-approach";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:97:"CCS-JAPAN Cooperation Programme: Workshop on Trade in Services Agreement (Negative-List Approach)";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-22";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:0:"";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual
