Cooperation Programme: Workshop on Trade in Services Agreement (Negative-List Approach) CCS-JAPAN Cooperation Programme: Workshop on Trade in Services Agreement (Negative-List Approach)        Virtual Room  Ms Sheila Fathiya sheila.fathiya@eria.org   2021-11-22 2021-11-23 2021-11-22 22 November 2021 1202 rebmevoN 22 22-11-1202 32-11-1202 22-11-1202   gro.aire@ayihtaf.aliehs ayihtaF aliehS sM  mooR lautriV        )hcaorppA tsiL-evitageN( tnemeergA secivreS ni edarT no pohskroW :emmargorP noitarepooC NAPAJ-SCC )hcaorppA tsiL-evitageN( tnemeergA secivreS ni edarT no pohskroW :emmargorP noitarepooC NAPAJ-SCC";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-11-04 11:43:33";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-11-04 11:45:02";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"sheila.fathiya@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:32;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11560";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6506";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:58:"publication-and-book-launch-indonesia-manufacturing-review";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:60:"Publication and Book Launch 'Indonesia Manufacturing Review'";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-17";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:7114:"<p><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/Webinar%20Launching%20buku%20kajian%20manufaktur%204.5%20English.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="800" /></p><p>Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning (PPN/Bappenas) has collaborated with Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) to complete a study titled &lsquo;Kajian Sektor Manufaktur (Manufacturing Sector Review)&rsquo;. This study has started in 2018 and been a part of a background study for Indonesian Mid-term National Planning (RPJMN) 2020-2024 for manufacturing industries. This study has also been updated to cover issues on manufacturing sectors during COVID-19 pandemic. Analysis used in this study involved secondary data analytics and focus group discussions with related ministries/government institutions, major manufacturing industry players and academicians, and other stakeholders.</p><p>Industry sector is one of the main drivers of Indonesian economy. Manufacturing sector has constantly made up for around 20% of Indonesian GDP and non-oil and gas manufacturing contribution to export has increased rapidly to around 50% since around 1990s. Industrialization has been one of strategies to transform Indonesian economy to be more inclusive and sustainable. On the other hand, during COVID-19 pandemic, manufacturing sectors had suffered multiple drawbacks, from the decline in production to value chain disruptions, sales decline, labor cut-off, and bankruptcy. In 2020, manufacturing sector&rsquo;s rate of GDP growth contracted by 2.5% (y-o-y), but in Q2-2021, the figure has improved to 6.6% (y-o-y).</p><p>One of strategies to improve Indonesian manufacturing sector performance is constructing a solid and comprehensive planning of manufacturing sector development. The policy directions shall cover analysis on relevant issues, opportunities, and challenges faced by each sub-sectors in manufacturing industries. This study focused on five sub-sectors, which are (i) food and beverage industry; (ii) textile, garment, and footwear industry; (iii) automotive industry; (iv) chemical industry; and (v) metal industry. Moreover, this study also provided an up-to-date analysis on current challenges, especially on (i) technological advancement; (ii) human resources and labor; (iii) global value chain; (iv) a review on sub-sectors in manufacturing sector and their auxiliary services; (v) export and utilization of Free Trade Agreement (FTA); (vi) energy availability; and (vii) financial support system. This study also provided policy suggestions to support the growth and development of manufacturing industries.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Wednesday,&nbsp; 17 November 2021, 13<span class="event-time-localized">:00 PM- - 15:20 PM (UTC +7)</span></p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><strong>Agenda:&nbsp;</strong></p><table style="width: 784px;"><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Time&nbsp;</strong></p></td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Event&nbsp;</strong></p></td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><strong>Speaker/Moderator/PIC</strong></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>13.00 &ndash; 13.05</strong></p></td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Opening</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">13.05 &ndash; 13.10</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Brief Report by Bappenas</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Economy Deputy at Indonesian Ministry of&nbsp; National Development Planning / Bappenas</strong></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">13.10 &ndash; 13.20</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Opening Remarks</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Dr. (H.C.)&nbsp;H. Suharso Monoarfa</strong></p><p><em>Minister of PPN/Chief of Bappenas</em></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">&nbsp;13.20 &ndash; 13.30</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">&nbsp;Opening Remarks&nbsp;</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Prof Hidetoshi Nishimura</strong></p><p><em>President of Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</em></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">13.30 &ndash; 14.00</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;"><p>Indonesian Manufacturing Review &ndash; Study Results</p></td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Dionisius A. Narjoko,&nbsp;</strong><em>Senior Economist, ERIA</em></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">&nbsp;14.00 &ndash; 14.15&nbsp;</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;"><p>International Production Network post the Covid-19 Pandemic&nbsp;</p></td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><strong>Fukunari Kimura,&nbsp;</strong><em>Chief Economist, ERIA</em></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">14.15 &ndash; 14.50</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Discussion session by discussants</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Discussants:</strong></p><ul><li><strong> Dr. Ir. Dradjad Irianto, M.Eng, </strong><em>Professor at Insititut Teknologi Bandung</em></li><li><strong> Maman Setiawan, </strong><em>Center of Economics and Development Studies at Universitas Padjajaran</em></li><li><strong> Vivi Alatas</strong>, <em>Chief Executive Officer of Asakreativita</em></li></ul><p><strong>Moderator,</strong> Director for Industry, Tourism, and Creative Economy, <em>Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning / Bappenas</em></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">14.50 &ndash; 15.10</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Q&amp;A Session</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><p><strong>Moderator,</strong>&nbsp;Director for Industry, Tourism, and Creative Economy, <em>Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning / Bappenas</em></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">15.10 &ndash; 15.15</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Conclusion</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;"><strong>Economy Deputy, </strong><em>Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning / Bappenas </em></td></tr><tr style="height: 42px;"><td style="width: 200px; height: 42px;">15.15 &ndash; 15.20</td><td style="width: 398.812px; height: 42px;">Closing</td><td style="width: 497.188px; height: 42px;">&nbsp;</td></tr></table><p><strong>Note</strong><strong>:</strong></p><p>This event will be held in a bilingual manner (English and Bahasa Indonesia).</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/3neuaBo" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:18:"Ms Hardianti Sukma";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:4:"ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-17";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-17";s:8:"keywords";s:9153:"Publication and Book Launch 'Indonesia Manufacturing Review' Publication and Book Launch 'Indonesia Manufacturing Review' Indonesian Ministry of National Development Planning (PPN/Bappenas) has collaborated with Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) to complete a study titled &lsquo;Kajian Sektor Manufaktur (Manufacturing Sector Review)&rsquo;. This study has started in 2018 and been a part of a background study for Indonesian Mid-term National Planning (RPJMN) 2020-2024 for manufacturing industries. This study has also been updated to cover issues on manufacturing sectors during COVID-19 pandemic. Analysis used in this study involved secondary data analytics and focus group discussions with related ministries/government institutions, major manufacturing industry players and academicians, and other stakeholders.
Industry sector is one of the main drivers of Indonesian economy. Manufacturing sector has constantly made up for around 20% of Indonesian GDP and non-oil and gas manufacturing contribution to export has increased rapidly to around 50% since around 1990s. Industrialization has been one of strategies to transform Indonesian economy to be more inclusive and sustainable. On the other hand, during COVID-19 pandemic, manufacturing sectors had suffered multiple drawbacks, from the decline in production to value chain disruptions, sales decline, labor cut-off, and bankruptcy. In 2020, manufacturing sector&rsquo;s rate of GDP growth contracted by 2.5% (y-o-y), but in Q2-2021, the figure has improved to 6.6% (y-o-y).
One of strategies to improve Indonesian manufacturing sector performance is constructing a solid and comprehensive planning of manufacturing sector development. The policy directions shall cover analysis on relevant issues, opportunities, and challenges faced by each sub-sectors in manufacturing industries. This study focused on five sub-sectors, which are (i) food and beverage industry; (ii) textile, garment, and footwear industry; (iii) automotive industry; (iv) chemical industry; and (v) metal industry. Moreover, this study also provided an up-to-date analysis on current challenges, especially on (i) technological advancement; (ii) human resources and labor; (iii) global value chain; (iv) a review on sub-sectors in manufacturing sector and their auxiliary services; (v) export and utilization of Free Trade Agreement (FTA); (vi) energy availability; and (vii) financial support system. This study also provided policy suggestions to support the growth and development of manufacturing industries.
Date and Time:
Wednesday,&nbsp; 17 November 2021, 13:00 PM- - 15:20 PM (UTC +7)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)

Rules of Origin Under RCEP, Lao PDR";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-15";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:0:"";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Rules of Origin Under RCEP, Lao PDR Understanding Rules of Origin Under RCEP, Lao PDR        Virtual Room  Ms Sheila Fathiya  sheila.fathiya@eria.org  ERIA 2021-11-15 2021-11-19 2021-11-15 15 November 2021 1202 rebmevoN 51 51-11-1202 91-11-1202 51-11-1202 AIRE  gro.aire@ayihtaf.aliehs  ayihtaF aliehS sM  mooR lautriV        RDP oaL ,PECR rednU nigirO fo seluR gnidnatsrednU RDP oaL ,PECR rednU nigirO fo seluR gnidnatsrednU";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-11-04 11:32:17";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-11-04 11:32:17";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"sheila.fathiya@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:34;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11454";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6502";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:54:"the-4th-asia-ccus-network-knowledge-sharing-conference";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:54:"The 4th Asia CCUS Network Knowledge Sharing Conference";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-17";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:4399:"<p class="preFlex flexIn">&nbsp;<img src="/uploads/media/Events/2021-4th-CCUS.png" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">The Asia CCUS Network was successfully launched on 22-23rd June 2021. Initially, 13 countries (all ASEAN member countries, the United States, Australia, and Japan) and more than 100 international organisations, companies, financial and research institutions decided to join the Network. Members share the vision of CCUS development throughout the Asian region, and the Asia CCUS Network aims to contribute through the collaboration and cooperation on development and deployment of CCUS.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">The mission of this network is to facilitate deployment of CCUS through: (i) promoting knowledge sharing through holding an annual forum, conferences, workshops, and meetings; (ii) conducting research studies on technical, economical, and legal standards of CCUS in the EAS region; and (iii) holding capacity building training workshops to bridge the knowledge gap on CCUS. The Asia CCUS Network provides opportunities for countries in the region to work and collaborate on the low emission technology partnership that will eventually help to build countries&rsquo; capability to lower the cost of CCUS technology and its deployment through collaboration of research and innovation.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">The Clean Energy Ministerial (CEM) CCUS Initiative plays a critical role to support the adoption and deployment of CCUS around the world. The Asia CCUS Network is partnering with the CEM CCUS Initiative and the European Commission in co-hosting this knowledge-sharing conference on the topic of &#039;Learning from failures &ndash; building on success: EU experience on CCUS&#039;.&nbsp;</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Wednesday,&nbsp; 17 November 2021,&nbsp;<span class="event-time-localized">3:00 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;4:30 PM (UTC +7)</span></p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><table style="width: 614px;"><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p><strong>TIME</strong></p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>AGENDA</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>15:00 PM &ndash; 15:10 PM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Opening Remarks:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Taizo Hara, </strong>Director General of Research and Policy Design Administration of ERIA</li><li><strong>Juho Lipponen</strong>, Coordinator CEM CCUS Initiative</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>15:10 PM &ndash; 15:50 PM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Moderator:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Han Phoumin</strong>, Senior Energy Economist, ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Chris Bolesta</strong>, CCUS Policy Lead at EU Commission: &lsquo;Learning from failures &ndash; building on success: EU experience on CCUS&rsquo;</li><li><strong>Per-Olof Granstr&ouml;m</strong>, EU Director, Zero-Emissions Platform (ZEP): &lsquo;ZEP&rsquo;s view on EU experience&rsquo;</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>15:50 PM &ndash; 16:00 PM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Commentary session:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Saleh Abdurrahman</strong>, Member of Committee for Downstream Oil and Gas Regulatory Body Former, Senior Advisor for Environment and Spatial Planning Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (MEMR), Indonesia</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>16:00 PM &ndash; 16:25 PM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Open discussion Session</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>16:25 PM &ndash; 16:30 PM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Closing Remarks:</strong></p><ul><li><div id="block-888dab804c721b30ec43" class="sqs-block html-block sqs-block-html" data-block-type="2"><div class="sqs-block-content"><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>Shigeru Kimura</strong>, Special Advisor to the President on Energy Affairs, ERIA</p></div></div><div id="block-ed3b88ee55b04a6ec005" class="sqs-block button-block sqs-block-button" data-block-type="53">&nbsp;</div></li></ul></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/3EC3qRl" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:16:"Ms Dian Lutfiana";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-17";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-17";s:8:"keywords";s:6099:"The 4th Asia CCUS Network Knowledge Sharing Conference The 4th Asia CCUS Network Knowledge Sharing Conference &nbsp;
The Asia CCUS Network was successfully launched on 22-23rd June 2021. Initially, 13 countries (all ASEAN member countries, the United States, Australia, and Japan) and more than 100 international organisations, companies, financial and research institutions decided to join the Network. Members share the vision of CCUS development throughout the Asian region, and the Asia CCUS Network aims to contribute through the collaboration and cooperation on development and deployment of CCUS.
The mission of this network is to facilitate deployment of CCUS through: (i) promoting knowledge sharing through holding an annual forum, conferences, workshops, and meetings; (ii) conducting research studies on technical, economical, and legal standards of CCUS in the EAS region; and (iii) holding capacity building training workshops to bridge the knowledge gap on CCUS. The Asia CCUS Network provides opportunities for countries in the region to work and collaborate on the low emission technology partnership that will eventually help to build countries&rsquo; capability to lower the cost of CCUS technology and its deployment through collaboration of research and innovation.
The Clean Energy Ministerial (CEM) CCUS Initiative plays a critical role to support the adoption and deployment of CCUS around the world. The Asia CCUS Network is partnering with the CEM CCUS Initiative and the European Commission in co-hosting this knowledge-sharing conference on the topic of 'Learning from failures &ndash; building on success: EU experience on CCUS'.&nbsp;
Date and Time:
Wednesday,&nbsp; 17 November 2021,&nbsp;3:00 PM&nbsp;&nbsp;4:30 PM (UTC +7)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)




TIME


AGENDA




15:00 PM &ndash; 15:10 PM


Opening Remarks:

Taizo Hara, Director General of Research and Policy Design Administration of ERIA
Juho Lipponen, Coordinator CEM CCUS Initiative





15:10 PM &ndash; 15:50 PM


Moderator:

Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist, ERIA

Speakers:

Chris Bolesta, CCUS Policy Lead at EU Commission: &lsquo;Learning from failures &ndash; building on success: EU experience on CCUS&rsquo;
Per-Olof Granstr&ouml;m, EU Director, Zero-Emissions Platform (ZEP): &lsquo;ZEP&rsquo;s view on EU experience&rsquo;





15:50 PM &ndash; 16:00 PM


Commentary session:

Saleh Abdurrahman, Member of Committee for Downstream Oil and Gas Regulatory Body Former, Senior Advisor for Environment and Spatial Planning Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (MEMR), Indonesia





16:00 PM &ndash; 16:25 PM


Open discussion Session




16:25 PM &ndash; 16:30 PM


Closing Remarks:




Shigeru Kimura, Special Advisor to the President on Energy Affairs, ERIA


&nbsp;

MP 00:61 ;hsadn& MP 05:51

;ouqsr&SUCC no ecneirepxe UE :sseccus no gnidliub ;hsadn& seruliaf morf gninraeL;ouqsl& :noissimmoC UE ta daeL yciloP SUCC ,atseloB sirhC

MP 05:51 ;hsadn& MP 01:51

MP 01:51 ;hsadn& MP 00:51

)noitartsiger retfa dedivorp eb ot moor gniteem eht ot knil( enilnO
:noitacoL
)7+ CTU( MP 03:4;psbn&;psbn&MP 00:3;psbn&,1202 rebmevoN 71 ;psbn&,yadsendeW
:emiT dna etaD
;psbn&.'SUCC no ecneirepxe UE :sseccus no gnidliub ;hsadn& seruliaf morf gninraeL' fo cipot eht no ecnerefnoc gnirahs-egdelwonk siht gnitsoh-oc ni noissimmoC naeporuE eht dna evitaitinI SUCC MEC eht htiw gnirentrap si krowteN SUCC aisA ehT .dlrow eht dnuora SUCC fo tnemyolped dna noitpoda eht troppus ot elor lacitirc a syalp evitaitinI SUCC )MEC( lairetsiniM ygrenE naelC ehT
.noitavonni dna hcraeser fo noitaroballoc hguorht tnemyolped sti dna ygolonhcet SUCC fo tsoc eht rewol ot ytilibapac ;ouqsr&seirtnuoc dliub ot pleh yllautneve lliw taht pihsrentrap ygolonhcet noissime wol eht no etaroballoc dna krow ot noiger eht ni seirtnuoc rof seitinutroppo sedivorp krowteN SUCC aisA ehT .SUCC no pag egdelwonk eht egdirb ot spohskrow gniniart gnidliub yticapac gnidloh )iii( dna ;noiger SAE eht ni SUCC fo sdradnats lagel dna ,lacimonoce ,lacinhcet no seiduts hcraeser gnitcudnoc )ii( ;sgniteem dna ,spohskrow ,secnerefnoc ,murof launna na gnidloh hguorht gnirahs egdelwonk gnitomorp )i( :hguorht SUCC fo tnemyolped etatilicaf ot si krowten siht fo noissim ehT
.SUCC fo tnemyolped dna tnempoleved no noitarepooc dna noitaroballoc eht hguorht etubirtnoc ot smia krowteN SUCC aisA eht dna ,noiger naisA eht tuohguorht tnempoleved SUCC fo noisiv eht erahs srebmeM .krowteN eht nioj ot dediced snoitutitsni hcraeser dna laicnanif ,seinapmoc ,snoitasinagro lanoitanretni 001 naht erom dna )napaJ dna ,ailartsuA ,setatS detinU eht ,seirtnuoc rebmem NAESA lla( seirtnuoc 31 ,yllaitinI .1202 enuJ dr32-22 no dehcnual yllufsseccus saw krowteN SUCC aisA ehT
;psbn& ecnerefnoC gnirahS egdelwonK krowteN SUCC aisA ht4 ehT ecnerefnoC gnirahS egdelwonK krowteN SUCC aisA ht4 ehT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-11-03 14:28:28";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-11-03 15:37:17";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:22:"dian.lutfiana@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:35;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11561";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6501";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:73:"malaysias-private-sector-innovation-as-a-driver-to-tackle-marine-plastics";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:82:"Malaysiaâ€™s Private Sector: Innovation as a Driver to Tackle Marine Plastics";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-23";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:6566:"<p><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/Eventbrite%20Banner%20(PSP%20Series%202).png" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p>Plastic is a material that is versatile, resistant, lightweight, and inexpensive to produce, which makes it ubiquitous in our everyday lives. However, the amount of plastic waste released in our environment and its negative effects on our marine ecosystem have attracted increasing scientific concern in recent years. East and Southeast Asian regions are recognised as the biggest contributors to marine plastic pollution due to rapid economic growth and the lack of solid waste management infrastructure. Indeed, ASEAN+3 region is estimated to account for 62.6% of the world leakage of plastics to the ocean, including Malaysia which ranks third in the world, according to a study by Dutch scientist Lourens Meijer et. al. (2021).</p><p>Alarmed by this regional situation, the ASEAN Member States in 2019 welcomed the ASEAN Framework of Action on Marine Debris and adopted the Bangkok Declaration on Combating Marine Debris in ASEAN Region. In May 2021, ASEAN as a group officially launched the ASEAN Regional Action Plan for Combating Marine Debris in the ASEAN Member States (2021-2025), which recognises the urgent need to combat marine litter, including by promoting platforms for knowledge sharing, innovative solutions, and best practices to address this issue.</p><p>Although much is still left to be studied, particularly the long-term impacts of plastics on our marine ecosystem, and its potential harm to human health through the food chain, there is a wide international consensus to take urgent preventative actions before further damage is done. Echoing these concerns, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) has established the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD) in 2019 to provide the ASEAN+3 Member States with support in addressing emerging challenges associated with marine plastic debris.</p><p>In fact, the private sector in ASEAN+3 countries have been contributing significantly to the reduction of plastic waste and by consequence marine plastic debris in the region. Their efforts can range from both production and consumption (so-called &ldquo;upstream&rdquo;) level to recycling and waste management (so-called &ldquo;downstream&rdquo;) level. <strong>At the occasion of this forum, ERIA&rsquo;s RKC-MPD will focus on the role played by the private sectors in Malaysia by shedding light on innovative technologies and approaches developed to address this pressing issue. </strong>Innovation, in this context will encompass a wide array of practices that distance themselves from the traditional linear (take-make-use-dispose) way of thinking and proposes more responsible and sustainable business models.</p><p>One of the important missions of RKC-MPD is to promote private companies whose business activities help combat marine plastic litter, in the hope to promote this positive shift. RKC-MPD has established an online platform titled &lsquo;Private sector initiatives to reduce plastic waste and marine plastic debris&rsquo; (<a href="https://rkcmpd-eria.org/story">https://rkcmpd-eria.org/story</a>). This online interface called the Private Sector Platform (PSP) hosts information submitted by private companies operating in all ASEAN+3 countries to showcase their products, services, or technologies contributing to the reduction of plastic waste and marine plastic debris. The platform collects and disseminates private companies&rsquo; business activities that are conducive to marine plastics mitigation. It also aims to encourage Business-to-Business, Business-to-Government and/or Business-to-Consumer opportunities in the ASEAN+3 region.</p><p>The forum will be an occasion for the Ministry of Environment and Water of Malaysia, a Malaysian business alliance, and Malaysian private companies to stocktake the progress made, and discuss the many ways private companies can contribute in combatting plastic waste and marine plastic debris. RKC-MPD will reintroduce the Private Sector Platform (PSP) to the public, particularly to the private companies, to raise more awareness of the platform and attract a larger number of private companies to join the fight against marine plastics.</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Tuesday, 23 November 2021,&nbsp;9 AM -&nbsp;10:30&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta time) / 10 AM - 11.30 (UTC+8; Malaysia time)&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><table style="width: 614px;"><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p><strong>TIME</strong></p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>AGENDA</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>10:00-10:10 AM</p><p>10:10-10:12 AM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Opening Remarks:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Michikazu Kojima,&nbsp;</strong>Research Fellow, Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), ERIA</li><li><strong>Dato&#039; Jana Santhiran a/l Muniayan,</strong> Deputy Secretary General, Ministry of Environment and Water of Malaysia</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>10:12-10:45AM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Moderator:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Fusanori Iwasaki,</strong> Senior Research Associate and Executive Assistant to the President of ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>Panellists:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Pauline Goh,</strong> General Manager, Malaysian Recycling Alliance Berhad (MAREA)</li><li><strong>Ayamany A/L P Sinakalai,</strong> CEO, FALLALEAF</li><li><strong>Wee Ching Yun,</strong> Chairman of Sustainability Sub-Committee, Malaysia Plastic Manufacturers Association (MPMA)</li><li><strong>Thomas Chhoa,</strong> Senior Advisor in the Office of the CEO, Alliance to End Plastic Waste (AEPW)</li><li><strong>Ellen Putri Edita,</strong> Research Associate, the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), ERIA</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>10:45-11:28 AM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Open Discussion with Q &amp; A</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>11.28-11.30 AM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Closing Remarks:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Michikazu Kojima, </strong>Research Fellow, RKC-MPD, ERIA</li></ul></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER" href="https://bit.ly/3wawgVS" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:22:"Ms Devina Anglingdarma";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:4:"ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-23";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-23";s:8:"keywords";s:11347:"Malaysiaâ€™s Private Sector: Innovation as a Driver to Tackle Marine Plastics Malaysiaâ€™s Private Sector: Innovation as a Driver to Tackle Marine Plastics Plastic is a material that is versatile, resistant, lightweight, and inexpensive to produce, which makes it ubiquitous in our everyday lives. However, the amount of plastic waste released in our environment and its negative effects on our marine ecosystem have attracted increasing scientific concern in recent years. East and Southeast Asian regions are recognised as the biggest contributors to marine plastic pollution due to rapid economic growth and the lack of solid waste management infrastructure. Indeed, ASEAN+3 region is estimated to account for 62.6% of the world leakage of plastics to the ocean, including Malaysia which ranks third in the world, according to a study by Dutch scientist Lourens Meijer et. al. (2021).
Alarmed by this regional situation, the ASEAN Member States in 2019 welcomed the ASEAN Framework of Action on Marine Debris and adopted the Bangkok Declaration on Combating Marine Debris in ASEAN Region. In May 2021, ASEAN as a group officially launched the ASEAN Regional Action Plan for Combating Marine Debris in the ASEAN Member States (2021-2025), which recognises the urgent need to combat marine litter, including by promoting platforms for knowledge sharing, innovative solutions, and best practices to address this issue.
Although much is still left to be studied, particularly the long-term impacts of plastics on our marine ecosystem, and its potential harm to human health through the food chain, there is a wide international consensus to take urgent preventative actions before further damage is done. Echoing these concerns, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) has established the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD) in 2019 to provide the ASEAN+3 Member States with support in addressing emerging challenges associated with marine plastic debris.
In fact, the private sector in ASEAN+3 countries have been contributing significantly to the reduction of plastic waste and by consequence marine plastic debris in the region. Their efforts can range from both production and consumption (so-called &ldquo;upstream&rdquo;) level to recycling and waste management (so-called &ldquo;downstream&rdquo;) level. At the occasion of this forum, ERIA&rsquo;s RKC-MPD will focus on the role played by the private sectors in Malaysia by shedding light on innovative technologies and approaches developed to address this pressing issue. Innovation, in this context will encompass a wide array of practices that distance themselves from the traditional linear (take-make-use-dispose) way of thinking and proposes more responsible and sustainable business models.
One of the important missions of RKC-MPD is to promote private companies whose business activities help combat marine plastic litter, in the hope to promote this positive shift. RKC-MPD has established an online platform titled &lsquo;Private sector initiatives to reduce plastic waste and marine plastic debris&rsquo; (https://rkcmpd-eria.org/story). This online interface called the Private Sector Platform (PSP) hosts information submitted by private companies operating in all ASEAN+3 countries to showcase their products, services, or technologies contributing to the reduction of plastic waste and marine plastic debris. The platform collects and disseminates private companies&rsquo; business activities that are conducive to marine plastics mitigation. It also aims to encourage Business-to-Business, Business-to-Government and/or Business-to-Consumer opportunities in the ASEAN+3 region.
The forum will be an occasion for the Ministry of Environment and Water of Malaysia, a Malaysian business alliance, and Malaysian private companies to stocktake the progress made, and discuss the many ways private companies can contribute in combatting plastic waste and marine plastic debris. RKC-MPD will reintroduce the Private Sector Platform (PSP) to the public, particularly to the private companies, to raise more awareness of the platform and attract a larger number of private companies to join the fight against marine plastics.
Date and Time:
Tuesday, 23 November 2021,&nbsp;9 AM -&nbsp;10:30&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta time) / 10 AM - 11.30 (UTC+8; Malaysia time)&nbsp;
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)




TIME


AGENDA




10:00-10:10 AM
10:10-10:12 AM


Opening Remarks:

Michikazu Kojima,&nbsp;Research Fellow, Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), ERIA
Dato' Jana Santhiran a/l Muniayan, Deputy Secretary General, Ministry of Environment and Water of Malaysia





10:12-10:45AM


Moderator:

Fusanori Iwasaki, Senior Research Associate and Executive Assistant to the President of ERIA

Panellists:

Pauline Goh, General Manager, Malaysian Recycling Alliance Berhad (MAREA)
Ayamany A/L P Sinakalai, CEO, FALLALEAF
Wee Ching Yun, Chairman of Sustainability Sub-Committee, Malaysia Plastic Manufacturers Association (MPMA)
Thomas Chhoa, Senior Advisor in the Office of the CEO, Alliance to End Plastic Waste (AEPW)
Ellen Putri Edita, Research Associate, the Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), ERIA





10:45-11:28 AM


Open Discussion with Q &amp; A




11.28-11.30 AM


Closing Remarks:

Michikazu Kojima, Research Fellow, RKC-MPD, ERIA

MA 03.11-82.11

.sirbed citsalp eniram htiw detaicossa segnellahc gnigreme gnisserdda ni troppus htiw setatS rebmeM 3+NAESA eht edivorp ot 9102 ni )DPM-CKR( sirbeD citsalP eniraM rof ertneC egdelwonK lanoigeR eht dehsilbatse sah )AIRE( aisA tsaE dna NAESA rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE eht ,snrecnoc eseht gniohcE .enod si egamad rehtruf erofeb snoitca evitatneverp tnegru ekat ot susnesnoc lanoitanretni ediw a si ereht ,niahc doof eht hguorht htlaeh namuh ot mrah laitnetop sti dna ,metsysoce eniram ruo no scitsalp fo stcapmi mret-gnol eht ylralucitrap ,deiduts eb ot tfel llits si hcum hguohtlA

.)1202( .la .te rejieM sneruoL tsitneics hctuD yb yduts a ot gnidrocca ,dlrow eht ni driht sknar hcihw aisyalaM gnidulcni ,naeco eht ot scitsalp fo egakael dlrow eht fo %6.26 rof tnuocca ot detamitse s™€âaisyalaM";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-11-03 14:04:58";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-11-16 16:56:08";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:28:"devina.anglingdarma@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:36;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11497";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6497";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:69:"eria-ciieco-webinar-series-on-innovation-and-digitalisation-in-agtech";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:70:"ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series on Innovation and Digitalisation in Agtech";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-11-11";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:3532:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/2021-Nob-CIIE.CO-3-v1.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p><strong>ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series - Building Prolific Entrepreneurship Ecosystem in ASEAN with Insight from India Episode #3: Innovation and Digitalisaion in Agtech</strong></p><p>Agriculture is a key contributor to economic development and serves as the main source of a livelihood for a large segment across ASEAN and India. Over the years, the creation and adoption of cutting-edge technologies has allowed the development of Agriculture Technology or &ldquo;Agtech&rdquo; &ndash; enabling entrepreneurs, public, and private sectors to offer innovative solutions to areas such as digital market and financial access for smallholder farmers, production and supply chains services, smart farming solutions, and agri-food technology and innovation.</p><p>With the 3<sup>rd</sup> episode of ERIA-CIIE.CO online discussion, we aim to share knowledge and experience from experts and leading startups on Agtech innovation and digitalisation in the region, as well as learning the major challenges and opportunities on Agtech industries in the post-Covid-19 world. &nbsp;</p><p>Join us as we harvest new insights on Agtech innovations and learn how technology is used in agriculture today!</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Thursday, 11 November 2021, 2:30 - 4:00 PM, IST / 4:00 - 5:30 PM, WIB</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><table style="width: 614px;"><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p><strong>TIME</strong></p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>AGENDA</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>2:30 &ndash; 2:40 PM, IST</p><p>or</p><p>4:00 - 4:10 PM, WIB</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks</strong></p><p><strong>Giulia Ajmone Marsan</strong></p><p>Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>2:40 &ndash; 3:40 PM, IST</p><p>or</p><p>4:10 - 5:10 PM</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Panel Discussion</strong></p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Dr Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Director of Research Strategy and Innovation, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li><li>Ritchie Goenawan, Chief Marketing Officer and Director of People &amp; Culture, TaniHub Group, Indonesia</li><li>Luke Tay, Independent Food Futurist, Singapore</li><li>Sai Gole, Co-founder, BharatAgri, India</li><li>Emmanuel Murray Senior Advisor, Caspian Impact Investment, India</li></ul><p>Moderated by <strong>Hemendra Mathur,</strong> Partner &ndash; Bharat Innovation Fund</p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>3:40 &ndash; 3:55 PM, IST</p><p>or</p><p>5:10 - 5:25 PM, WIB</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Q &amp; A</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 182.347px;"><p>3:55 &ndash; 4:00 PM, IST</p><p>or</p><p>5:25 - 5:30 PM, WIB</p></td><td style="width: 416.653px;"><p><strong>Closing Remarks and End of Webinar</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/innovation-and-digitalisation-in-agtech-tickets-203522399977" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/%5BConcept%20Note%5D%20ERIA-CIIE.CO%20Roundtable%20on%20Innovation%20and%20Digitalisation%20in%20Agtech.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CONCEPT NOTE</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Amelia Litania";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-11";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-11";s:8:"keywords";s:5047:"ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series on Innovation and Digitalisation in Agtech ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series on Innovation and Digitalisation in Agtech ERIA-CIIE.CO Webinar Series - Building Prolific Entrepreneurship Ecosystem in ASEAN with Insight from India Episode #3: Innovation and Digitalisaion in Agtech
Agriculture is a key contributor to economic development and serves as the main source of a livelihood for a large segment across ASEAN and India. Over the years, the creation and adoption of cutting-edge technologies has allowed the development of Agriculture Technology or &ldquo;Agtech&rdquo; &ndash; enabling entrepreneurs, public, and private sectors to offer innovative solutions to areas such as digital market and financial access for smallholder farmers, production and supply chains services, smart farming solutions, and agri-food technology and innovation.
With the 3rd episode of ERIA-CIIE.CO online discussion, we aim to share knowledge and experience from experts and leading startups on Agtech innovation and digitalisation in the region, as well as learning the major challenges and opportunities on Agtech industries in the post-Covid-19 world. &nbsp;
Join us as we harvest new insights on Agtech innovations and learn how technology is used in agriculture today!
Date and Time:
Thursday, 11 November 2021, 2:30 - 4:00 PM, IST / 4:00 - 5:30 PM, WIB
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)




TIME


AGENDA




2:30 &ndash; 2:40 PM, IST
or
4:00 - 4:10 PM, WIB


Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks
Giulia Ajmone Marsan
Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA




2:40 &ndash; 3:40 PM, IST
or
4:10 - 5:10 PM


Panel Discussion
Speakers:

Dr Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Director of Research Strategy and Innovation, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)
Ritchie Goenawan, Chief Marketing Officer and Director of People &amp; Culture, TaniHub Group, Indonesia
Luke Tay, Independent Food Futurist, Singapore
Sai Gole, Co-founder, BharatAgri, India
Emmanuel Murray Senior Advisor, Caspian Impact Investment, India

Moderated by Hemendra Mathur, Partner &ndash; Bharat Innovation Fund




3:40 &ndash; 3:55 PM, IST
or
5:10 - 5:25 PM, WIB


Q &amp; A




3:55 &ndash; 4:00 PM, IST
or
5:25 - 5:30 PM, WIB


Closing Remarks and End of Webinar

RCEP will create new business opportunities and change the shape of trade in the region.</p><p>ERIA&rsquo;s Capacity Building Programme is organising a series of five Public-Private Dialogues, &#039;Unpacking the RCEP Agreement&#039;. Dialogue 1 will discuss the e-commerce provisions and the digitalization of trade, and the potential impact it may have on your business. The Dialogue will bring together business, government, and international trade experts to share their perspectives.</p><p>If you are in Cambodia, glean insights together with our distinguished panel of speakers on how to maximise the benefits from e-commerce.</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Tuesday, 2 November 2021, 8.30 AM&nbsp;&ndash; 12.30 PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia href="https://bit.ly/3pdu7Hp" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-11-02";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-11-02";s:8:"keywords";s:8197:"Unpacking the RCEP Agreement, Public-Private Dialogue 1: The RCEP E-Commerce Provisions and What They Mean for Cambodia Unpacking the RCEP Agreement, Public-Private Dialogue 1: The RCEP E-Commerce Provisions and What They Mean for Cambodia Unpacking the RCEP Agreement, Public-Private Dialogue 1: The RCEP E-Commerce Provisions and What They Mean for Cambodia
The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) marks the establishment of a free trade agreement amongst 15 states. RCEP will create new business opportunities and change the shape of trade in the region.
ERIA&rsquo;s Capacity Building Programme is organising a series of five Public-Private Dialogues, 'Unpacking the RCEP Agreement'. Dialogue 1 will discuss the e-commerce provisions and the digitalization of trade, and the potential impact it may have on your business. The Dialogue will bring together business, government, and international trade experts to share their perspectives.
If you are in Cambodia, glean insights together with our distinguished panel of speakers on how to maximise the benefits from e-commerce.
Date and Time:
Tuesday, 2 November 2021, 8.30 AM&nbsp;&ndash; 12.30 PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda (as of 27 October 2021)
(Phnom Penh and Jakarta time, UTC+7)



Time
Agenda Item
Notes


8:30 &ndash; 9:00 AM

Opening Remarks
Host: Mr Jeremy Gross, Director of Capacity Building, ERIA

HE SIM Sokheng, Secretary of State, Ministry of Commerce
Mr Andreas ZURBRUGG, Deputy Ambassador, Australian Embassy, Cambodia


&nbsp;


9:00 - 10:00 AM

Session 1: Setting the scene: The RCEP e-commerce agreement and Cambodia&rsquo;s Work Plan for its implementation
Moderator: Mr Sven Callebaut, International Trade and E-Trade Adviser
Presenters:

HE SOK Siphana, Senior Advisor to the Royal Government of Cambodia
Deborah ELMS, CEO, Asia Trade Centre
SRENG Nearirath, Deputy Head of Banking and Finance Practice Group, DFDL Mekong (Cambodia)

Q&amp;A with the audience.


This session will provide a precise description of what the RCEP e-commerce provisions are and whether Cambodia&rsquo;s legal and regulatory system for e-commerce is ready to accelerate cross-border e-commerce.



10:00 -10:10 AM
&nbsp;Break
&nbsp;


10:10 &ndash; 11:30 AM

Session 2: Private sector perspectives on opportunities for Cambodia in RCEP
Moderator: Mr Sven Callebaut, International Trade Consultant, CBP, ERIA
Panellists: 

Mr CHEA Langda, Founder and CEO, BookMeBus
Mr Maxime Rosburger, Partner &amp; COO, Kiwipay Pte Ltd.
LCT CHEA Ratha, Vice President, Cambodia Women Entrepreneur Association
Mr Kenneth TANG, Auscham Cambodia and Managing Director, Dynamic Technologies
Mr PRAYAG Chitrakar, Country Manager, DHL Express (Cambodia) Ltd.

Q&amp;A with the audience.


This session will enable different business interests to assess their level of preparedness and understanding of how the RCEP agreement could be a game-changer in their industry.



11.30 AM - 12.15 PM

Session 3: Panel Discussion on Bridging National Interests and Global Trends
Moderator: Mr Danny Burrows, Founder and Principal, TradeWorthy Ltd.
Panellists: 

DG RATH Saravuth, General Directorate of International Trade, Ministry of Commerce
Mr MOM Varin, Vice-President, Cambodia E-business Association and CEO, AngkorStores.com
Representative, Australian Embassy in Cambodia.

Q&amp;A with the audience.


The session will seek to enhance public-private dialogue on e-commerce and, more broadly, of RCEP implementation, with a view to discuss possible follow-up actions to increase the capacity of public officials and MSMEs alike to respond to regional opportunities created by RCEP.




12:15 PM &ndash; 12:30 PM


Closing remarks
HE SIM Sokheng, Secretary of State / HE Rath Saravuth, Director General, Ministry of Commerce (TBC)

&nbsp;



REGISTER NOW&nbsp;        Ms Lina Maulidina lina.maulidina@eria.org   2021-11-02 2021-11-02 2021-11-02 2 November 2021 1202 rebmevoN 2 20-11-1202 20-11-1202 20-11-1202   gro.aire@anidiluam.anil anidiluaM aniL sM        ;psbn&WON RETSIGER

skramer gnisolC


MP 03:21 ;hsadn& MP 51:21




.PECR yb detaerc seitinutroppo lanoiger ot dnopser ot ekila sEMSM dna slaiciffo cilbup fo yticapac eht esaercni ot snoitca pu-wollof elbissop ssucsid ot weiv a htiw ,noitatnemelpmi PECR fo ,yldaorb erom ,dna ecremmoc-e no eugolaid etavirp-cilbup ecnahne ot kees lliw noisses ehT

aidobmaC rof naeM yehT tahW dna snoisivorP ecremmoC-E PECR ehT :1 eugolaiD etavirP-cilbuP ,tnemeergA PECR eht gnikcapnU aidobmaC rof naeM yehT tahW dna snoisivorP ecremmoC-E PECR ehT :1 eugolaiD etavirP-cilbuP ,tnemeergA PECR eht gnikcapnU aidobmaC rof naeM yehT tahW dna snoisivorP ecremmoC-E PECR ehT :1 eugolaiD etavirP-cilbuP ,tnemeergA PECR eht gnikcapnU";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-10-19 13:33:29";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-10-28 18:05:12";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:38;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11269";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6470";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:77:"esi-webinar-episode-9-sustainability-and-entrepreneurship-past-present-future";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:79:"ESI Webinar Episode 9: Sustainability and Entrepreneurship: Past-Present-Future";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-10-21";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:2592:"<p><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/Photo%20Flyer%20-%20ESI9.jpg" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p><strong>ERIA Webinar Series #9 - &#039;Entrepreneurship, Start-Ups and Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for The Post-Pandemic Recovery&#039;</strong></p><p>The COVID-19 pandemic has brought about heightened scrutiny on climate change agendas and sustainability practices. Entrepreneurs whose focus revolves around sustainability have also come to the forefront in recent years. What future opportunities await Sustainability Entrepreneurship and how will it drive post-pandemic recovery? Join us in conversation as our 4 speakers share their thoughts on this topic of growing interest.</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Thursday, 21 October 2021, 2:00&nbsp;PM to 3:15 PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><table><tr><td width="141"><p><strong>TIME</strong></p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>AGENDA</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td width="141"><p>2.00 &ndash; 3.15 PM</p></td><td width="459"><p><strong>Closing Remarks and End of Webinar</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sustainability-entrepreneurship-past-present-and-future-tickets-189451704147?keep_tld=1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-10-21";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-10-21";s:8:"keywords";s:3809:"ESI Webinar Episode 9: Sustainability and Entrepreneurship: Past-Present-Future ESI Webinar Episode 9: Sustainability and Entrepreneurship: Past-Present-Future ERIA Webinar Series #9 - 'Entrepreneurship, Start-Ups and Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for The Post-Pandemic Recovery'
The COVID-19 pandemic has brought about heightened scrutiny on climate change agendas and sustainability practices. Entrepreneurs whose focus revolves around sustainability have also come to the forefront in recent years. What future opportunities await Sustainability Entrepreneurship and how will it drive post-pandemic recovery? Join us in conversation as our 4 speakers share their thoughts on this topic of growing interest.
Date and Time:
Thursday, 21 October 2021, 2:00&nbsp;PM to 3:15 PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)




TIME


AGENDA




2.00 &ndash; 2.05 PM


Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks
Giulia Ajmone Marsan
Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA




2.05 &ndash; 3.00 PM


Panel Discussion 
Speakers:

Chan Mun Wei,&nbsp;Founder and Principal Consultant, SustainableSG, Singapore
Jeong Hyop Lee,&nbsp;Senior Advisor, Deep Science and Tech Programme Management Unit for Competitiveness Thailand
Ayako Mizuno,&nbsp;Programme Manager, Regional Knowledge Centre for Marine Plastic Debris (RKC-MPD), ERIA
Nicola Crosta,&nbsp;Founder and CEO, Impact46, Thailand

Moderated by OOI Tiat Jin (TJ)
Founder &amp; Principal Consultant, Curated Connectors, Singapore




3.00 &ndash; 3.10PM


Q &amp; A
Moderated by Lina Maulidina Sabrina
Programme Officer, ERIA




3.10 &ndash; 3.15 PM


Closing Remarks and End of Webinar

on the occasion of the annual meeting of the World Health Organization Regional Commission for the Western Pacific to be held in Himeji, Japan at the end of October this year. This event will be streamed online via Zoom webinar.</p><ul><li>Date: Wednesday, 27 October 2021</li><li>Time: 3:30 PM to 5 PM (Hanoi time, UTC+7) or 5:30 PM to 7 PM (Tokyo time, UTC+9)</li><li>Format: Zoom webinar, RSVP is required</li><li>Language: English</li></ul></div><div class="structured-content-rich-text structured-content__module l-align-left l-mar-vert-6 l-sm-mar-vert-4 text-body-medium"><p><strong>Opening Remarks</strong></p><p>The representative of Medical Excellence&nbsp;JAPAN</p><p><strong>Keynote Address</strong></p><ol><li data-key="369"><span data-key="370">For the Future, the Role of Viet Nam and Japan in the Western Pacific Region: Dr Takeshi Kasai (WHO Regional Director for the Western Pacific)</span></li><li data-key="371" data-slate-fragment=""><span data-key="372">Health Development in Viet Nam:&nbsp;Vice Minister H.E. Mr Nguyen Truong Son, Ministry of Health of Viet Nam</span></li></ol><p><strong>Panel Discussion</strong></p><p>Moderator: Dr Mitsuhiro Ushio, former Health Policy Advisor to Ministry of Health, Viet Nam</p><p><strong>Panellist</strong></p><ol><li>Dr Pham Nguyen Quy, M.D., Ph.D., Department of Medical Oncology, Kyoto Miniren Central Hospital, Kyoto University, Y hoc cong</li><li>Ms Pham Thi Minh Chau, Deputy Director, International Cooperation Department, Ministry of Health, Viet Nam</li><li>Mr Yukinori Tominaga, Chairperson of Japanese Pharmaceutical Alliance in Viet Nam</li><li>Dr Koji Wada, Professor, Department of Public Health, Faculty of Medicine, International University of Health and Welfare</li></ol><p><strong>Special Advice</strong></p><p>Dr Tran Thi Giang Huong (Director, Program for Disease Control, WHO WPRO)</p><p><strong>Concluding Remarks</strong></p><p>Dr Hiroki Nakatani (Special Advisor to the President of ERIA)</p></div><div class="structured-content-rich-text structured-content__module l-align-left l-mar-vert-6 l-sm-mar-vert-4 text-body-medium"><p><strong>Organised by</strong></p><ul><li>Medical Excellence JAPAN (MEJ)</li><li>Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li></ul><p><strong>Supported by&nbsp;</strong></p><ul><li>Viet Nam: Ministry of Health</li><li>Japan: Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry</li></ul><p class="pdf"><a href="https://bit.ly/3pCJ0U1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Programme and&nbsp;Speakers&#039; Bio</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="Click here to register on Eventbrite" href="https://bit.ly/FCHSVJ" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Register Now</a></p></div>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Monde Maharani";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:12:"MEJ and ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-10-27";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-10-27";s:8:"keywords";s:4665:"Further Collaboration in Healthcare Sector between Viet Nam and Japan Further Collaboration in Healthcare Sector between Viet Nam and Japan Medical Excellence JAPAN (MEJ) and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), given the importance and potential of Viet Nam-Japan cooperation in the healthcare sector, will organise a bilateral side event entitled 'Further Collaboration in Healthcare Sector between Vietnam and Japan' on the occasion of the annual meeting of the World Health Organization Regional Commission for the Western Pacific to be held in Himeji, Japan at the end of October this year. This event will be streamed online via Zoom webinar.

Date: Wednesday, 27 October 2021
Time: 3:30 PM to 5 PM (Hanoi time, UTC+7) or 5:30 PM to 7 PM (Tokyo time, UTC+9)
Format: Zoom webinar, RSVP is required
Language: English



Opening Remarks
The representative of Medical Excellence&nbsp;JAPAN
Keynote Address

For the Future, the Role of Viet Nam and Japan in the Western Pacific Region: Dr Takeshi Kasai (WHO Regional Director for the Western Pacific)
Health Development in Viet Nam:&nbsp;Vice Minister H.E. Mr Nguyen Truong Son, Ministry of Health of Viet Nam

Panel Discussion
Moderator: Dr Mitsuhiro Ushio, former Health Policy Advisor to Ministry of Health, Viet Nam
Panellist

Dr Pham Nguyen Quy, M.D., Ph.D., Department of Medical Oncology, Kyoto Miniren Central Hospital, Kyoto University, Y hoc cong
Ms Pham Thi Minh Chau, Deputy Director, International Cooperation Department, Ministry of Health, Viet Nam
Mr Yukinori Tominaga, Chairperson of Japanese Pharmaceutical Alliance in Viet Nam
Dr Koji Wada, Professor, Department of Public Health, Faculty of Medicine, International University of Health and Welfare

Special Advice
Dr Tran Thi Giang Huong (Director, Program for Disease Control, WHO WPRO)
Concluding Remarks
Dr Hiroki Nakatani (Special Advisor to the President of ERIA)


Organised by

Medical Excellence JAPAN (MEJ)
Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)

Supported by&nbsp;

Viet Nam: Ministry of Health
Japan: Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry

Programme and&nbsp;Speakers' Bio

1202 rebotcO 72 ,yadsendeW :etaD

.ranibew mooZ aiv enilno demaerts eb lliw tneve sihT .raey siht rebotcO fo dne eht ta napaJ ,ijemiH ni dleh eb ot cificaP nretseW eht rof noissimmoC lanoigeR noitazinagrO htlaeH dlroW eht fo gniteem launna eht fo noisacco eht no 'napaJ dna manteiV neewteb rotceS erachtlaeH ni noitaroballoC rehtruF' deltitne tneve edis laretalib a esinagro lliw ,rotces erachtlaeh eht ni noitarepooc napaJ-maN teiV Partners";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-10-06";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:0:"";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual of ERIA Member States and Dialogue Partners Ambassadors Meeting of ERIA Member States and Dialogue Partners        Virtual Room  Ms Sarah Tavia  sarah.tavia@eria.org   2021-10-06 2021-10-06 2021-10-06 6 October 2021 1202 rebotcO 6 60-01-1202 60-01-1202 60-01-1202   gro.aire@aivat.haras  aivaT haraS sM  mooR lautriV        srentraP eugolaiD dna setatS rebmeM AIRE fo gniteeM srodassabmA srentraP eugolaiD dna setatS rebmeM AIRE fo gniteeM srodassabmA";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-10-06 10:38:28";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-10-06 10:38:28";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:20:"sarah.tavia@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:42;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"11161";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6445";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:23:"ccus-technical-workshop";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:23:"CCUS Technical Workshop";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-10-05";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:8080:"<p class="preFlex flexIn">The Asia CCUS Network has been successfully launched on 22-23rd June 2021 with initially 13 countries (all ASEAN member countries, the United States, Australia, and Japan) and more than 100 international organisations, companies, financial and research institutions that share the vision of CCUS development throughout the Asian region. The Network members have expressed their intention to participate to share the vision of the Asia CCUS Network that aims to contribute to the decarbonisation of emissions in Asia through collaboration and cooperation on development and deployment of CCUS. The mission of this network is to facilitate deployment of CCUS through: (i) promoting knowledge sharing through holding an annual forum, conferences, workshops, and meetings; (ii) conducting research studies on technical, economical, and legal standards of CCUS in the EAS region; and (iii) holding capacity building training workshops to bridge the knowledge gap on CCUS. The Asia CCUS Network provides opportunities for countries in the region to work and collaborate on the low emission technology partnership that will eventually help to build countries&rsquo; capability to lower the cost of CCUS technology and its deployment through collaboration of research and innovation.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">At the 1st Asia CCUS Network Forum held on 22-23 June 2021, it was concluded that CCUS and Carbon Recycling are crucial technologies for the ASEAN region to achieve carbon neutrality amidst climate and energy security concerns in the future. It was also discussed by the stakeholders that participated in the Forum, that in order to bring more CCUS projects to commercialization stage, issues, such as the lack of an adequate legal framework to address liability and a technical framework through pilot projects need to be resolved. Moreover, it is expected that in order to accelerate the deployment of CCUS in ASEAN region, there is a need to bridge the gap and to implement knowledge and experience sharing amongst the ASEAN and Asian region.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Building upon the outcome of the 1st Asia CCUS Network Forum as described above, the Asia CCUS Network (ACN) will organize a virtual technical workshop about CCUS in the October 2021. This workshop hosted by ACN aims to serve as an opportunity to instill knowledge about latest technologies and the current trend of CCUS through real case studies by top notch lecturers.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">The goals of the CCUS technical workshops are as follows.</p><ul data-rte-list="default"><li><p class="preFlex flexIn">Promote the knowledge sharing on the latest CCUS technology through lecture session.</p></li><li><p class="preFlex flexIn">Accelerate further consideration of application of mainstream CCUS technologies to ASEAN region.</p></li><li><p class="preFlex flexIn">Exchange ideas and issues about CCUS technology.</p></li></ul><p class="preFlex flexIn">There will be a total of three workshops to be organized. The 1st day of the workshop is about the technical aspect of carbon capture technology. The 2nd day is the technical aspect of transport &amp; storage technology. The 3rd day will be about the utilization of CO2.</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>DAY 1 -&nbsp;CCUS Technical Workshop: Technical Aspect of Carbon Capture Technology</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Tuesday, 5 October 2021&nbsp;</p><h4 class="preFlex flexIn">Agenda</h4><p class="preFlex flexIn"><em>(as of 22 September 2021)</em></p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>Technical Workshop 1: Technical Aspect of Carbon Capture Technology</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">(Jakarta Time, UTC+7)</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:00-9:15 <strong>Opening Remarks (Overview of Asia CCUS Network) </strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Dr Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist of ERIA</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:15-9:30 <strong>Introduction to capacity building and overview of CCUS business development in Asia</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:30-10:10 <strong>Overview of carbon capture technologies. Their advantages and disadvantages.</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Dr David Kearns, Principal Consultant-CCS technology, GCCSI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">10:10-10:50 <strong>Case Study on chemical absorption technologies</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">(TBC) Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Engineering</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">10:50-11:00 <strong>Closing Speech</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><a class="bluebtn" title="https://bit.ly/CCUSTW1" href="https://bit.ly/CCUSTW1" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER&nbsp;</a></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">&nbsp;<strong>DAY 2 &nbsp;-&nbsp;CCUS Technical Workshop: Technical Aspect of Carbon Transportation &amp; Storage Technology&nbsp;</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Wednesday, 6 October 2021&nbsp;</p><h4 class="preFlex flexIn">Agenda</h4><p class="preFlex flexIn">(as of 16 September 2021)</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>Technical Workshop 2: Technical aspect of carbon transportation &amp; storage technology </strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">(Jakarta Time)</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:00-9:15 <strong>Opening Remarks (Overview of Asia CCUS Network)</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Dr Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist of ERIA</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:15-9:30 <strong>Introduction to capacity building and overview of CCUS business development in Asia</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:30-10:10 <strong>Overview of marine / pipeline transportation technologies (TBC)</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mr Ulysses Coulmas, Researcher, MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">10:10-10:50 <strong>Overview of storage technologies </strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Dr Ziqiu&nbsp;Xue, Chief researcher, CO2 Storage Technology Group, <br /> Research Institute for Innovative Technologies for the Earth (RITE)</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">10:50-11:00 <strong>Closing Speech</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/CCUSTW2" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER&nbsp;</a></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Agenda</h4><p class="preFlex flexIn"><em>(as of 22 September 2021)</em></p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><strong>Technical Workshop3: Utilization of CO2</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">(Jakarta Time)</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:00-9:15<strong> Opening Remarks (Overview of Asia CCUS Network)</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Dr Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist of ERIA</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:15-9:30 <strong>Introduction to capacity building and overview of CCUS business development in Asia</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">9:30-10:10 <strong>Research activities of CCU technologies in Indonesia</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Ms Dewi Mersitarini, Advisor CCUS, Pertamina RTC, Indonesia</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">10:10-10:50 <strong>CO2 Utilization Research Activities and Potential Industrial Application</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mr Ning Yan, Dean&rsquo;s Chair Associate Professor, Head of Green Catalysis Lab, National University of Singapore</p><p class="preFlex flexIn">10:50-11:00 <strong>Closing Speech</strong></p><p class="preFlex flexIn">Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI</p><p class="preFlex flexIn"><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/CCUSTW3" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:15:"Ms Tri Mulianik";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-10-05";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-10-07";s:8:"keywords";s:11537:"CCUS Technical Workshop CCUS Technical Workshop The Asia CCUS Network has been successfully launched on 22-23rd June 2021 with initially 13 countries (all ASEAN member countries, the United States, Australia, and Japan) and more than 100 international organisations, companies, financial and research institutions that share the vision of CCUS development throughout the Asian region. The Network members have expressed their intention to participate to share the vision of the Asia CCUS Network that aims to contribute to the decarbonisation of emissions in Asia through collaboration and cooperation on development and deployment of CCUS. The mission of this network is to facilitate deployment of CCUS through: (i) promoting knowledge sharing through holding an annual forum, conferences, workshops, and meetings; (ii) conducting research studies on technical, economical, and legal standards of CCUS in the EAS region; and (iii) holding capacity building training workshops to bridge the knowledge gap on CCUS. The Asia CCUS Network provides opportunities for countries in the region to work and collaborate on the low emission technology partnership that will eventually help to build countries&rsquo; capability to lower the cost of CCUS technology and its deployment through collaboration of research and innovation.
At the 1st Asia CCUS Network Forum held on 22-23 June 2021, it was concluded that CCUS and Carbon Recycling are crucial technologies for the ASEAN region to achieve carbon neutrality amidst climate and energy security concerns in the future. It was also discussed by the stakeholders that participated in the Forum, that in order to bring more CCUS projects to commercialization stage, issues, such as the lack of an adequate legal framework to address liability and a technical framework through pilot projects need to be resolved. Moreover, it is expected that in order to accelerate the deployment of CCUS in ASEAN region, there is a need to bridge the gap and to implement knowledge and experience sharing amongst the ASEAN and Asian region.
Building upon the outcome of the 1st Asia CCUS Network Forum as described above, the Asia CCUS Network (ACN) will organize a virtual technical workshop about CCUS in the October 2021. This workshop hosted by ACN aims to serve as an opportunity to instill knowledge about latest technologies and the current trend of CCUS through real case studies by top notch lecturers.
The goals of the CCUS technical workshops are as follows.


Promote the knowledge sharing on the latest CCUS technology through lecture session.


Accelerate further consideration of application of mainstream CCUS technologies to ASEAN region.


Exchange ideas and issues about CCUS technology.


There will be a total of three workshops to be organized. The 1st day of the workshop is about the technical aspect of carbon capture technology. The 2nd day is the technical aspect of transport &amp; storage technology. The 3rd day will be about the utilization of CO2.
DAY 1 -&nbsp;CCUS Technical Workshop: Technical Aspect of Carbon Capture Technology
Tuesday, 5 October 2021&nbsp;
Agenda
(as of 22 September 2021)
Technical Workshop 1: Technical Aspect of Carbon Capture Technology
(Jakarta Time, UTC+7)
9:00-9:15 Opening Remarks (Overview of Asia CCUS Network) 
Dr Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist of ERIA
9:15-9:30 Introduction to capacity building and overview of CCUS business development in Asia
Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI
9:30-10:10 Overview of carbon capture technologies. Their advantages and disadvantages.
Dr David Kearns, Principal Consultant-CCS technology, GCCSI
10:10-10:50 Case Study on chemical absorption technologies
(TBC) Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Engineering
10:50-11:00 Closing Speech
Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI
REGISTER&nbsp;
&nbsp;DAY 2 &nbsp;-&nbsp;CCUS Technical Workshop: Technical Aspect of Carbon Transportation &amp; Storage Technology&nbsp;
Wednesday, 6 October 2021&nbsp;
Agenda
(as of 16 September 2021)
Technical Workshop 2: Technical aspect of carbon transportation &amp; storage technology 
(Jakarta Time)
9:00-9:15 Opening Remarks (Overview of Asia CCUS Network)
Dr Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist of ERIA
9:15-9:30 Introduction to capacity building and overview of CCUS business development in Asia
Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI
9:30-10:10 Overview of marine / pipeline transportation technologies (TBC)
Mr Ulysses Coulmas, Researcher, MRI
10:10-10:50 Overview of storage technologies 
Dr Ziqiu&nbsp;Xue, Chief researcher, CO2 Storage Technology Group,  Research Institute for Innovative Technologies for the Earth (RITE)
10:50-11:00 Closing Speech
Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI
REGISTER&nbsp;
&nbsp;DAY 3&nbsp; -&nbsp;CCUS Technical Workshop:&nbsp;Utilisation of CO2
Thursday, 7 October 2021&nbsp;
Agenda
(as of 22 September 2021)
Technical Workshop3: Utilization of CO2
(Jakarta Time)
9:00-9:15 Opening Remarks (Overview of Asia CCUS Network)
Dr Han Phoumin, Senior Energy Economist of ERIA
9:15-9:30 Introduction to capacity building and overview of CCUS business development in Asia
Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI
9:30-10:10 Research activities of CCU technologies in Indonesia
Ms Dewi Mersitarini, Advisor CCUS, Pertamina RTC, Indonesia
10:10-10:50 CO2 Utilization Research Activities and Potential Industrial Application
Mr Ning Yan, Dean&rsquo;s Chair Associate Professor, Head of Green Catalysis Lab, National University of Singapore
10:50-11:00 Closing Speech
Mrs Kikuko Shinchi, Senior Researcher of MRI
REGISTER&nbsp;       Virtual Room Ms Tri Mulianik tri.manik@eria.org   2021-10-05 2021-10-07 2021-10-05 5 October 2021 1202 rebotcO 5 50-01-1202 70-01-1202 50-01-1202   gro.aire@kinam.irt kinailuM irT sM mooR lautriV       ;psbn&RETSIGER
