NAESA'";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-04-12 15:56:40";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-04-19 10:13:59";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:24:"isabella.italia@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:54;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"10157";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6171";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:48:"oecd-eria-gohe-in-conversation-with-ms-danit-gal";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:48:"OECD-ERIA GoHE in Conversation with Ms Danit Gal";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-04-14";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"4";s:7:"content";s:2079:"<p>&nbsp;</p><p><img src="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/ERIA-OECD-GoHe-12th.jpg" alt="" width="900" height="450" /></p><p>The OECD together with the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) is pleased to invite you to join the 12<sup>th</sup>&nbsp;of a series of webinars with prominent international experts.&nbsp;</p><p>In a 45-minute event (including Q&amp;A), we will discuss with Danit about complementary skills for AI, the role HEIs can play promoting these skills, and the ethics of AI.</p><p>This meeting will be held in English.</p><h2>About the Speaker&nbsp;</h2><p><em>Danit Gal is an Associate Fellow at the Leverhulme Centre for the Future of Intelligence at the University of Cambridge, UK, and Visiting Research Fellow at the S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies at the Nanyang Technological University, in Singapore. She is interested in technology ethics, geopolitics, governance, safety, and security. Previously, she was Technology Advisor at the United Nations, leading work on AI in the implementation of the United Nations Secretary-General&#039;s Roadmap for Digital Cooperation. Danit serves as the vice chair of the P7009 IEEE standard on the Fail-Safe Design of Autonomous and Semi-Autonomous Systems. She also serves on the Executive Committee of the IEEE Global Initiative on Ethics of Autonomous and Intelligent Systems, and as Founding Editor and Editorial Board member of Springer&rsquo;s AI and Ethics journal, Advisory Board Member of the AI&amp; Equality initiative at the Carnegie Council for Ethics in International Affairs, Executive Committee Member of the AI4SDGs Cooperation Network at the Beijing Academy of AI, and Advisory Board Member of EPSRC and UKRI&lsquo;s Trustworthy Autonomous Systems Verifiability Node.</em></p><h2>Date and Time&nbsp;</h2><p>Wednesday, 14 April 2021, 15.00 (CET)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://meetoecd1.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJEsf-CtrD8pG9wafXxuWbJRE7pW48Z5TuZx" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-04-14";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-04-14";s:8:"keywords";s:3837:"OECD-ERIA GoHE in Conversation with Ms Danit Gal OECD-ERIA GoHE in Conversation with Ms Danit Gal &nbsp;

The OECD together with the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) is pleased to invite you to join the 12th&nbsp;of a series of webinars with prominent international experts.&nbsp;
In a 45-minute event (including Q&amp;A), we will discuss with Danit about complementary skills for AI, the role HEIs can play promoting these skills, and the ethics of AI.
This meeting will be held in English.
About the Speaker&nbsp;
Danit Gal is an Associate Fellow at the Leverhulme Centre for the Future of Intelligence at the University of Cambridge, UK, and Visiting Research Fellow at the S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies at the Nanyang Technological University, in Singapore. She is interested in technology ethics, geopolitics, governance, safety, and security. Previously, she was Technology Advisor at the United Nations, leading work on AI in the implementation of the United Nations Secretary-General's Roadmap for Digital Cooperation. Danit serves as the vice chair of the P7009 IEEE standard on the Fail-Safe Design of Autonomous and Semi-Autonomous Systems. She also serves on the Executive Committee of the IEEE Global Initiative on Ethics of Autonomous and Intelligent Systems, and as Founding Editor and Editorial Board member of Springer&rsquo;s AI and Ethics journal, Advisory Board Member of the AI&amp; Equality initiative at the Carnegie Council for Ethics in International Affairs, Executive Committee Member of the AI4SDGs Cooperation Network at the Beijing Academy of AI, and Advisory Board Member of EPSRC and UKRI&lsquo;s Trustworthy Autonomous Systems Verifiability Node.
Date and Time&nbsp;
Wednesday, 14 April 2021, 15.00 (CET)
REGISTER NOW&nbsp;       Virtual Room  Ms Lina Maulidina lina.maulidina@eria.org   2021-04-14 2021-04-14 2021-04-14 14 April 2021 1202 lirpA 41 41-40-1202 41-40-1202 41-40-1202   gro.aire@anidiluam.anil anidiluaM aniL sM  mooR lautriV       ;psbn&WON RETSIGER
)TEC( 00.51 ,1202 lirpA 41 ,yadsendeW
;psbn&emiT dna etaD
.edoN ytilibaifireV smetsyS suomonotuA yhtrowtsurT s;ouqsl&IRKU dna CRSPE fo rebmeM draoB yrosivdA dna ,IA fo ymedacA gnijieB eht ta krowteN noitarepooC sGDS4IA eht fo rebmeM eettimmoC evitucexE ,sriaffA lanoitanretnI ni scihtE rof licnuoC eigenraC eht ta evitaitini ytilauqE ;pma&IA eht fo rebmeM draoB yrosivdA ,lanruoj scihtE dna IA s;ouqsr&regnirpS fo rebmem draoB lairotidE dna rotidE gnidnuoF sa dna ,smetsyS tnegilletnI dna suomonotuA fo scihtE no evitaitinI labolG EEEI eht fo eettimmoC evitucexE eht no sevres osla ehS .smetsyS suomonotuA-imeS dna suomonotuA fo ngiseD efaS-liaF eht no dradnats EEEI 9007P eht fo riahc eciv eht sa sevres tinaD .noitarepooC latigiD rof pamdaoR s'lareneG-yraterceS snoitaN detinU eht fo noitatnemelpmi eht ni IA no krow gnidael ,snoitaN detinU eht ta rosivdA ygolonhceT saw ehs ,ylsuoiverP .ytiruces dna ,ytefas ,ecnanrevog ,scitilopoeg ,scihte ygolonhcet ni detseretni si ehS .eropagniS ni ,ytisrevinU lacigolonhceT gnaynaN eht ta seidutS lanoitanretnI fo loohcS mantarajaR .S eht ta wolleF hcraeseR gnitisiV dna ,KU ,egdirbmaC fo ytisrevinU eht ta ecnegilletnI fo erutuF eht rof ertneC emluhreveL eht ta wolleF etaicossA na si laG tinaD

.hsilgnE ni dleh eb lliw gniteem sihT

RCEP Tariff Commitment from AHTN 2012 into AHTN 2017 online workshop with MOIC  Transposition of RCEP Tariff Commitment from AHTN 2012 into AHTN 2017 online workshop with MOIC          Ms Sheila Fathiya sheila.fathiya@eria.org   2021-04-05 2021-04-06 2021-04-05 5 April 2021 1202 lirpA 5 50-40-1202 60-40-1202 50-40-1202   gro.aire@ayihtaf.aliehs ayihtaF aliehS sM          CIOM htiw pohskrow enilno 7102 NTHA otni 2102 NTHA morf tnemtimmoC ffiraT PECR fo noitisopsnarT  CIOM htiw pohskrow enilno 7102 NTHA otni 2102 NTHA morf tnemtimmoC ffiraT PECR fo noitisopsnarT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-04-08 11:17:40";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-04-08 11:17:40";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"sheila.fathiya@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:61;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"10134";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6158";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:114:"women-participation-in-the-digital-economy-improving-access-to-skills-entrepreneurship-and-leadership-across-asean";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:117:"Women Participation in the Digital Economy: Improving Access to Skills, Entrepreneurship, and Leadership Across ASEAN";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-04-13";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"4";s:7:"content";s:2132:"<p>The Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) has recently released a <a href="/publications/gender-digital-equality-across-asean/">discussion paper</a> and a <a href="/publications/womens-participation-in-the-digital-economy-improving-access-to-skills-entrepreneurship-and-leadership-across-asean/">policy brief</a> on the participation of women in the digital economy across ASEAN. The issue of equal participation in the digital economy is particularly important for the ASEAN region, one of the fastest-growing digital economies in the world, whose growth has been accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic. With a growing proportion of our daily activities moving online, equal access to digital technology and participation in online professional activities is key to an inclusive post-pandemic recovery, as recently highlighted in the <a href="https://asean.org/asean-comprehensive-recovery-framework-implementation-plan/">ASEAN Comprehensive Recovery Framework (ACRF).</a> And equal access means the same opportunities to compete, thrive and access leadership positions.</p><p>To discuss, debate and disseminate the findings of these two recent publications, ERIA is organizing two dissemination events to take place on the 13<sup>th</sup> and the 15<sup>th</sup> of April 2021. The preliminary agenda of the events are detailed below. The target audience for the event is composed by regional policymakers, business sector representatives, analysts in think tanks and academia.</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>DAY 1: 13 April 2021, 1 PM to 2 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p>DAY 2: 15 April 2021, 1 PM to 2.30 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Agenda_women%20in%20the%20digital%20economy%20dissemination%2013%20%2015%20April%20Dialogue%20and%20Roundtable.pdf">PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/31Ng2Us" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-04-13";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-04-15";s:8:"keywords";s:3543:"Women Participation in the Digital Economy: Improving Access to Skills, Entrepreneurship, and Leadership Across ASEAN Women Participation in the Digital Economy: Improving Access to Skills, Entrepreneurship, and Leadership Across ASEAN The Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) has recently released a discussion paper and a policy brief on the participation of women in the digital economy across ASEAN. The issue of equal participation in the digital economy is particularly important for the ASEAN region, one of the fastest-growing digital economies in the world, whose growth has been accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic. With a growing proportion of our daily activities moving online, equal access to digital technology and participation in online professional activities is key to an inclusive post-pandemic recovery, as recently highlighted in the ASEAN Comprehensive Recovery Framework (ACRF). And equal access means the same opportunities to compete, thrive and access leadership positions.
To discuss, debate and disseminate the findings of these two recent publications, ERIA is organizing two dissemination events to take place on the 13th and the 15th of April 2021. The preliminary agenda of the events are detailed below. The target audience for the event is composed by regional policymakers, business sector representatives, analysts in think tanks and academia.
Date and Time:
DAY 1: 13 April 2021, 1 PM to 2 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
DAY 2: 15 April 2021, 1 PM to 2.30 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)
PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;

latigiD eht ni noitapicitraP nemoW";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-04-05 14:48:23";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-04-06 15:48:15";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:62;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"10052";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6137";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:76:"international-webinar-building-dementia-friendly-communities-in-asia-pacific";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:77:"International Webinar: Building Dementia-Friendly Communities in Asia Pacific";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-03-25";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"3";s:7:"content";s:2597:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/AHWN-Webinar.png" alt="" width="800" height="450" /></p><p><strong>Invitation to the International Webinar&nbsp;</strong><strong>&ldquo;Building Dementia-Friendly Communities in Asia Pacific&rdquo;</strong></p><p>As we face an era of global aging, the number of people living with dementia is projected to double by 2040, and the majority will be living in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs). Such regions have fewer of the resources needed to cope with dementia-related care compared to high-income countries. As the disease progresses, increasing care and support is needed for people with dementia and their caregivers. The World Health Organization (WHO) states that &ldquo;increasing public awareness, acceptance and understanding of dementia and making the societal environment friendly will enable people with dementia to participate in the community and maximize their autonomy through improved social participation.&rdquo;</p><p>&nbsp;In order to help explore this issue, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), JCIE, and the Health and Global Policy Institute (HGPI) have come to together to host a webinar bringing together a panel of experts from Indonesia, Japan, and the United States. These experts will share the latest insights on how the global community can work hand-in-hand to promote dementia-friendly communities in ways that make sense for LMICs and HICs alike.</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Wednesday, March 24 (US) | Friday, March 25 (Asia)</p><p>10:00&ndash;11:00 pm EDT | 9:00 am ICT (GMT+7) | 11:00 am JST (GMT+9)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><strong>Moderator:</strong></p><ul><li>Ryoji Noritake, CEO, Board Member, Health and Global Policy Institute</li></ul><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Rajiv Ahuja, Associate Director, Milken Institute Center for the Future of Aging</li><li>Ryoma Kayano, Technical Officer, WHO Centre for Health Development (WHO Kobe Centre)</li><li><p>DY Suharya, Regional Director, Alzheimer&rsquo;s Disease International (ADI) Asia Pacific Region; Founder, Alzheimer&rsquo;s Indonesia</p></li></ul><p><strong>Co-hosts:</strong></p><ul><li>Kim Ashizawa, Senior Advisor, Japan Center for International Exchange&nbsp;</li><li>Osuke Komazawa, Special Advisor on Healthcare &amp; Long-Term Care Policy, ERIA</li></ul><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/ahwinwebinar0321" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:14:"Ms Nanda Putri";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-03-25";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-03-25";s:8:"keywords";s:4789:"International Webinar: Building Dementia-Friendly Communities in Asia Pacific International Webinar: Building Dementia-Friendly Communities in Asia Pacific Invitation to the International Webinar&nbsp;&ldquo;Building Dementia-Friendly Communities in Asia Pacific&rdquo;
As we face an era of global aging, the number of people living with dementia is projected to double by 2040, and the majority will be living in low- and middle-income countries (LMICs). Such regions have fewer of the resources needed to cope with dementia-related care compared to high-income countries. As the disease progresses, increasing care and support is needed for people with dementia and their caregivers. The World Health Organization (WHO) states that &ldquo;increasing public awareness, acceptance and understanding of dementia and making the societal environment friendly will enable people with dementia to participate in the community and maximize their autonomy through improved social participation.&rdquo;
&nbsp;In order to help explore this issue, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), JCIE, and the Health and Global Policy Institute (HGPI) have come to together to host a webinar bringing together a panel of experts from Indonesia, Japan, and the United States. These experts will share the latest insights on how the global community can work hand-in-hand to promote dementia-friendly communities in ways that make sense for LMICs and HICs alike.
Date and Time:
Wednesday, March 24 (US) | Friday, March 25 (Asia)
10:00&ndash;11:00 pm EDT | 9:00 am ICT (GMT+7) | 11:00 am JST (GMT+9)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)
Moderator:

Ryoji Noritake, CEO, Board Member, Health and Global Policy Institute

Speakers:

Rajiv Ahuja, Associate Director, Milken Institute Center for the Future of Aging
Ryoma Kayano, Technical Officer, WHO Centre for Health Development (WHO Kobe Centre)

DY Suharya, Regional Director, Alzheimer&rsquo;s Disease International (ADI) Asia Pacific Region; Founder, Alzheimer&rsquo;s Indonesia


Co-hosts:

Kim Ashizawa, Senior Advisor, Japan Center for International Exchange&nbsp;
Osuke Komazawa, Special Advisor on Healthcare &amp; Long-Term Care Policy, ERIA

;ouqdr&cificaP aisA ni seitinummoC yldneirF-aitnemeD gnidliuB;ouqdl&;psbn&ranibeW lanoitanretnI eht ot noitativnI cificaP aisA ni seitinummoC yldneirF-aitnemeD gnidliuB :ranibeW lanoitanretnI cificaP aisA ni seitinummoC yldneirF-aitnemeD gnidliuB :ranibeW lanoitanretnI";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-03-17 15:32:47";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-03-17 15:48:36";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:20:"nanda.putri@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:63;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:5:"10967";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6125";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:62:"from-resilience-to-success-entrepreneurial-mindsets-and-skills";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:63:"From Resilience to Success: Entrepreneurial Mindsets and Skills";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-04-01";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"4";s:7:"content";s:3029:"<p><img src="/uploads/media/Events/2021-ESI2-V1.png" alt="" width="800" height="400" /></p><p><strong>ERIA Webinar Series &ndash; Episode #2 Entrepreneurship, Start-ups, Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for The Post-Pandemic Recovery - From Resilience to Success - Entrepreneurial Mindsets and Skills</strong></p><p>During the peak of the pandemic in 2020, entrepreneurs had to learn to adapt and be resilient as many businesses were plunged into an unknown future. Navigating the new normal to ensure survival became the key priority.&nbsp;</p><p>With the turn of the new year and as we enter the second quarter of 2021, the gears have shifted even as vaccination programmes around the world go into full swing. Entrepreneurs have similarly begun shifting gears to position their businesses to move beyond resilience to succeeding in a post-pandemic world. Join us as we dive into the mindsets and skills that they need to embrace for recovery and an increasingly unpredictable world.&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Thursday, 1 April 2021, 2 PM to 3:15 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><strong>Welcome Remark:</strong></p><ul><li>Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director of Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Raffaele Trapaso, Economist, OECD</li><li>Jeff Sandhu,&nbsp;Head of 42 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia</li><li>Stefan Ye, Events Experience, Compass Events, Singapore</li><li>Sinn Chanserei Sophea,&nbsp;Founder and Managing Director of SinnC Creative Solutions, Cambodia</li></ul><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;" href="/uploads/media/Events/2021-ERIA-Webinar-Talk-%232-Agenda-v1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-04-01";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:3901:"From Resilience to Success: Entrepreneurial Mindsets and Skills From Resilience to Success: Entrepreneurial Mindsets and Skills ERIA Webinar Series &ndash; Episode #2 Entrepreneurship, Start-ups, Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for The Post-Pandemic Recovery - From Resilience to Success - Entrepreneurial Mindsets and Skills
During the peak of the pandemic in 2020, entrepreneurs had to learn to adapt and be resilient as many businesses were plunged into an unknown future. Navigating the new normal to ensure survival became the key priority.&nbsp;
With the turn of the new year and as we enter the second quarter of 2021, the gears have shifted even as vaccination programmes around the world go into full swing. Entrepreneurs have similarly begun shifting gears to position their businesses to move beyond resilience to succeeding in a post-pandemic world. Join us as we dive into the mindsets and skills that they need to embrace for recovery and an increasingly unpredictable world.&nbsp;
Date and Time:
Thursday, 1 April 2021, 2 PM to 3:15 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)
Welcome Remark:

Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director of Strategy and Partnership, ERIA

Speakers:

Raffaele Trapaso, Economist, OECD
Jeff Sandhu,&nbsp;Head of 42 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Stefan Ye, Events Experience, Compass Events, Singapore
Sinn Chanserei Sophea,&nbsp;Founder and Managing Director of SinnC Creative Solutions, Cambodia

Programme Agenda&nbsp;
News and Event Materials
Relive the Webinar

&nbsp;Raffaele Trapasso,&nbsp;Economist, OECD

Jeff Sandhu,&nbsp;Head of 42 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

Stefan Ye, Events Experience, Compass Events, Singapore

for Lao PDR: Services, Urban Amenities and GVC: New Pathways for 2021-03-22 2021-03-22 2021-03-22 22 March 2021 1202 hcraM 22 22-30-1202 22-30-1202 22-30-1202   gro.aire@adniliam  adniliaM sM  mooR lautriV         htworG rof syawhtaP weN :CVG dna seitinemA nabrU for Cambodia: Services, Urban Amenities and GVC: New Pathways for Growth";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-03-16";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"3";s:7:"content";s:0:"";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Cambodia: Services, Urban Amenities and GVC: New Pathways for Growth  Webinar for Cambodia: Services, Urban Amenities and GVC: New Pathways for Growth         Virtual Room  Ms Mailinda  mailinda@eria.org   2021-03-16 2021-03-16 2021-03-16 16 March 2021 1202 hcraM 61 61-30-1202 61-30-1202 61-30-1202   gro.aire@adniliam  adniliaM sM  mooR lautriV         htworG rof syawhtaP weN :CVG dna seitinemA nabrU ,secivreS :aidobmaC rof ranibeW  htworG rof syawhtaP weN :CVG dna seitinemA nabrU ,secivreS :aidobmaC rof ranibeW";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-03-01 13:46:39";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-03-01 13:46:39";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:17:"mailinda@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:66;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9954";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6112";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:78:"eria-ris-oecd-asia-forum-digitalisation-and-development-reflections-from-asia-";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:79:"ERIA-RIS-OECD Asia Forum: Digitalisation and Development: Reflections from Asia";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-03-05";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"3";s:7:"content";s:1836:"<p><strong>Digitalization-A New Wave of Technological Change</strong></p><p>Technological innovation has been a major force behind economic transformation at different stages of human civilizations. From invention of steam engines to high-speed computers the role and contribution of technologies remained crucial. Historically, countries that have invested in research &amp; development in science, technology and innovation (STI) have maintained an edge over others in advancing application of technologies in manufacturing and augmenting the contribution of frontier areas of technology to the process of economic growth and development. Spread of telecommunications, digital infrastructure and modern information technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Block Chain, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Big Data, etc have significantly reduced human effort in production and contributed to higher productivity of labor. It simultaneously marked a steady acquisition of higher technical and managerial skills by the existing workforce which can be broadly defined as adaptation and investment in formal education and training for acquisition of new skills for fresh supply of talents in line the emerging skill requirements. Following that trend, the world has reached a stage now where human labour is being substituted by robots on the grounds of speed and efficiency.</p><p class="pdf"><a title="CONCEPT NOTE" href="/uploads/media/Events/Asia-Forum--Concept-Note.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">CONCEPT NOTE</a></p><h2>Date and Time&nbsp;</h2><div class="mdate">Friday, 5 March 2021</div><div class="mdate">4.30-17.40 (IST) / 10.00-13.10 (CET)</div><div class="mtime">&nbsp;</div><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER&nbsp;" href="http://oe.cd/3x2" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:15:"Ms Kemala Putri";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-03-05";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-03-05";s:8:"keywords";s:3473:"ERIA-RIS-OECD Asia Forum: Digitalisation and Development: Reflections from Asia  ERIA-RIS-OECD Asia Forum: Digitalisation and Development: Reflections from Asia  Digitalization-A New Wave of Technological Change
Technological innovation has been a major force behind economic transformation at different stages of human civilizations. From invention of steam engines to high-speed computers the role and contribution of technologies remained crucial. Historically, countries that have invested in research &amp; development in science, technology and innovation (STI) have maintained an edge over others in advancing application of technologies in manufacturing and augmenting the contribution of frontier areas of technology to the process of economic growth and development. Spread of telecommunications, digital infrastructure and modern information technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Block Chain, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Big Data, etc have significantly reduced human effort in production and contributed to higher productivity of labor. It simultaneously marked a steady acquisition of higher technical and managerial skills by the existing workforce which can be broadly defined as adaptation and investment in formal education and training for acquisition of new skills for fresh supply of talents in line the emerging skill requirements. Following that trend, the world has reached a stage now where human labour is being substituted by robots on the grounds of speed and efficiency.
CONCEPT NOTE
Date and Time&nbsp;
Friday, 5 March 2021
4.30-17.40 (IST) / 10.00-13.10 (CET)

New ideas, mind-sets, approaches, and business models are needed for building back better in the new normal.</p><p>In this launch event of the ERIA 2021 Webinar Series, hear our speakers share their views on the future of the Entrepreneurship, Start-up and Innovation (E-S-I) ecosystems, as reformation, transformation and evolution take place to meet economic recovery demand and future entrepreneurial aspirations.</p><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>Thursday, 4 March 2021, 2 PM to 3:30 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><strong>&nbsp;Welcome Remark:</strong></p><ul><li>Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director of Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Jonathan Wong, Chief of Technology and Innovation, UNESCAP</li><li>Adna Rahman, Head Entrepreneurship Innovation Centre, Ministry of Education, Brunei Darussalam</li><li>NGO Ravindra, Co-Founder and CEO of Invest in Cambodia; Founder of The ASEAN Network</li><li>Veronica Low, President, ASEAN Business Youth Association, Singapore</li><li>Nur Kaser, Managing Director, KnowledgeHiveInternational, Malaysia</li></ul><p class="detail"><a class="bluebtn" title="ERIA Launches New Webinar Series: Entrepreneurship, Start-ups and Innovation" href="/news-and-views/eria-launches-new-webinar-series-entrepreneurship-start-ups-and-innovation/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">News and Event Materials</a></p><h2>Relive the Webinar</h2><p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Zcd1Ps1nHHI" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Jonathan Wong, Chief of Technology and Innovation, UNESCAP</h2><p><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/ELdV2bOMe3k" width="560" height="314" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Adna Rahman, Head Entrepreneurship Innovation Centre, Ministry of Education, Brunei Darussalam</h2><p><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/C46eSChnYyE" width="560" height="314" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Ravindra Ngo, Co-Founder and CEO of Invest in Cambodia; Founder of The ASEAN Network</h2><p><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/BQhP7h4DIPU" width="560" height="314" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Veronica Low, President, ASEAN Business Youth Association, Singapore</h2><p><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/lXvlf0QcI1M" width="560" height="314" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Nur Kaser, Managing Director, KnowledgeHiveInternational, Malaysia</h2><p><iframe src="//www.youtube.com/embed/pl0-921LqHw" width="560" height="314" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><p>ERIA&rsquo;s E-S-I webinar series is organised under ERIA&rsquo;s Strategy and Partnership Programme, funded by Australia.</p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:76:"Entrepreneurship,Start-Up,Innovation,SMEs,Strategy and Partnership Programme";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-03-04";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-03-04";s:8:"keywords";s:4537:"Futurecasting: E-S-I in ASEAN and East Asia - 2021 and Beyond Futurecasting: E-S-I in ASEAN and East Asia - 2021 and Beyond ERIA Webinar Series &ndash; Episode #1 Entrepreneurship, Start-ups, Innovation (E-S-I) in ASEAN and East Asia for The Post-Pandemic Recovery
Following a year of global disruption due to the COVID-19 pandemic, focus in 2021 has shifted to post-pandemic recovery as both governments and businesses review and refine policies and strategies. New ideas, mind-sets, approaches, and business models are needed for building back better in the new normal.
In this launch event of the ERIA 2021 Webinar Series, hear our speakers share their views on the future of the Entrepreneurship, Start-up and Innovation (E-S-I) ecosystems, as reformation, transformation and evolution take place to meet economic recovery demand and future entrepreneurial aspirations.
Date and Time:
Thursday, 4 March 2021, 2 PM to 3:30 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to the meeting room to be provided after registration)
&nbsp;Welcome Remark:

Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director of Strategy and Partnership, ERIA

Speakers:

Jonathan Wong, Chief of Technology and Innovation, UNESCAP
Adna Rahman, Head Entrepreneurship Innovation Centre, Ministry of Education, Brunei Darussalam
NGO Ravindra, Co-Founder and CEO of Invest in Cambodia; Founder of The ASEAN Network
Veronica Low, President, ASEAN Business Youth Association, Singapore
Nur Kaser, Managing Director, KnowledgeHiveInternational, Malaysia

News and Event Materials
Relive the Webinar

Jonathan Wong, Chief of Technology and Innovation, UNESCAP

Adna Rahman, Head Entrepreneurship Innovation Centre, Ministry of Education, Brunei Darussalam

Ravindra Ngo, Co-Founder and CEO of Invest in Cambodia; Founder of The ASEAN Network

Veronica Low, President, ASEAN Business Youth Association, Singapore

Nur Kaser, Managing Director, KnowledgeHiveInternational, Malaysia

ERIA&rsquo;s E-S-I webinar series is organised under ERIA&rsquo;s Strategy and Partnership Programme, funded by Australia. yrevoceR cimednaP-tsoP ehT rof aisA tsaE dna NAESA ni )I-S-E( noitavonnI ,spu-tratS ,pihsruenerpertnE 1# edosipE ;hsadn& seireS ranibeW AIRE dnoyeB dna 1202 - aisA tsaE dna NAESA ni I-S-E :gnitsacerutuF dnoyeB dna 1202 - aisA tsaE dna NAESA ni I-S-E :gnitsacerutuF";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-02-19 12:19:20";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-08-24 15:53:28";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:68;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9805";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6076";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:56:"oecd-eria-gohe-in-conversation-with-markus-buchhorn-apan";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:57:"OECD-ERIA GoHE in Conversation with Markus Buchhorn, APAN";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-02-17";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"2";s:7:"content";s:2513:"<p>The OECD together with the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) is pleased to invite you to join the 10<sup>th</sup> of a series of webinars with prominent international experts. These webinars discuss the relationship between higher education institutions and innovation ecosystems, continuing on from our&nbsp;previous on-line meetings, about the Geography of Higher Education (#<strong>GoHE</strong>).</p><p>The next guest of the series<strong> &ldquo;<em>GoHE in Conversation with..</em>&rdquo; </strong>is <strong>Markus Buchhorn</strong>, from APAN.</p><p>In a 45-minute event (including Q&amp;A), we will discuss with Markus about digital infrastructure, digital skills within HEIs, and the way in which HEIs can promote digital transformation and capabilities, in their own ecosystems and networks.</p><p>This webinar will be the first of a short series of events focussing on different aspects of the digital transformation in higher education.</p><table style="height: 163px;" width="683"><tr style="height: 154.656px;"><td style="width: 673px; height: 154.656px;"><p><em><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Dr Markus Buchhorn is a former astrophysicist who became an IT professional with a focus on the application of information and communication technologies to support research, education and broader benefits to society. He has been the academic IT director for the Australian National University, and the Director of Services for Intersect Australia, a partnership of over a dozen major universities delivering e-Research infrastructure and services. Over the last ten years he has been working as a consultant to a range of national and state governments, international bodies as well as multiple universities and research organisations in several countries, and also as the General Manager of APAN, the Asia-Pacific Advanced Network partnership of network providers for research and education across the region.</span></em></p></td></tr></table><p class="pdf"><a title="More about HEIs" href="/uploads/media/Events/ERIA-OECD-HEIs-and-COVID-19.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">More about HEIs</a></p><h2>Date and time</h2><div class="mdate">17 February 2021</div><div class="mtime"><span class="JsGRdQ">10 AM CET&nbsp;</span></div><div class="mtime"><h2><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER" href="https://meetoecd1.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJAocO2rqj4rEtCQRr3AoAUaXdbCaRU2ZqWm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER</a></h2></div>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:11:"Ms Mailinda";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-02-17";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-02-17";s:8:"keywords";s:4029:"OECD-ERIA GoHE in Conversation with Markus Buchhorn, APAN OECD-ERIA GoHE in Conversation with Markus Buchhorn, APAN The OECD together with the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) is pleased to invite you to join the 10th of a series of webinars with prominent international experts. These webinars discuss the relationship between higher education institutions and innovation ecosystems, continuing on from our&nbsp;previous on-line meetings, about the Geography of Higher Education (#GoHE).
The next guest of the series &ldquo;GoHE in Conversation with..&rdquo; is Markus Buchhorn, from APAN.
In a 45-minute event (including Q&amp;A), we will discuss with Markus about digital infrastructure, digital skills within HEIs, and the way in which HEIs can promote digital transformation and capabilities, in their own ecosystems and networks.
This webinar will be the first of a short series of events focussing on different aspects of the digital transformation in higher education.




Dr Markus Buchhorn is a former astrophysicist who became an IT professional with a focus on the application of information and communication technologies to support research, education and broader benefits to society. He has been the academic IT director for the Australian National University, and the Director of Services for Intersect Australia, a partnership of over a dozen major universities delivering e-Research infrastructure and services. Over the last ten years he has been working as a consultant to a range of national and state governments, international bodies as well as multiple universities and research organisations in several countries, and also as the General Manager of APAN, the Asia-Pacific Advanced Network partnership of network providers for research and education across the region.




More about HEIs
Date and time
17 February 2021
10 AM CET&nbsp;

.noiger eht ssorca noitacude dna hcraeser rof sredivorp krowten fo pihsrentrap krowteN decnavdA cificaP-aisA eht ,NAPA fo reganaM lareneG eht sa osla dna ,seirtnuoc lareves ni snoitasinagro hcraeser dna seitisrevinu elpitlum sa llew sa seidob lanoitanretni ,stnemnrevog etats dna lanoitan fo egnar a ot tnatlusnoc a sa gnikrow neeb sah eh sraey net tsal eht revO .secivres dna erutcurtsarfni hcraeseR-e gnireviled seitisrevinu rojam nezod a revo fo pihsrentrap a ,ailartsuA tcesretnI rof secivreS fo rotceriD eht dna ,ytisrevinU lanoitaN nailartsuA eht rof rotcerid TI cimedaca eht neeb sah eH .yteicos ot stifeneb redaorb dna noitacude ,hcraeser troppus ot seigolonhcet noitacinummoc dna noitamrofni fo noitacilppa eht no sucof a htiw lanoisseforp TI na emaceb ohw tsicisyhportsa remrof a si nrohhcuB sukraM rD




.noitacude rehgih ni noitamrofsnart latigid eht fo stcepsa tnereffid no gnissucof stneve fo seires trohs a fo tsrif eht eb lliw ranibew sihT
.skrowten dna smetsysoce nwo rieht ni ,seitilibapac dna noitamrofsnart latigid etomorp nac sIEH hcihw ni yaw eht dna ,sIEH nihtiw slliks latigid ,erutcurtsarfni latigid tuoba sukraM htiw ssucsid lliw ew ,)A;pma&Q gnidulcni( tneve etunim-54 a nI
.NAPA morf ,nrohhcuB sukraM si ;ouqdr&..htiw noitasrevnoC ni EHoG;ouqdl& seires eht fo tseug txen ehT
.)EHoG#( noitacudE rehgiH fo yhpargoeG eht tuoba ,sgniteem enil-no suoiverp;psbn&ruo morf no gniunitnoc ,smetsysoce noitavonni dna snoitutitsni noitacude rehgih neewteb pihsnoitaler eht ssucsid sranibew esehT .strepxe lanoitanretni tnenimorp htiw sranibew fo seires a fo ht01 eht nioj ot uoy etivni ot desaelp si )AIRE( aisA tsaE dna NAESA rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE eht htiw rehtegot DCEO ehT NAPA ,nrohhcuB sukraM htiw noitasrevnoC ni EHoG AIRE-DCEO NAPA ,nrohhcuB sukraM htiw noitasrevnoC ni EHoG AIRE-DCEO";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-02-08 11:36:16";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-02-08 11:51:59";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:17:"mailinda@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:69;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9722";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6057";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:54:"webinar-assessing-cost-effectiveness-of-ntms-a-toolkit";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:64:"Webinar: Assessing cost-effectiveness of NTMs â€“ A toolkit";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-01-27";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"1";s:7:"content";s:3351:"<p>NTMs can increase the cost of doing business through increased compliance costs, thus reducing productivity. Poorly designed and inefficiently implemented NTMs can create administrative and financial burden for the private sector. This makes it necessary to review NTMs with the objective of minimizing compliance costs, improving design and making implementation processes more effective: all critical elements for boosting regional value chains (RVCs). At the same time, NTMs are necessary for achieving other social or development goals. Thus, there is a need to strike a careful balance when reviewing NTMs such that effectiveness of NTMs in meeting the policy objectives for which they are designed is not undermined.</p><p>The&nbsp;<strong><em>NTM Cost-Effectiveness Toolkit</em>&nbsp;</strong>addresses this very issue: it provides tools to evaluate NTMs in terms of the objective they are designed for, the way they are being implemented, and how easy it is for the private sector to comply with them. In a pilot project, the toolkit was piloted in the Kenyan cotton, textiles and apparel (CTA) value chain, the project involved a review of NTMs applied to cotton lint imports in Kenya. It resulted in recommendations for simplifying import regulations and procedures and reduce trade costs while ensuring that relevant public policy objectives are not compromised.</p><p>The webinar on 27 January will bring present the&nbsp;<em>NTM Cost-Effectiveness Toolkit&nbsp;</em>and discuss its use and implementation with a group of expert panellists from the Government of Kenya, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and the Organization for Economic Co-Operation (OECD).</p><p>The webinar is open to policy makers, researchers, private sector and other interested stakeholders.<strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><h2>Date and time</h2><div class="mdate">27 January 2021</div><div class="mtime"><span class="JsGRdQ">4 PM - 6 PM (UTC+7) | 10 AM - 12 PM</span> <span class="JsGRdQ">(UTC+1)</span></div><h2>How to Join?</h2><p><strong>Join by WebEx meeting link:</strong><br /><a href="https://rtce-unog.webex.com/rtce-unog/j.php?MTID=me0383d76027579a30c6209b7de0c66bc" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://rtce-unog.webex.com/rtce-unog/j.php?MTID=me0383d76027579a30c6209b7de0c66bc</a></p><p><strong>Join WebEx by meeting number:</strong><br />Meeting number (access code): 174 698 3828 and meeting password: vMS8dqpuA24</p><p><strong>Join from a video system or application:</strong>&nbsp;Dial&nbsp;<a href="mailto:1746983828@rtce-unog.webex.com">1746983828@rtce-unog.webex.com</a><br />You can also dial 62.109.219.4 and enter your meeting number.</p><p><strong>Join using Microsoft Lync or Microsoft Skype for Business:</strong><br />Dial&nbsp;<a href="mailto:1746983828.rtceunog@lync.webex.com">1746983828.rtceunog@lync.webex.com</a></p><h2>Co-organisers and Sponsor</h2><div class="contactnav"><div class="prg-event">Co-organisers:</div><div class="prg-text">German Cooperation (GIZ), Government of Kenya, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East-Asia (ERIA), Organization for Economic Co-Operation (OECD)</div><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div></div><div class="contactnav"><div class="prg-event">Sponsor / funding:</div><div class="prg-text">German Cooperation (GIZ)</div><div class="clear">&nbsp;</div></div>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:23:"NTM,international trade";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:19:"Mr Christian Knebel";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:36:"GIZ, Government of Kenya, ERIA, OECD";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-01-27";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-01-27";s:8:"keywords";s:5793:"Webinar: Assessing cost-effectiveness of NTMs â€“ A toolkit Webinar: Assessing cost-effectiveness of NTMs â€“ A toolkit NTMs can increase the cost of doing business through increased compliance costs, thus reducing productivity. Poorly designed and inefficiently implemented NTMs can create administrative and financial burden for the private sector. This makes it necessary to review NTMs with the objective of minimizing compliance costs, improving design and making implementation processes more effective: all critical elements for boosting regional value chains (RVCs). At the same time, NTMs are necessary for achieving other social or development goals. Thus, there is a need to strike a careful balance when reviewing NTMs such that effectiveness of NTMs in meeting the policy objectives for which they are designed is not undermined.
The&nbsp;NTM Cost-Effectiveness Toolkit&nbsp;addresses this very issue: it provides tools to evaluate NTMs in terms of the objective they are designed for, the way they are being implemented, and how easy it is for the private sector to comply with them. In a pilot project, the toolkit was piloted in the Kenyan cotton, textiles and apparel (CTA) value chain, the project involved a review of NTMs applied to cotton lint imports in Kenya. It resulted in recommendations for simplifying import regulations and procedures and reduce trade costs while ensuring that relevant public policy objectives are not compromised.
The webinar on 27 January will bring present the&nbsp;NTM Cost-Effectiveness Toolkit&nbsp;and discuss its use and implementation with a group of expert panellists from the Government of Kenya, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) and the Organization for Economic Co-Operation (OECD).
The webinar is open to policy makers, researchers, private sector and other interested stakeholders.&nbsp;
Date and time
27 January 2021
4 PM - 6 PM (UTC+7) | 10 AM - 12 PM (UTC+1)

;psbn&.sredlohekats detseretni rehto dna rotces etavirp ,srehcraeser ,srekam ycilop ot nepo si ranibew ehT
.)DCEO( noitarepO-oC cimonocE rof noitazinagrO eht dna )AIRE( aisA tsaE dna NAESA rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE eht ,ayneK fo tnemnrevoG eht morf stsillenap trepxe fo puorg a htiw noitatnemelpmi dna esu sti ssucsid dna;psbn&tiklooT ssenevitceffE-tsoC MTN;psbn&eht tneserp gnirb lliw yraunaJ 72 no ranibew ehT
.desimorpmoc ton era sevitcejbo ycilop cilbup tnaveler taht gnirusne elihw stsoc edart ecuder dna serudecorp dna snoitaluger tropmi gniyfilpmis rof snoitadnemmocer ni detluser tI .ayneK ni stropmi tnil nottoc ot deilppa sMTN fo weiver a devlovni tcejorp eht ,niahc eulav )ATC( lerappa dna selitxet ,nottoc nayneK eht ni detolip saw tikloot eht ,tcejorp tolip a nI .meht htiw ylpmoc ot rotces etavirp eht rof si ti ysae woh dna ,detnemelpmi gnieb era yeht yaw eht ,rof dengised era yeht evitcejbo eht fo smret ni sMTN etaulave ot sloot sedivorp ti :eussi yrev siht sesserdda;psbn&tiklooT ssenevitceffE-tsoC MTN;psbn&ehT
.denimrednu ton si dengised era yeht hcihw rof sevitcejbo ycilop eht gniteem ni sMTN fo ssenevitceffe taht hcus sMTN gniweiver nehw ecnalab luferac a ekirts ot deen a si ereht ,suhT .slaog tnempoleved ro laicos rehto gniveihca rof yrassecen era sMTN ,emit emas eht tA .)sCVR( sniahc eulav lanoiger gnitsoob rof stnemele lacitirc lla :evitceffe erom sessecorp noitatnemelpmi gnikam dna yltneiciffeni dna dengised ylrooP .ytivitcudorp gnicuder suht ,stsoc ecnailpmoc desaercni hguorht ssenisub gniod fo tsoc eht esaercni nac sMTN tikloot A “€â sMTN fo ssenevitceffe-tsoc gnissessA :ranibeW tikloot A “€â sMTN fo ssenevitceffe-tsoc gnissessA :ranibeW";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-01-21 12:12:32";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-01-22 14:38:50";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:27:"Christian.Knebel@unctad.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:70;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9710";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"6034";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:70:"asean-on-point-public-forum-fake-news-tackling-disinformation-in-asean";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:87:"â€˜ASEAN on Pointâ€™ Public Forum  Fake News: Tackling Disinformation in ASEAN";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2021-01-20";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2021";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"1";s:7:"content";s:2824:"<p>In response to the global coronavirus pandemic, the ASEAN Secretariat (ASEC) and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), will co-host a series of public forums &ndash; &lsquo;ASEAN on Point&rsquo; - to address issues of importance to the advancement of ASEAN.&nbsp; The forums will provide a platform to bring together representatives of diverse stakeholders to share knowledge on the latest research and insights on relevant topics on post-pandemic recovery in order to inform the policy discourse. It is hoped that the insights and recommendations from the forums can contribute to different sectoral work in ASEAN towards recovery. The vision of these Forums is to &lsquo;Build Back Better&rsquo; so that the region&rsquo;s recovery policies result in a more resilient, inclusive, and sustainable region.&nbsp;</p><p>Fake news and misinformation are emerging challenges that the ASEAN Member States must address as access to the internet and digital media grows exponentially among ASEAN citizens. Data for January 2020 from We Are Social (2020) reports that the internet penetration rate in the region is 66%, which reflects a year-on-year growth of 8.2%. Social media usage is at 63%, a 7.7% increase from the previous year.</p><p>ASEAN is taking concrete steps to prevent fake news and misinformation regarding the COVID-19 pandemic that can potentially sow a climate of distrust. Since 2017, efforts to address fake news and misinformation have figured significantly in ASEAN&rsquo;s activities. In 2017, the ASEAN Ministers Responsible for Information (AMRI) convened a Roundtable Discussion on Fake News and Communicating the Right Information, and have since adopted the Framework and Joint Declaration to Minimise the Harmful Effects of Fake News in 2018. ASEAN also launched the Core Values on Digital Literacy for ASEAN which aims to promote greater cybersecurity as part of the efforts to counter online falsehoods.</p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Marites Vitug,&nbsp;Editor-at-Large Rappler, Philippines&nbsp;</li><li>Donny Eryastha, Head of Public Policy, ByteDance&nbsp;</li><li>Trieu Minh Long,&nbsp;Director-General, Ministry of Information and Communications, Viet Nam</li></ul><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>20 January 2021, 10 AM to 11 AM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA" href="/uploads/media/ASEAN-on-Point/ASEAN-on-Point-Fake-News-Concept-Note-and-Agenda_18Jan-21_short.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA</a></p><h2>Video</h2><p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/x54lRsF_Hvc" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:18:"Ms Nadia Elsyafira";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2021-01-20";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2021-01-20";s:8:"keywords";s:5275:"â€˜ASEAN on Pointâ€™ Public Forum  Fake News: Tackling Disinformation in ASEAN â€˜ASEAN on Pointâ€™ Public Forum  Fake News: Tackling Disinformation in ASEAN In response to the global coronavirus pandemic, the ASEAN Secretariat (ASEC) and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), will co-host a series of public forums &ndash; &lsquo;ASEAN on Point&rsquo; - to address issues of importance to the advancement of ASEAN.&nbsp; The forums will provide a platform to bring together representatives of diverse stakeholders to share knowledge on the latest research and insights on relevant topics on post-pandemic recovery in order to inform the policy discourse. It is hoped that the insights and recommendations from the forums can contribute to different sectoral work in ASEAN towards recovery. The vision of these Forums is to &lsquo;Build Back Better&rsquo; so that the region&rsquo;s recovery policies result in a more resilient, inclusive, and sustainable region.&nbsp;
Fake news and misinformation are emerging challenges that the ASEAN Member States must address as access to the internet and digital media grows exponentially among ASEAN citizens. Data for January 2020 from We Are Social (2020) reports that the internet penetration rate in the region is 66%, which reflects a year-on-year growth of 8.2%. Social media usage is at 63%, a 7.7% increase from the previous year.
ASEAN is taking concrete steps to prevent fake news and misinformation regarding the COVID-19 pandemic that can potentially sow a climate of distrust. Since 2017, efforts to address fake news and misinformation have figured significantly in ASEAN&rsquo;s activities. In 2017, the ASEAN Ministers Responsible for Information (AMRI) convened a Roundtable Discussion on Fake News and Communicating the Right Information, and have since adopted the Framework and Joint Declaration to Minimise the Harmful Effects of Fake News in 2018. ASEAN also launched the Core Values on Digital Literacy for ASEAN which aims to promote greater cybersecurity as part of the efforts to counter online falsehoods.
Speakers:

Marites Vitug,&nbsp;Editor-at-Large Rappler, Philippines&nbsp;
Donny Eryastha, Head of Public Policy, ByteDance&nbsp;
Trieu Minh Long,&nbsp;Director-General, Ministry of Information and Communications, Viet Nam

Date and Time:
20 January 2021, 10 AM to 11 AM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
PROGRAMME AND AGENDA

;psbn&.noiger elbaniatsus dna ,evisulcni ,tneiliser erom a ni tluser seicilop yrevocer s;ouqsr&noiger eht taht os ;ouqsr&retteB kcaB dliuB;ouqsl& ot si smuroF eseht fo noisiv ehT .yrevocer sdrawot NAESA ni krow larotces tnereffid ot etubirtnoc nac smurof eht morf snoitadnemmocer dna sthgisni eht taht depoh si tI .esruocsid ycilop eht mrofni ot redro ni yrevocer cimednap-tsop no scipot tnaveler no sthgisni dna hcraeser tsetal eht no egdelwonk erahs ot sredlohekats esrevid fo sevitatneserper rehtegot gnirb ot mroftalp a edivorp lliw smurof ehT ;psbn&.NAESA fo tnemecnavda eht ot ecnatropmi fo seussi sserdda ot - ;ouqsr&tnioP no NAESA;ouqsl& ;hsadn& smurof cilbup fo seires a tsoh-oc lliw ,)AIRE( aisA tsaE dna NAESA rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE eht dna )CESA( tairaterceS NAESA eht ,cimednap surivanoroc labolg eht ot esnopser nI NAESA ni noitamrofnisiD gnilkcaT :sweN ekaF  muroF cilbuP ™€âtnioP no NAESA˜€â NAESA ni noitamrofnisiD gnilkcaT :sweN ekaF  muroF cilbuP ™€âtnioP no NAESA˜€â";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2021-01-05 11:25:41";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2021-01-20 18:19:51";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:24:"nadia.elsyafira@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:71;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9433";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5960";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:71:"survey-launch-the-impact-of-covid-19-on-foreign-businesses-across-asean";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:73:"Survey Launch:  The Impact of COVID-19 on Foreign Businesses across ASEAN";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-11-30";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:2948:"<p>The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted the operations of businesses across the ASEAN region. The impact of this disruption will be both short and long-term.&nbsp;AmCham Indonesia and the Economic Research Institute of ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) created a rapid survey in April to understand the evolving needs of US companies in the region. Five months later, ERIA and AmCham Indonesia created the survey described in this report, a more in-depth investigation of how foreign companies in ASEAN have responded and what plans they have in place moving forward. 24 chambers and business organizations representing foreign companies were involved in the implementation of this survey.&nbsp;</p><p>The results indicate how adversely firms were impacted and which industries experienced the greatest impact, which factors contributed to the impact, the extent of supply chain disruption, countries where firms are reducing operations, whether firms are considering reshoring, when firms expect business to stabilize, what new technologies and innovations firms will continue to employ in the future, and many more.&nbsp;</p><table><tr><td width="72"><p>10:00 am</p></td><td width="552"><p><strong>Opening Remarks</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Lin Neumann,</strong> Director of the American Chamber of Commerce in Indonesia</li><li><strong>Koji Hachiyama,</strong> COO, The Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td width="72"><p>10:05 am</p></td><td width="552"><p>Short video showing results</p></td></tr><tr><td width="72"><p>10:10 am</p></td><td width="552"><p><strong>Presentation of the Results</strong></p><p><strong>Lydia Ruddy,</strong> Director of Communications, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td width="72"><p>10:20 am</p></td><td width="552"><p><strong>Panel Discussion</strong></p><p>Moderator:&nbsp;</p><ul><li><strong>Lin Neumann,</strong>&nbsp;Director of the American Chamber of Commerce in Indonesia</li></ul><p>Panelists</p><ul><li><strong>Sunit Dhoka,</strong> Country Representative, Cargill Indonesia</li><li><strong>Siobhan Das,</strong> CEO, American Malaysian Chamber of Commerce</li><li><strong>Dionisius Narjoko</strong>, Senior Economist, ERIA</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td width="72"><p>10:45 am</p></td><td width="552"><p><strong>QnA</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td width="72"><p>11:00 am</p></td><td width="552"><p><strong>Event Ends</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>30 November 2020, 10 AM to 11 AM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AGENDA" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/AmCham_ERIA_Survey_Launch_Agenda_7.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AGENDA</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW" href="https://bit.ly/3lHC9nu" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:18:"Ms Isabella Italia";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-11-30";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-11-30";s:8:"keywords";s:4557:"Survey Launch:  The Impact of COVID-19 on Foreign Businesses across ASEAN Survey Launch:  The Impact of COVID-19 on Foreign Businesses across ASEAN The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted the operations of businesses across the ASEAN region. The impact of this disruption will be both short and long-term.&nbsp;AmCham Indonesia and the Economic Research Institute of ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA) created a rapid survey in April to understand the evolving needs of US companies in the region. Five months later, ERIA and AmCham Indonesia created the survey described in this report, a more in-depth investigation of how foreign companies in ASEAN have responded and what plans they have in place moving forward. 24 chambers and business organizations representing foreign companies were involved in the implementation of this survey.&nbsp;
The results indicate how adversely firms were impacted and which industries experienced the greatest impact, which factors contributed to the impact, the extent of supply chain disruption, countries where firms are reducing operations, whether firms are considering reshoring, when firms expect business to stabilize, what new technologies and innovations firms will continue to employ in the future, and many more.&nbsp;




10:00 am


Opening Remarks

Lin Neumann, Director of the American Chamber of Commerce in Indonesia
Koji Hachiyama, COO, The Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)





10:05 am


Short video showing results




10:10 am


Presentation of the Results
Lydia Ruddy, Director of Communications, ERIA




10:20 am


Panel Discussion
Moderator:&nbsp;

Lin Neumann,&nbsp;Director of the American Chamber of Commerce in Indonesia

Panelists

Sunit Dhoka, Country Representative, Cargill Indonesia
Siobhan Das, CEO, American Malaysian Chamber of Commerce
Dionisius Narjoko, Senior Economist, ERIA





10:45 am


QnA




11:00 am


Event Ends




Date and Time:
30 November 2020, 10 AM to 11 AM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)

.noiger NAESA eht ssorca sessenisub fo snoitarepo eht detpursid sah cimednap 91-DIVOC ehT NAESA ssorca sessenisuB ngieroF no 91-DIVOC fo tcapmI ehT  :hcnuaL yevruS NAESA ssorca sessenisuB ngieroF no 91-DIVOC fo tcapmI ehT  :hcnuaL yevruS";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-11-18 14:40:54";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-11-30 09:21:44";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:24:"isabella.italia@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:72;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9398";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5959";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:32:"non-tariff-measures-in-east-asia";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:32:"Non-Tariff Measures in East Asia";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-12-08";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:4759:"<p>The increased number of&nbsp;Non-Tariff Measures&nbsp;(NTMs) reflects the dynamics of regulatory reform in East Asia.&nbsp;</p><p>NTMs play a role of check and balance for the quality of goods.&nbsp;</p><p>However, not all NTMs are benign, in certain circumstances, NTMs can be used as disguised barriers&nbsp;to international trade and become a convenient tool&nbsp;to provide unnecessary protection to certain products or industries.</p><p>To make NTMs work for the common good, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)&nbsp;and the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) has driven for transparency,&nbsp;collecting NTMs across East Asia and analyse the impacts of NTMs on trade.&nbsp;</p><p>Reports on NTMs in ASEAN and East Asia are available at&nbsp;<a title="Non-Tariff Measures -- An Update" href="/publications/non-tariff-measures--an-update/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" data-auth="NotApplicable">Non-Tariff Measures -- An Update</a>&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp;<a title="Non-Tariff Measures in Australia, China, India, Japan, New Zealand, and the Republic of Korea: Preliminary Findings" href="/publications/non-tariff-measures-in-australia-china-india-japan-new-zealand-and-the-republic-of-korea-preliminary-findings/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Non-Tariff Measures in Australia, China, India, Japan, New Zealand, and the Republic of Korea: Preliminary Findings</a></p><p>Data on NTMs are available at&nbsp;<a title="TRAINS: The global database on Non-Tariff Measures" href="https://trains.unctad.org/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" data-auth="NotApplicable">TRAINS: The global database on Non-Tariff Measures</a></p><p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/nemgoOiM_og" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><p>Join us to glean insights on NTMs in East Asia!</p><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>8 December 2020, 4 PM to 5:30 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><h2>Location</h2><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><h2>Agenda</h2><table style="width: sf_compact_textregular;">Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Strategy and Partnership Director, ERIA</span></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 193px;"><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">4:50 PM to 5:25 PM</span></strong></td><td style="width: 506.894px;"><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Q &amp; A Session</span></strong></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Moderated by Giulia Ajmone Marsan&nbsp;</span></p></td></tr><tr><td style="width: 193px;"><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">5:25 PM to 5:30 PM</span></strong></td><td style="width: 506.894px;"><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Closure of the Event and End of Webinar </span></strong></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" title="Click here to RSVP via Eventbrite" href="https://bit.ly/362OzAT" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:29:"non-tariff measures,East Asia";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:13:"Ms Denise Ann";s:16:"article_keywords";s:36:"non-tariff measures, East Asia, ERIA";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-12-08";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-12-08";s:8:"keywords";s:4545:"Non-Tariff Measures in East Asia Non-Tariff Measures in East Asia The increased number of&nbsp;Non-Tariff Measures&nbsp;(NTMs) reflects the dynamics of regulatory reform in East Asia.&nbsp;
NTMs play a role of check and balance for the quality of goods.&nbsp;
However, not all NTMs are benign, in certain circumstances, NTMs can be used as disguised barriers&nbsp;to international trade and become a convenient tool&nbsp;to provide unnecessary protection to certain products or industries.
To make NTMs work for the common good, the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)&nbsp;and the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD) has driven for transparency,&nbsp;collecting NTMs across East Asia and analyse the impacts of NTMs on trade.&nbsp;
Reports on NTMs in ASEAN and East Asia are available at&nbsp;Non-Tariff Measures -- An Update&nbsp; and&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-Tariff Measures in Australia, China, India, Japan, New Zealand, and the Republic of Korea: Preliminary Findings
Data on NTMs are available at&nbsp;TRAINS: The global database on Non-Tariff Measures

Join us to glean insights on NTMs in East Asia!
Date and Time
8 December 2020, 4 PM to 5:30 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda



Time
Agenda


4 PM to 4:10 PM

Opening remarks

Koji Hachiyama, Chief Operating Officer, ERIA
Ralf Peters, Chief of Trade Information Section, UNCTAD




4:10 PM to 4:50 PM

Panel Discussion
Speakers:&nbsp;

Doan Thi Thanh Ha, Economist, ERIA
Denise Penello Rial,&nbsp;Economist in the Trade Information Section, Division on International, Trade, and Commodities, UNCTAD
Prof Simon Evenett,&nbsp;Professor of International Trade and Economic Development and MBA Director at the University of St.Gallen, Switzerland 

Moderator: 
Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Strategy and Partnership Director, ERIA



4:50 PM to 5:25 PM

Q &amp; A Session
Moderated by Giulia Ajmone Marsan&nbsp;



5:25 PM to 5:30 PM
Closure of the Event and End of Webinar 



REGISTER NOW non-tariff measures,East Asia      Virtual Room Ms Denise Ann denise.ann@eria.org non-tariff measures, East Asia, ERIA  2020-12-08 2020-12-08 2020-12-08 8 December 2020 0202 rebmeceD 8 80-21-0202 80-21-0202 80-21-0202  AIRE ,aisA tsaE ,serusaem ffirat-non gro.aire@nna.esined nnA esineD sM mooR lautriV      aisA tsaE,serusaem ffirat-non WON RETSIGER



 ranibeW fo dnE dna tnevE eht fo erusolC

noisseS A ;pma& Q

AIRE ,rotceriD pihsrentraP dna ygetartS ,nasraM enomjA ailuiG

adnegA
)noitartsiger retfa dedivorp eb ot moor gniteem ot knil( enilnO

)7+CTU( emiT atrakaJ MP 03:5 ot MP 4 ,0202 rebmeceD 8
emiT dna etaD
!aisA tsaE ni sMTN no sthgisni naelg ot su nioJ

serusaeM ffiraT-noN no esabatad labolg ehT :SNIART;psbn&ta elbaliava era sMTN no ataD

;psbn&.aisA tsaE ni mrofer yrotaluger fo scimanyd eht stcelfer )sMTN(;psbn&serusaeM ffiraT-noN;psbn&fo rebmun desaercni ehT aisA tsaE ni serusaeM ffiraT-noN aisA tsaE ni serusaeM ffiraT-noN";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-11-18 11:41:14";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-11-25 14:12:51";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:19:"denise.ann@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:73;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9460";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5958";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:73:"msmes-talk-10-innovation-eco-systems-and-the-roles-of-start-ups-and-msmes";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:75:"MSMEs Talk #10: Innovation Eco-systems and the roles of Start-ups and MSMEs";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-12-03";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"12";s:7:"content";s:2178:"<p>The dynamism of the ASEAN region can be observed also in its vibrant and emerging innovation eco-systems. Together with other players, MSMEs and start-ups have an important role to play in the emergence of these ASEAN innovation hot spots. Companies investing in the ASEAN region have brought with them new ideas, talents, resources, business culture, and skills. The positive impact cannot be denied as evident from the rise of start-ups and innovative MSMEs over the past few years. And it is important to remember that innovation is about technology and R&amp;D but also about systemic change, social impact, and new ways to tackle and find solutions to problems.</p><p>What roles can ASEAN start-ups and MSMEs play, and how can they contribute to the further growth and development of the innovation eco-systems in this region? What can government and international organisations do to promote inclusive innovations bringing social impact and systemic change? Come hear from our experts and entrepreneurs as they share their thoughts in the final episode of this webinar series. Not to be missed!</p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Okka Phyo Maung, Co-Founder and CMO, RecyGlo (Myanmar)</li><li>Souphaphone Souannavong, Founder and Managing Director, TOHLAO Group (Laos)</li><li>Michele Yen Cheng Chew, Assistant Director, Science and Technology Division, ASEAN Secretariat</li><li>Giulio Quaggiotto, Head of the Regional Innovation Center, Asia Pacific, UNDP</li><li>Sitara Syed, Deputy Resident Representative, UNDP</li></ul><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>3 December 2020, 2 PM to 3:15 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Adv%20MSME%20%2310%20Agenda.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/innovation-eco-systems-and-the-roles-of-asean-start-ups-and-msmes-tickets-130214169085" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-12-03";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-12-03";s:8:"keywords";s:3845:"MSMEs Talk #10: Innovation Eco-systems and the roles of Start-ups and MSMEs MSMEs Talk #10: Innovation Eco-systems and the roles of Start-ups and MSMEs The dynamism of the ASEAN region can be observed also in its vibrant and emerging innovation eco-systems. Together with other players, MSMEs and start-ups have an important role to play in the emergence of these ASEAN innovation hot spots. Companies investing in the ASEAN region have brought with them new ideas, talents, resources, business culture, and skills. The positive impact cannot be denied as evident from the rise of start-ups and innovative MSMEs over the past few years. And it is important to remember that innovation is about technology and R&amp;D but also about systemic change, social impact, and new ways to tackle and find solutions to problems.
What roles can ASEAN start-ups and MSMEs play, and how can they contribute to the further growth and development of the innovation eco-systems in this region? What can government and international organisations do to promote inclusive innovations bringing social impact and systemic change? Come hear from our experts and entrepreneurs as they share their thoughts in the final episode of this webinar series. Not to be missed!
Speakers:

Okka Phyo Maung, Co-Founder and CMO, RecyGlo (Myanmar)
Souphaphone Souannavong, Founder and Managing Director, TOHLAO Group (Laos)
Michele Yen Cheng Chew, Assistant Director, Science and Technology Division, ASEAN Secretariat
Giulio Quaggiotto, Head of the Regional Innovation Center, Asia Pacific, UNDP
Sitara Syed, Deputy Resident Representative, UNDP

Date and Time:
3 December 2020, 2 PM to 3:15 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
