!dessim eb ot toN .seires ranibew siht fo edosipe lanif eht ni sthguoht rieht erahs yeht sa sruenerpertne dna strepxe ruo morf raeh emoC ?egnahc cimetsys dna tcapmi laicos gnignirb snoitavonni evisulcni etomorp ot od snoitasinagro lanoitanretni dna tnemnrevog nac tahW ?noiger siht ni smetsys-oce noitavonni eht fo tnempoleved dna htworg rehtruf eht ot etubirtnoc yeht nac woh dna ,yalp sEMSM dna spu-trats NAESA nac selor tahW
.smelborp ot snoitulos dnif dna elkcat ot syaw wen dna ,tcapmi laicos ,egnahc cimetsys tuoba osla tub D;pma&R dna ygolonhcet tuoba si noitavonni taht rebmemer ot tnatropmi si ti dnA .sraey wef tsap eht revo sEMSM evitavonni dna spu-trats fo esir eht morf tnedive sa deined eb tonnac tcapmi evitisop ehT .slliks dna ,erutluc ssenisub ,secruoser ,stnelat ,saedi wen meht htiw thguorb evah noiger NAESA eht ni gnitsevni seinapmoC .stops toh noitavonni NAESA eseht fo ecnegreme eht ni yalp ot elor tnatropmi na evah spu-trats dna sEMSM ,sreyalp rehto htiw rehtegoT .smetsys-oce noitavonni gnigreme dna tnarbiv sti ni osla devresbo eb nac noiger NAESA eht fo msimanyd ehT sEMSM dna spu-tratS fo selor eht dna smetsys-ocE noitavonnI :01# klaT sEMSM sEMSM dna spu-tratS fo selor eht dna smetsys-ocE noitavonnI :01# klaT sEMSM";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-11-18 11:40:08";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-12-02 09:19:08";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:74;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9282";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5956";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:53:"cities-in-the-world-a-new-perspective-on-urbanisation";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:54:"Cities in the World: A New Perspective on Urbanisation";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-11-27";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:11189:"<p data-key="37"><span data-key="38">Cities are not only home to around half of the global population but also major centers of economic activity and innovation. Yet, substantial differences in the way cities, metropolitan, urban, and rural areas are defined across countries hinder robust international comparisons and an accurate monitoring of SDGs. The recent OECD-European Commission report Cities in the World: A New Perspective on Urbanisation addresses this void and provides new insights on urbanisation by applying two new definitions of human settlements to the entire globe: the Degree of Urbanisation and the Functional Urban Area. </span></p><p data-key="39"><span data-key="40">What are current urbanisation trends globally and across Asia? How the shape of cities is changing and how this impact sustainability? What can policy makers do to address urban-rural divides? Come and join us on the 27 of November for a discussion with speakers from the OECD, ERIA as well as ASEAN organisations and the European Commission. </span></p><p data-key="41"><span data-key="42">Opening remarks:</span></p><ul data-key="43"><li data-key="44"><span data-key="45">Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</span></li></ul><p data-key="46"><span data-key="47">Presentation of OECD report:</span></p><ul data-key="48"><li data-key="49"><span data-key="50">Paolo Veneri, Head of Unit, OECD</span></li></ul><p data-key="51"><span data-key="52">Panel discussion:</span></p><ul data-key="53"><li data-key="54"><span data-key="55">Bernadia Irawati Tjandradewi, Secretary General, UCLG Asia Pacific</span></li></ul><ul data-key="56"><li data-key="57"><span data-key="58">Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Senior Energy Economist, ERIA</span></li></ul><ul data-key="59"><li data-key="60"><span data-key="61">Lewis Dijkstra, Head of the Economic Analysis Sector, DG REGIO, European Commission</span></li></ul><ul data-key="62"><li data-key="63"><span data-key="64">Benazir Syahril,&nbsp;Project Officer for ASEAN Connectivity, ASEAN Secretariat</span></li></ul><p data-key="65"><span data-key="66">Closing remarks: </span></p><ul data-key="67" data-slate-fragment=""><li data-key="68"><span data-key="69">Rudiger Ahrend &ndash; Head of Division, OECD</span></li></ul><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>27 November 2020, 3.30 PM to 5 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="/uploads/media/ERIA_OECD_27_NOV_AGENDA_3.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW" href="https://bit.ly/2Uu5LIO" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-11-27";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-11-27";s:8:"keywords";s:3829:"Cities in the World: A New Perspective on Urbanisation Cities in the World: A New Perspective on Urbanisation Cities are not only home to around half of the global population but also major centers of economic activity and innovation. Yet, substantial differences in the way cities, metropolitan, urban, and rural areas are defined across countries hinder robust international comparisons and an accurate monitoring of SDGs. The recent OECD-European Commission report Cities in the World: A New Perspective on Urbanisation addresses this void and provides new insights on urbanisation by applying two new definitions of human settlements to the entire globe: the Degree of Urbanisation and the Functional Urban Area. 
What are current urbanisation trends globally and across Asia? How the shape of cities is changing and how this impact sustainability? What can policy makers do to address urban-rural divides? Come and join us on the 27 of November for a discussion with speakers from the OECD, ERIA as well as ASEAN organisations and the European Commission. 
Opening remarks:

Giulia Ajmone Marsan, Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA

Presentation of OECD report:

Paolo Veneri, Head of Unit, OECD

Panel discussion:

Bernadia Irawati Tjandradewi, Secretary General, UCLG Asia Pacific


Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Senior Energy Economist, ERIA


Lewis Dijkstra, Head of the Economic Analysis Sector, DG REGIO, European Commission


Benazir Syahril,&nbsp;Project Officer for ASEAN Connectivity, ASEAN Secretariat

Closing remarks: 

Rudiger Ahrend &ndash; Head of Division, OECD

Date and Time:
27 November 2020, 3.30 PM to 5 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)

webinar:  Preparing Indonesia to Expand Silver Economy";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-11-06";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:0:"";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual webinar:  Preparing Indonesia to Expand Silver Economy ERIA-BAPPENAS webinar:  Preparing Indonesia to Expand Silver Economy        Virtual Room  Ms Nanda Putri nanda.putri@eria.org   2020-11-06 2020-11-06 2020-11-06 6 November 2020 0202 rebmevoN 6 60-11-0202 60-11-0202 60-11-0202   gro.aire@irtup.adnan irtuP adnaN sM  mooR lautriV        ymonocE revliS dnapxE ot aisenodnI gniraperP  :ranibew SANEPPAB-AIRE ymonocE revliS dnapxE ot aisenodnI gniraperP  :ranibew SANEPPAB-AIRE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-11-16 13:49:49";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-11-16 14:33:34";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:20:"nanda.putri@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:76;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"9079";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5909";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:72:"msme-talk9-the-rise-of-fintech-and-digital-payments--pandemic-and-beyond";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:74:"MSME Talk#9: The Rise of Fintech and Digital Payments- Pandemic and Beyond";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-11-19";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"11";s:7:"content";s:1787:"<p>The rise of financial technology (fintech) firms has been phenomenal over the last several years. In ASEAN, a report shared that the number of fintech firms increased 3.5 times between 2014 and 2019. Governments in ASEAN have been aggressively reforming and strengthening their respective regulatory frameworks to ensure that this sector continues its robust growth trajectory.</p><p>Has the COVID-19 pandemic thrown a curveball to this growth story? How should this region respond and more importantly, what can the fintech entrepreneurs ride the waves of this storm to emerge stronger? As with past sessions of this webinar talk series, we have brought together an interesting blend of economic experts and entrepreneurs to share their thoughts on this topic. Join us to glean valuable insights for your business on 19 November 2020.</p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Ye Myat Min, CEO, Nexlabs (Myanmar)</li><li>Denny Muslim, Founder &amp; Director, BEEP Digital Solutions (Brunei)</li><li>Pritam Basu, Founder, Boseman Group (London, UK)</li><li>Kimberley Botwright, Community Lead, Global Trade and Investment, World Economic Forum (WEF)</li><li>Norhizam bin Abdul Kadir, Vice President, Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC)</li></ul><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>19 November 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/MSME-9-Agenda-v1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW" href="https://bit.ly/3kaw7u4" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-11-19";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-11-19";s:8:"keywords";s:3269:"MSME Talk#9: The Rise of Fintech and Digital Payments- Pandemic and Beyond MSME Talk#9: The Rise of Fintech and Digital Payments- Pandemic and Beyond The rise of financial technology (fintech) firms has been phenomenal over the last several years. In ASEAN, a report shared that the number of fintech firms increased 3.5 times between 2014 and 2019. Governments in ASEAN have been aggressively reforming and strengthening their respective regulatory frameworks to ensure that this sector continues its robust growth trajectory.
Has the COVID-19 pandemic thrown a curveball to this growth story? How should this region respond and more importantly, what can the fintech entrepreneurs ride the waves of this storm to emerge stronger? As with past sessions of this webinar talk series, we have brought together an interesting blend of economic experts and entrepreneurs to share their thoughts on this topic. Join us to glean valuable insights for your business on 19 November 2020.
Speakers:

Ye Myat Min, CEO, Nexlabs (Myanmar)
Denny Muslim, Founder &amp; Director, BEEP Digital Solutions (Brunei)
Pritam Basu, Founder, Boseman Group (London, UK)
Kimberley Botwright, Community Lead, Global Trade and Investment, World Economic Forum (WEF)
Norhizam bin Abdul Kadir, Vice President, Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation (MDEC)

Date and Time:
19 November 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)

The global and regional push towards Industry 4.0 and the Digital Economy makes an increased participation of women and girls in STEM education, jobs, and careers fundamental for the future economy. In ASEAN, more women are visibly championing careers and businesses in these fields and more have jumped onto the start-up bandwagon to become female entrepreneurs in the tech sector. However, there is still room to encourage many more women and girls to pursue STEM careers.</p><p>How will the COVID-19 pandemic affect this upward trend, or will it fuel an even greater surge as opportunities present itself in the digital world post-pandemic? Come hear from a panel of female entrepreneurs in STEM as well as our economic experts as they deliberate and share their thoughts in this upcoming webinar session.</p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Chan Yin Yin, COO and Founder, BotDistrikt (Singapore)</li><li>Mazlita Mat Hassan Co-Founder, RECQA.com (Malaysia)</li><li>Kingkeo Doungsavanh, Director, Data Com (Laos PDR)</li><li>Liza Noonan, ASEAN Director, CSIRO&nbsp;</li></ul><p><strong><strong>Date and Time:</strong></strong></p><p>5 November 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Agenda_ERIA_MSMEs%20Webinar_Talk%238.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/women-in-stem-and-the-digital-economy-the-asean-perspective-tickets-126767710635" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-11-05";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-11-05";s:8:"keywords";s:3285:"MSME Talk #8: Women in STEM and the Digital Economy â€“ The ASEAN perspective MSME Talk #8: Women in STEM and the Digital Economy â€“ The ASEAN perspective Women have made up a small percentage of the workforce in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) both in developed and emerging countries. The global and regional push towards Industry 4.0 and the Digital Economy makes an increased participation of women and girls in STEM education, jobs, and careers fundamental for the future economy. In ASEAN, more women are visibly championing careers and businesses in these fields and more have jumped onto the start-up bandwagon to become female entrepreneurs in the tech sector. However, there is still room to encourage many more women and girls to pursue STEM careers.
How will the COVID-19 pandemic affect this upward trend, or will it fuel an even greater surge as opportunities present itself in the digital world post-pandemic? Come hear from a panel of female entrepreneurs in STEM as well as our economic experts as they deliberate and share their thoughts in this upcoming webinar session.
Speakers:

Chan Yin Yin, COO and Founder, BotDistrikt (Singapore)
Mazlita Mat Hassan Co-Founder, RECQA.com (Malaysia)
Kingkeo Doungsavanh, Director, Data Com (Laos PDR)
Liza Noonan, ASEAN Director, CSIRO&nbsp;

Date and Time:
5 November 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)

Contribution";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-10-28";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:1431:"<p>In this webinar, key figures from ASEAN and Japan will discuss how to accelerate digital Innovation in ASEAN to overcome the current economic crisis and achieve further prosperity beyond it. They will also discuss what ASEAN can expect from Japan and how Japan should respond to it.</p><p>Agenda</p><ol><li>Opening remark from METI</li><li>Keynote speech from ASEC</li><li>Keynote speech from JETRO</li><li>Panel discussion among ASEC, JETRO, ASEAN-BAC, and ERIA</li></ol><h2>Speakers</h2><ul><li>Mr Hirose Naoshi, Director-General, Trade Policy Bureau, Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry (METI), Japan</li><li>Dr Julia Tijaja, Director, ASEAN Integration Monitoring Directorate, ASEAN Secretariat (ASEC)</li><li>Mr Taketani Atsushi, Chief Representative for ASEAN, Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO) Bangkok</li><li>Tan Sri Dato&#039; They will also discuss what ASEAN can expect from Japan and how Japan should respond to it.
Agenda

Opening remark from METI
Keynote speech from ASEC
Keynote speech from JETRO
Panel discussion among ASEC, JETRO, ASEAN-BAC, and ERIA

Speakers

Mr Hirose Naoshi, Director-General, Trade Policy Bureau, Ministry of Economy, Trade, and Industry (METI), Japan

.ti ot dnopser dluohs napaJ woh dna napaJ morf tcepxe nac NAESA tahw ssucsid osla lliw yehT .ti dnoyeb ytirepsorp rehtruf eveihca dna sisirc cimonoce tnerruc eht emocrevo ot NAESA ni noitavonnI latigid etarelecca ot woh ssucsid lliw napaJ dna NAESA morf serugif yek ,ranibew siht nI noitubirtnoC s'napaJ dna NAESA ni noitavonnI latigiD fo noitareleccA :ranibeW ffo-kciK noitubirtnoC s'napaJ dna NAESA ni noitavonnI latigiD fo noitareleccA :ranibeW ffo-kciK";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-10-18 22:18:10";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-10-20 08:59:11";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:24:"nadia.elsyafira@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:79;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8985";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5879";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:76:"covid-robust-economies-regional-impacts-of-covid-19-and-options-for-recovery";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:77:"COVID-Robust Economies Regional Impacts of COVID-19, and Options for Recovery";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-10-27";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:2423:"<p>The COVID-19 pandemic is transforming economies and societies across the Asia-Pacific and its impacts will be felt for a long period of time. Countries and organizations across the region are developing strategies, actions, and new thinking to speed-up the economic recovery process and transition towards the new normal: from macroeconomic policies to regional trade, value chains, and production networks, to the regional economic integration across ASEAN and regional dialogue partners.</p><p>This webinar organized jointly by ERIA and the New Zealand Mission to ASEAN, will discuss and compare different regional strategies and approaches to the economy, trade, production, and economic integration. It is an opportunity to learn&nbsp;about the region&rsquo;s economic recovery from COVID and the challenges ahead, from speakers in the ASEAN region and New Zealand (the views of the speakers are their own).</p><p><strong>Welcome Remarks:</strong></p><ul><li>Dato Lim Jock Hoi, Secretary-General of ASEAN</li><li>Koji Hachiyama,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>Chief Operating Officer, ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>&nbsp;Convenor and Moderator:</strong></p><ul><li>Alan Bollard,&nbsp;Professor of Asia-Pacific Economies at the Victoria University of Wellington, ERIA Governing Board Member from New Zealand</li></ul><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Lili Yan Ing,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>Lead Advisor (Southeast Asia region), Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)</li><li>Deborah Elms,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>Founder and Executive Director, Asian Trade Centre (ATC)</li><li>Pavida Pananond,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>Associate Professor, Thammasat Business School, Thammasat University Thailand</li><li>Vangelis Vitalis,<strong>&nbsp;</strong>Deputy Secretary, Trade and Economic, New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs &amp; Trade</li></ul><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>27 October 2020, 9.30 AM to 11.00 AM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/27%20Oct_Agenda_ERIA-NZ_webinar(FIN).pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/3iXGG2X" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-10-27";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-10-27";s:8:"keywords";s:4193:"COVID-Robust Economies Regional Impacts of COVID-19, and Options for Recovery COVID-Robust Economies Regional Impacts of COVID-19, and Options for Recovery The COVID-19 pandemic is transforming economies and societies across the Asia-Pacific and its impacts will be felt for a long period of time. Countries and organizations across the region are developing strategies, actions, and new thinking to speed-up the economic recovery process and transition towards the new normal: from macroeconomic policies to regional trade, value chains, and production networks, to the regional economic integration across ASEAN and regional dialogue partners.
This webinar organized jointly by ERIA and the New Zealand Mission to ASEAN, will discuss and compare different regional strategies and approaches to the economy, trade, production, and economic integration. It is an opportunity to learn&nbsp;about the region&rsquo;s economic recovery from COVID and the challenges ahead, from speakers in the ASEAN region and New Zealand (the views of the speakers are their own).
Welcome Remarks:

Dato Lim Jock Hoi, Secretary-General of ASEAN
Koji Hachiyama,&nbsp;Chief Operating Officer, ERIA

&nbsp;Convenor and Moderator:

Alan Bollard,&nbsp;Professor of Asia-Pacific Economies at the Victoria University of Wellington, ERIA Governing Board Member from New Zealand

Speakers:

Lili Yan Ing,&nbsp;Lead Advisor (Southeast Asia region), Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA)
Deborah Elms,&nbsp;Founder and Executive Director, Asian Trade Centre (ATC)
Pavida Pananond,&nbsp;Associate Professor, Thammasat Business School, Thammasat University Thailand
Vangelis Vitalis,&nbsp;Deputy Secretary, Trade and Economic, New Zealand Ministry of Foreign Affairs &amp; Trade

Date and Time:
27 October 2020, 9.30 AM to 11.00 AM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;

Negative impacts and pressures on firms, the labour market and households are already apparent, although they vary by sector. In addition to policies to prevent the spread of the virus, such as border closures, lockdowns and restrictions on social interaction, all countries in the region have taken measures to ease the economic shock, including stimulus packages, but further efforts are needed. Continuous policy support is necessary to overcome the issues confronting the sectors most affected by the pandemic.</p><p>The pandemic demonstrated the importance of digitalisation and the opportunities it brings. Digital tools proved essential during lockdowns to ensure the continuity of essential services. However, efforts to mobilise digital innovations remain limited in some emerging economies. Further efforts would be needed to facilitate digitalisation and reap the full benefits of the growing demand for digital tools. Regional initiatives to deal with the pandemic and its effects are currently underway and need to be strengthened going forward.</p><p>Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), in collaboration with the OECD Development Centre and ASEAN Secretariat will conduct a webinar to share their views about policy challenges and priorities in response to the pandemic in the region.</p><h2>Format</h2><p>This moderated panel discussion will be held via Zoom platform using the meeting function.</p><h2>Participants</h2><p>Participants will come from the public and private sectors, academia, international organisations, and civil society. The nature of this webinar is public. The event will be recorded and posted online.</p><h2>Moderator</h2><p>Ms Anita Prakash, Director, Policy Relations, Office of the President, ERIA</p><h2>Panellists</h2><ul><li>Dr Aladdin D. Rillo, Deputy Secretary-General for ASEAN Economic Community, ASEAN</li><li>Mr Kensuke Tanaka, Head of Asia Desk, OECD Development Centre</li><li>Mr Iman Pambagyo, Director General for International Trade Negotiations, Ministry of Trade, Indonesia</li></ul><h2>Reference Points of the Webinar</h2><ul><li>South East Asia&rsquo;s economic performance will be important for all global partners in the post-COVID-19 economic recovery</li><li>Trade, both goods and services, will have important role &nbsp;in near and longer term economic growth</li><li>ASEAN must prepare for a digital economy, to maintain the competitiveness of its production networks</li><li>The next phase of ASEAN&rsquo;s economic performance will need investing in the human capital, and infrastructure for a digitalisation</li></ul><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>23 October 2020, 2 PM to 3:30 PM Jakarta, Indonesia time (UTC+7)</p><h2>Agenda</h2><table><tr><td width="170"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>TIME</strong></span></p></td><td width="265"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>AGENDA</strong></span></p></td><td width="142"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">&nbsp;</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="170"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>2:00 PM to 2:05 PM</strong></span></p></td><td colspan="2" width="406"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks</span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Ms Anita Prakash</span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Director, Policy Relations, ERIA</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="170"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>2:05 PM to 2:55 PM</strong></span></p></td><td colspan="2" width="406"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Panel Discussion</span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr Kensuke Tanaka, Head of Asia Desk, OECD Development Centre</span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; H.E. Mr Aladdin Rillo, Deputy Secretary-General, ASEAN</span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr Iman Pambagyo, Director General for International Trade Negotiations, Ministry of Trade, Indonesia</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="170"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>2:55 PM to 3:25 PM</strong></span></p></td><td colspan="2" width="406"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Q&amp;A</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="170"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>3:25 PM to 3:30 PM</strong></span></p></td><td colspan="2" width="406"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Closing remarks and end of webinar</span></p></td></tr></table><h2>Reference Document</h2><p><a title="Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia, China and India 2020 - UPDATE" href="https://www.oecd.org/dev/economic-outlook-for-southeast-asia-china-and-india-23101113.htm" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia, China and India 2020 - UPDATE</a></p><p><em>Published on 31 July 2020</em></p><p>The Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia, China and India is a bi-annual publication on regional economic growth, development and regional integration in Emerging Asia. It focuses on the economic conditions of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) member countries: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Viet Nam. It also addresses relevant economic issues in China and India to fully reflect economic developments in the region. The update of the Outlook comprises three main parts, each highlighting a particular dimension of recent economic developments in the region. The first part presents the regional economic monitor, depicting the economic outlook and macroeconomic challenges in the region. The second and third parts consist of special thematic chapters addressing major issues facing the region. The second chapter of this update focuses on the COVID-19 outbreak, discussing in particular the socio-economic impacts of the pandemic. An analysis of the quality of education in the region is discussed in the third chapter.</p><p>Read more and download the document from OECD&rsquo;s website: <a href="https://www.oecd.org/dev/economic-outlook-for-southeast-asia-china-and-india-23101113.htm">https://www.oecd.org/dev/economic-outlook-for-southeast-asia-china-and-india-23101113.htm</a></p><p class="pdf"><a title="Coping with COVID-19 in ASEAN &ndash; Challenges of Digitalisation " href="/uploads/media/Events/2020-October-Concept-Note-ERIA-OECD-Coping-with-COVID-19-in-ASEAN.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Concept Note</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/33TAWmp" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:34:"ASEAN,OECD,digitalisation,COVID-19";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Monde Maharani";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:13:"ERIA and OECD";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-10-23";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-10-23";s:8:"keywords";s:10365:"Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia: Coping with COVID-19 in ASEAN--Challenges of Digitalisation Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia: Coping with COVID-19 in ASEAN--Challenges of Digitalisation Background
The COVID-19 pandemic has affected ASEAN countries in many ways beyond the immediate health crisis. Negative impacts and pressures on firms, the labour market and households are already apparent, although they vary by sector. In addition to policies to prevent the spread of the virus, such as border closures, lockdowns and restrictions on social interaction, all countries in the region have taken measures to ease the economic shock, including stimulus packages, but further efforts are needed. Continuous policy support is necessary to overcome the issues confronting the sectors most affected by the pandemic.
The pandemic demonstrated the importance of digitalisation and the opportunities it brings. Digital tools proved essential during lockdowns to ensure the continuity of essential services. However, efforts to mobilise digital innovations remain limited in some emerging economies. Further efforts would be needed to facilitate digitalisation and reap the full benefits of the growing demand for digital tools. Regional initiatives to deal with the pandemic and its effects are currently underway and need to be strengthened going forward.
Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), in collaboration with the OECD Development Centre and ASEAN Secretariat will conduct a webinar to share their views about policy challenges and priorities in response to the pandemic in the region.
Format
This moderated panel discussion will be held via Zoom platform using the meeting function.
Participants
Participants will come from the public and private sectors, academia, international organisations, and civil society. The nature of this webinar is public. The event will be recorded and posted online.
Moderator
Ms Anita Prakash, Director, Policy Relations, Office of the President, ERIA
Panellists

Dr Aladdin D. Rillo, Deputy Secretary-General for ASEAN Economic Community, ASEAN
Mr Kensuke Tanaka, Head of Asia Desk, OECD Development Centre
Mr Iman Pambagyo, Director General for International Trade Negotiations, Ministry of Trade, Indonesia

Reference Points of the Webinar

South East Asia&rsquo;s economic performance will be important for all global partners in the post-COVID-19 economic recovery
Trade, both goods and services, will have important role &nbsp;in near and longer term economic growth
ASEAN must prepare for a digital economy, to maintain the competitiveness of its production networks
The next phase of ASEAN&rsquo;s economic performance will need investing in the human capital, and infrastructure for a digitalisation

Date and Time
23 October 2020, 2 PM to 3:30 PM Jakarta, Indonesia time (UTC+7)
Agenda




TIME


AGENDA


&nbsp;




2:00 PM to 2:05 PM


Start of Webinar | Welcome Remarks
Ms Anita Prakash
Director, Policy Relations, ERIA

&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr Kensuke Tanaka, Head of Asia Desk, OECD Development Centre
&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; H.E. Mr Aladdin Rillo, Deputy Secretary-General, ASEAN
&middot;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Mr Iman Pambagyo, Director General for International Trade Negotiations, Ministry of Trade, Indonesia




2:55 PM to 3:25 PM


Q&amp;A




3:25 PM to 3:30 PM


Closing remarks and end of webinar




Reference Document
Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia, China and India 2020 - UPDATE
Published on 31 July 2020
The Economic Outlook for Southeast Asia, China and India is a bi-annual publication on regional economic growth, development and regional integration in Emerging Asia. It focuses on the economic conditions of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) member countries: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, Indonesia, Lao PDR, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Viet Nam. It also addresses relevant economic issues in China and India to fully reflect economic developments in the region. The update of the Outlook comprises three main parts, each highlighting a particular dimension of recent economic developments in the region. The first part presents the regional economic monitor, depicting the economic outlook and macroeconomic challenges in the region. The second and third parts consist of special thematic chapters addressing major issues facing the region. The second chapter of this update focuses on the COVID-19 outbreak, discussing in particular the socio-economic impacts of the pandemic. An analysis of the quality of education in the region is discussed in the third chapter.
Read more and download the document from OECD&rsquo;s website: https://www.oecd.org/dev/economic-outlook-for-southeast-asia-china-and-india-23101113.htm
Concept Note

.noiger eht ni cimednap eht ot esnopser ni seitiroirp dna segnellahc ycilop tuoba sweiv rieht erahs ot ranibew a tcudnoc lliw tairaterceS NAESA dna ertneC tnempoleveD DCEO eht htiw noitaroballoc ni ,)AIRE( aisA tsaE dna NAESA rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE
.drawrof gniog denehtgnerts eb ot deen dna yawrednu yltnerruc era stceffe sti dna cimednap eht htiw laed ot sevitaitini lanoigeR .sloot latigid rof dnamed gniworg eht fo stifeneb lluf eht paer dna noitasilatigid etatilicaf ot dedeen eb dluow stroffe rehtruF .seimonoce gnigreme emos ni detimil niamer snoitavonni latigid esilibom ot stroffe ,revewoH .secivres laitnesse fo ytiunitnoc eht erusne ot snwodkcol gnirud laitnesse devorp sloot latigiD .sgnirb ti seitinutroppo eht dna noitasilatigid fo ecnatropmi eht detartsnomed cimednap ehT
.cimednap eht yb detceffa tsom srotces eht gnitnorfnoc seussi eht emocrevo ot yrassecen si troppus ycilop suounitnoC .dedeen era stroffe rehtruf tub ,segakcap sulumits gnidulcni ,kcohs cimonoce eht esae ot serusaem nekat evah noiger eht ni seirtnuoc lla ,noitcaretni laicos no snoitcirtser dna snwodkcol ,serusolc redrob sa hcus ,suriv eht fo daerps eht tneverp ot seicilop ot noitidda nI .rotces yb yrav yeht hguohtla ,tnerappa ydaerla era sdlohesuoh dna tekram ruobal eht ,smrif no serusserp dna stcapmi evitageN .sisirc htlaeh etaidemmi eht dnoyeb syaw ynam ni seirtnuoc NAESA detceffa sah cimednap 91-DIVOC ehT
dnuorgkcaB noitasilatigiD fo segnellahC--NAESA ni 91-DIVOC htiw gnipoC :aisA tsaehtuoS rof kooltuO cimonocE noitasilatigiD fo segnellahC--NAESA ni 91-DIVOC htiw gnipoC :aisA tsaehtuoS rof kooltuO cimonocE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-10-13 14:25:59";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-10-19 11:16:58";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"monde.maharani@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:81;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8851";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5851";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:98:"international-webinar-older-people-and-covid-19-in-indonesia-early-analysis-of-silani-phone-survey";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:113:"International Webinar â€œOlder People and Covid-19 in Indonesia: Early Analysis of SILANI Phone Surveyâ€";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-10-07";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:1448:"<div class="kvgmc6g5 cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q"><div dir="auto">&nbsp;The pandemic of Covid-19 has created significant impacts on older people in Indonesia. The physical and social restriction policy prevents older people from meeting friends, relatives, and their immediate family. To maintain their quality of life, older people need social and health services, as well as close connections to family and friends. The isolation, fear of getting infected, and economic insecurity may affect older people&#039;s well-being.</div><p>Using SILANI, ERIA and Bappenas conduct a two-wave phone survey to investigate the impact of Covid-19 on the situation of older people. The survey covered 3,500 older people in the SILANI regions.</p><p>Regarding that, and also to commemorate the International Day for Older Persons, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), in collaboration with Bappenas, will conduct an International Webinar event on &ldquo;Older People and Covid-19 in Indonesia: Early Analysis of SILANI Phone Survey&rdquo;</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;" href="/uploads/media/ERIA-Bappenas-International-Webinar.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><div dir="auto">&nbsp;</div></div><div class="o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q">&nbsp;</div><div class="o9v6fnle cxmmr5t8 oygrvhab hcukyx3x c1et5uql ii04i59q">&nbsp;</div>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:14:"Ms Nanda Putri";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-10-07";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-10-07";s:8:"keywords";s:2699:"International Webinar â€œOlder People and Covid-19 in Indonesia: Early Analysis of SILANI Phone Surveyâ€ International Webinar â€œOlder People and Covid-19 in Indonesia: Early Analysis of SILANI Phone Surveyâ€ &nbsp;The pandemic of Covid-19 has created significant impacts on older people in Indonesia. The physical and social restriction policy prevents older people from meeting friends, relatives, and their immediate family. To maintain their quality of life, older people need social and health services, as well as close connections to family and friends. The isolation, fear of getting infected, and economic insecurity may affect older people's well-being.
Using SILANI, ERIA and Bappenas conduct a two-wave phone survey to investigate the impact of Covid-19 on the situation of older people. The survey covered 3,500 older people in the SILANI regions.
Regarding that, and also to commemorate the International Day for Older Persons, Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), in collaboration with Bappenas, will conduct an International Webinar event on &ldquo;Older People and Covid-19 in Indonesia: Early Analysis of SILANI Phone Survey&rdquo;
PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;
&nbsp;

&nbsp;

.snoiger INALIS eht ni elpoep redlo 005,3 derevoc yevrus ehT .elpoep redlo fo noitautis eht no 91-divoC fo tcapmi eht etagitsevni ot yevrus enohp evaw-owt a tcudnoc saneppaB dna AIRE ,INALIS gnisU
.gnieb-llew s'elpoep redlo tceffa yam ytirucesni cimonoce dna ,detcefni gnitteg fo raef ,noitalosi ehT .sdneirf dna ylimaf ot snoitcennoc esolc sa llew sa ,secivres htlaeh dna laicos deen elpoep redlo ,efil fo ytilauq rieht niatniam oT .ylimaf etaidemmi rieht dna ,sevitaler ,sdneirf gniteem morf elpoep redlo stneverp ycilop noitcirtser laicos dna lacisyhp ehT .aisenodnI ni elpoep redlo no stcapmi tnacifingis detaerc sah 91-divoC fo cimednap ehT;psbn& €âyevruS enohP INALIS fo sisylanA ylraE :aisenodnI ni 91-divoC dna elpoeP redlOœ€â ranibeW lanoitanretnI €âyevruS enohP INALIS fo sisylanA ylraE :aisenodnI ni 91-divoC dna elpoeP redlOœ€â ranibeW lanoitanretnI";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-10-05 12:52:47";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-10-05 12:55:44";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:20:"nanda.putri@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:82;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8827";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5847";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:85:"eria-msmes-webinar-talk-6---upskilling-to-succeed--asean-msmes-in-the-digital-economy";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:86:"ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #6 - Upskilling to Succeed- ASEAN MSMEs in the Digital Economy";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-10-08";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:2650:"<p><u></u>The push towards digitalisation and digital transformation have been on the agenda of many governments in recent years, notably more targeted towards small businesses. The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic further accelerated this agenda even as MSMEs struggled to adapt and survive in the uncertain economic environment.</p><p>Whilst the broad agenda must be commended, the fact remains that digital transformation covers a broad spectrum requiring varying skill sets. Upskilling to succeed is necessary, but what skills are needed, what support is provided and fundamentally, what are entrepreneurs, start-ups and small businesses doing to remain relevant in the digital economy?</p><p>Come join us and hear from a well-blended panel of economic experts and entrepreneurs as they share their thoughts about what they see locally and regionally.</p><h2>Speakers</h2><ul><li>Yan Naing Oo, CEO &amp; Co-founder, The Door Tech (Myanmar)</li><li>Lydia Ng, Founder, Thinktechniq (Singapore)</li><li>Meloney C. Lindberg, Country Representative in Cambodia, The Asia Foundation</li><li>Dr Rashesh Shrestha, Economist, ERIA</li></ul><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>8 October 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)</p><h2>Location</h2><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><h2>Agenda</h2><table><tr><td width="136"><p>TIME</p></td><td width="464"><p>AGENDA</p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Welcome Remarks</strong></p><p>Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>2:05 &ndash; 2:35 PM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Panel Discussion</strong></p><p><strong>Speakers:</strong></p><ul><li>Yan Naing Oo, CEO &amp; Co-founder, The Door Tech (Myanmar)</li><li>Lydia Ng, Founder, Thinktechniq (Singapore)</li><li>Meloney C. Lindberg, Country Representative in Cambodia, The Asia Foundation</li><li>Dr Rashesh Shrestha, Economist, ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>Moderator:</strong></p><p>Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>2:35 &ndash; 2:55 PM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Q &amp; A</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>2:55 &ndash; 3:00 PM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Closing Remarks</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="/uploads/media/Agenda_MSMEs_6th_on_8th_Oct.pdf">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/upskilling-to-succeed-asean-msmes-in-the-digital-economy-tickets-123302632493" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-10-08";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4335:"ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #6 - Upskilling to Succeed- ASEAN MSMEs in the Digital Economy ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #6 - Upskilling to Succeed- ASEAN MSMEs in the Digital Economy The push towards digitalisation and digital transformation have been on the agenda of many governments in recent years, notably more targeted towards small businesses. The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic further accelerated this agenda even as MSMEs struggled to adapt and survive in the uncertain economic environment.
Whilst the broad agenda must be commended, the fact remains that digital transformation covers a broad spectrum requiring varying skill sets. Upskilling to succeed is necessary, but what skills are needed, what support is provided and fundamentally, what are entrepreneurs, start-ups and small businesses doing to remain relevant in the digital economy?
Come join us and hear from a well-blended panel of economic experts and entrepreneurs as they share their thoughts about what they see locally and regionally.
Speakers

Yan Naing Oo, CEO &amp; Co-founder, The Door Tech (Myanmar)
Lydia Ng, Founder, Thinktechniq (Singapore)
Meloney C. Lindberg, Country Representative in Cambodia, The Asia Foundation
Dr Rashesh Shrestha, Economist, ERIA

Date and Time
8 October 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)
Location
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda

Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA

Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA

AIRE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-09-30 17:01:17";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-09-30 17:08:43";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:83;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8822";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5844";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:86:"southeast-asia-regional-programme-sixth-steering-group-meeting-thematic-webinar-part-i";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:86:"Southeast Asia Regional Programme Sixth Steering Group Meeting Thematic Webinar Part I";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-10-06";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:993:"<p>In all Southeast Asian countries, infrastructure development is considered as key to the economic recovery post-Covid-19, not only as a tool to increase public spending to boost growth, but as channel through which the post-recovery economy and society could be made more resilient to similar, and different, shocks.</p><p>This webinar will address the ongoing policy discussion on the policy discussion surrounding infrastructure planning and development in the ASEAN context, including on changes in priority setting following the crisis, how Covid-19 has impacted or likely to impact into the future on the financing of infrastructure, as well as impact on climate change consideration.&nbsp; An example of how an OECD Member addressed these issues will follow.</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Agenda_Resilient-Infrastructure-Webinar_OCT-2020_v1.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Monde Maharani";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-10-06";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-10-06";s:8:"keywords";s:2141:"Southeast Asia Regional Programme Sixth Steering Group Meeting Thematic Webinar Part I Southeast Asia Regional Programme Sixth Steering Group Meeting Thematic Webinar Part I In all Southeast Asian countries, infrastructure development is considered as key to the economic recovery post-Covid-19, not only as a tool to increase public spending to boost growth, but as channel through which the post-recovery economy and society could be made more resilient to similar, and different, shocks.
This webinar will address the ongoing policy discussion on the policy discussion surrounding infrastructure planning and development in the ASEAN context, including on changes in priority setting following the crisis, how Covid-19 has impacted or likely to impact into the future on the financing of infrastructure, as well as impact on climate change consideration.&nbsp; An example of how an OECD Member addressed these issues will follow.

Talk #7: Agility and Resilience of Micro-Businesses â€“ Now and Post-Pandemic";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-10-22";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:2:"10";s:7:"content";s:2266:"<h2>Event Recording</h2><p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vq511KC7J14" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Event Report</h2><p><a title="ERIA Holds Webinar on Agility and Resilience of Micro-Businesses Amidst and After the Pandemic" href="/news-and-views/eria-holds-webinar-on-agility-and-resilience-of-micro-businesses-amidst-and-after-the-pandemic/">ERIA Holds Webinar on Agility and Resilience of Micro-Businesses Amidst and After the Pandemic</a></p><p>---</p><h2>Event Details</h2><p>In ERIA&rsquo;s engagement with various MSME stakeholders through the course of its webinar series, there was a common train of thought shared &ndash; small businesses must be agile and adapt to the ever-changing business environment.</p><p>The world has endured 10 months of the global upheaval caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, with the gloomy economic outlook set to remain through 2021. Many businesses, large and small, have caved under the economic pressure. Government stimuli measures have been stretched like never before, with many of such measures focused on helping micro and small businesses.</p><p>But how are these businesses really doing? How have they remained agile and resilient these past 10 months and more importantly, how will they remain so post-pandemic? Come hear from business owners as they share their thoughts and glean regional insights from economic experts in this upcoming webinar.</p><p><strong>Speakers: </strong></p><ul><li>Arief Imran, Group CEO, SERV (Malaysia)</li><li>Simon Soo,&nbsp;Founder, Track&amp;Roll (Brunei)</li><li>Marco Marchese,&nbsp;Technical Specialist on SME Policies, ILO&nbsp;</li><li>Dr Doan Thi Thanh Ha, Economist, ERIA</li></ul><p><strong>Date and Time:</strong></p><p>22 October 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)</p><p><strong>Location:</strong></p><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA" href="/uploads/media/!v1-ERIA-MSMEs-Webinar-Talk.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW&nbsp;" href="https://bit.ly/33RtOqA" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-10-22";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-10-22";s:8:"keywords";s:3487:"MSME Talk #7: Agility and Resilience of Micro-Businesses â€“ Now and Post-Pandemic MSME Talk #7: Agility and Resilience of Micro-Businesses â€“ Now and Post-Pandemic Event Recording

Event Report
ERIA Holds Webinar on Agility and Resilience of Micro-Businesses Amidst and After the Pandemic
---
Event Details
In ERIA&rsquo;s engagement with various MSME stakeholders through the course of its webinar series, there was a common train of thought shared &ndash; small businesses must be agile and adapt to the ever-changing business environment.
The world has endured 10 months of the global upheaval caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, with the gloomy economic outlook set to remain through 2021. Many businesses, large and small, have caved under the economic pressure. Government stimuli measures have been stretched like never before, with many of such measures focused on helping micro and small businesses.
But how are these businesses really doing? How have they remained agile and resilient these past 10 months and more importantly, how will they remain so post-pandemic? Come hear from business owners as they share their thoughts and glean regional insights from economic experts in this upcoming webinar.
Speakers: 

Arief Imran, Group CEO, SERV (Malaysia)
Simon Soo,&nbsp;Founder, Track&amp;Roll (Brunei)
Marco Marchese,&nbsp;Technical Specialist on SME Policies, ILO&nbsp;
Dr Doan Thi Thanh Ha, Economist, ERIA

Date and Time:
22 October 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta Time (UTC+7)
Location:
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
PROGRAMME AND AGENDA

â€œBasics of E-Commerce for Trade and Other Services Sector Officialsâ€        Virtual Room Ms Sheila Fathiya sheila.fathiya@eria.org   2020-10-04 2020-09-09 2020-10-04 4 October 2020 0202 rebotcO 4 40-01-0202 90-90-0202 40-01-0202   gro.aire@ayihtaf.aliehs ayihtaF aliehS sM mooR lautriV        €âslaiciffO rotceS secivreS rehtO dna edarT rof ecremmoC-E fo scisaBœ€â slaiciffO naidobmaC gnoma gnicnahnE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-09-30 13:57:17";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-09-30 14:06:25";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"14";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"sheila.fathiya@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:89;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8837";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5797";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:109:"eria-msmes-webinar-talk-5--sustainability-practices-in-a-covid-19-world-and-beyond-the-practicality-for-msmes";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:119:"ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #5- Sustainability Practices in a COVID-19 World and Beyond â€“ The Practicality for MSMEs";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-09-24";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"9";s:7:"content";s:2474:"<p>The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) were adopted by all United Nations Member States in 2015 as a universal call to action to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure that all people enjoy peace and prosperity by 2030. The tripartite partnership between public, private, and people has never been stronger in the call to action to address sustainability agendas and issues. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, many reports surfaced of improved air quality and reduced carbon emissions due to reduced industrial activity and global travel. The advocacy for greater adoption of sustainability practices has grown in voice. Yet, the business practicality of such practices has always been a hurdle for many businesses, MSMEs notwithstanding.</p><p>Moving beyond the pandemic, can MSMEs realistically adopt and implement sustainability practices for their businesses? What does it mean, what challenges does it come with, and more importantly, how can it make for a successful business?</p><p>Come join us and hear from a panel of speakers, comprising MSME entrepreneurs that have made sustainability practices a core element of their business, as well as economic experts who will provide pan-regional views on this &lsquo;hot button&rsquo; topic.</p><p>The&nbsp;event&nbsp;was held as follows:</p><ul><li>Date :&nbsp; Thursday, 24 September&nbsp;2020</li><li>Time :&nbsp; 2:00&nbsp;PM to 3:00&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)</li><li>Venue: Virtual Room (link will be sent with confirmation of RSVP)</li><li>RSVP :&nbsp; &nbsp;<a href="http://bit.ly/MSMEs5">http://bit.ly/MSMEs5</a> to register by 23 September&nbsp;2020</li></ul><p><em>&nbsp;</em><u>Speakers:</u></p><ul><li>Aivonne Chong, Founder &amp; Managing Director, Brown Bag Wines (Singapore)</li><li>Priyanka Chetry, CEO, Grocerdel (Cambodia)</li><li>Dr Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Senior Energy Economist, ERIA</li><li>Prof&nbsp; Jootae Kim, Professor, Dankook University, Korea</li></ul><h2><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Video</span></h2><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/T-7vK-eadIM" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></span></p><h2><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Related Document</span></h2><p class="pdf"><a title="Agenda&nbsp;" href="/uploads/media/!24-Sept_MSMEs-Agenda-(rev3).pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Agenda</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:14:"COVID-19,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-09-24";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-09-24";s:8:"keywords";s:4447:"ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #5- Sustainability Practices in a COVID-19 World and Beyond â€“ The Practicality for MSMEs ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #5- Sustainability Practices in a COVID-19 World and Beyond â€“ The Practicality for MSMEs The Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) were adopted by all United Nations Member States in 2015 as a universal call to action to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure that all people enjoy peace and prosperity by 2030. The tripartite partnership between public, private, and people has never been stronger in the call to action to address sustainability agendas and issues. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, many reports surfaced of improved air quality and reduced carbon emissions due to reduced industrial activity and global travel. The advocacy for greater adoption of sustainability practices has grown in voice. Yet, the business practicality of such practices has always been a hurdle for many businesses, MSMEs notwithstanding.
Moving beyond the pandemic, can MSMEs realistically adopt and implement sustainability practices for their businesses? What does it mean, what challenges does it come with, and more importantly, how can it make for a successful business?
Come join us and hear from a panel of speakers, comprising MSME entrepreneurs that have made sustainability practices a core element of their business, as well as economic experts who will provide pan-regional views on this &lsquo;hot button&rsquo; topic.
The&nbsp;event&nbsp;was held as follows:

Date :&nbsp; Thursday, 24 September&nbsp;2020
Time :&nbsp; 2:00&nbsp;PM to 3:00&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)
Venue: Virtual Room (link will be sent with confirmation of RSVP)
RSVP :&nbsp; &nbsp;http://bit.ly/MSMEs5 to register by 23 September&nbsp;2020

&nbsp;Speakers:

Aivonne Chong, Founder &amp; Managing Director, Brown Bag Wines (Singapore)
Priyanka Chetry, CEO, Grocerdel (Cambodia)
Dr Venkatachalam Anbumozhi, Senior Energy Economist, ERIA
Prof&nbsp; Jootae Kim, Professor, Dankook University, Korea

Video

16:33:05";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:90;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8669";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5796";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:60:"the-impact-of-covid-19-on-australian-businesses-across-asean";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:60:"The Impact of COVID-19 on Australian Businesses Across ASEAN";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-09-21";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"9";s:7:"content";s:1764:"<p>Australia and ASEAN are experiencing lower global demand for goods and services as a consequence of the COVID-19 pandemic. Projections for economic activity and trade volumes remain uncertain for Australian businesses operating in the ASEAN region. In response to that, the AustCham ASEAN and the Economic Research Institute for&nbsp;ASEAN&nbsp;and East Asia (ERIA), with support from Australia, will host a public roundtable to discuss the challenges and strategies of Australian Businesses operating in the ASEAN region.</p><p>The&nbsp;event&nbsp;will be held as follows:</p><ul><li>Date :&nbsp; Monday, 21&nbsp;September&nbsp;2020</li><li>Time :&nbsp;1:00&nbsp;PM to 2:30&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)</li><li>Venue: Virtual Room (link will be sent with confirmation of RSVP)</li><li>RSVP : <a title="RSVP through Eventbrite" href="https://bit.ly/3bUUEkd" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">https://bit.ly/3bUUEkd</a> to register by 20 September&nbsp;2020</li></ul><p>&nbsp;We look forward to welcoming you to the&nbsp;event!</p><h2>Agenda</h2><p><u>Welcoming Remarks:&nbsp;</u></p><ul><li><strong>Koji Hachiyama</strong>, COO, ERIA</li></ul><p><u>Keynote Speech:</u></p><ul><li><strong>H. E. Will Nankervis,&nbsp;</strong>Australian Ambassador to ASEAN</li></ul><p><u>Speakers: </u></p><ul><li><strong>Chau Ta,&nbsp;</strong>President, AustCham ASEAN</li></ul><ul><li><strong>John Ackerman,&nbsp;</strong>Founding Director, PT Mitra Asia Lestari</li></ul><ul><li><strong>Intan Murnira Ramli,&nbsp;</strong>Policy Fellow, ERIA</li></ul><h2>Related Document</h2><p class="pdf"><a title="Agenda" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/Events/2020-September-AustCham-ERIA-AGENDA-2.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Agenda</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:24:"COVID-19,ASEAN,Australia";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:4:"ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-09-21";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-09-21";s:8:"keywords";s:3003:"The Impact of COVID-19 on Australian Businesses Across ASEAN The Impact of COVID-19 on Australian Businesses Across ASEAN Australia and ASEAN are experiencing lower global demand for goods and services as a consequence of the COVID-19 pandemic. Projections for economic activity and trade volumes remain uncertain for Australian businesses operating in the ASEAN region. In response to that, the AustCham ASEAN and the Economic Research Institute for&nbsp;ASEAN&nbsp;and East Asia (ERIA), with support from Australia, will host a public roundtable to discuss the challenges and strategies of Australian Businesses operating in the ASEAN region.
The&nbsp;event&nbsp;will be held as follows:

Date :&nbsp; Monday, 21&nbsp;September&nbsp;2020
Time :&nbsp;1:00&nbsp;PM to 2:30&nbsp;PM (UTC+7; Jakarta, Indonesia time)
Venue: Virtual Room (link will be sent with confirmation of RSVP)
RSVP : https://bit.ly/3bUUEkd to register by 20 September&nbsp;2020

&nbsp;We look forward to welcoming you to the&nbsp;event!

.noiger NAESA eht ni gnitarepo sessenisuB nailartsuA fo seigetarts dna segnellahc eht ssucsid ot elbatdnuor cilbup a tsoh lliw ,ailartsuA morf troppus htiw ,)AIRE( aisA tsaE dna;psbn&NAESA;psbn&rof etutitsnI hcraeseR cimonocE eht dna NAESA mahCtsuA eht ,taht ot esnopser nI .noiger NAESA eht ni gnitarepo sessenisub nailartsuA rof niatrecnu niamer semulov edart dna ytivitca cimonoce rof snoitcejorP .cimednap 91-DIVOC eht fo ecneuqesnoc a sa secivres dna sdoog rof dnamed labolg rewol gnicneirepxe era NAESA dna ailartsuA NAESA ssorcA sessenisuB nailartsuA no 91-DIVOC fo tcapmI ehT NAESA ssorcA sessenisuB nailartsuA no 91-DIVOC fo tcapmI ehT";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-09-14 14:55:10";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-09-15 17:07:27";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"4";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:91;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8593";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5787";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:76:"eria-msmes-webinar-talk-4---women-entrepreneurs-amidst-covid-19-boom-or-bane";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:87:"ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #4 - Women Entrepreneurs Amidst COVID-19 â€“ Boom or Bane?";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-09-03";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"9";s:7:"content";s:5013:"<p>Over the past decade, the number of women becoming entrepreneurs had been increasingly steadily within ASEAN. Digitalisation has been a major enabling factor, empowering many women to start small businesses from the comforts of their own homes. In some cases, what were once remote and traditional female artisans have also jumped onto the digital bandwagon to bring their products beyond their local and domestic shores, to a wider regional and global audience. The pandemic has brought many businesses to a stand-still. Yet, New e-commerce initiatives are being rolled out in several countries, providing more opportunities for women to start small businesses and embark on the entrepreneurial journey. There are obvious challenges in this journey, more in the current environment.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>Has the pandemic led to a boom in women becoming entrepreneurs, or has it been a bane? Join us to discuss these issues with three ASEAN women entrepreneurs, as well as two international experts, as they share their thoughts in this fourth webinar of the ERIA MSME Talk series organised in collaboration with Curated Connectors.&nbsp;</p><h2>Speakers</h2><ul><li>Ms Ratha Chea, Founder &amp; CEO of Khmum Technology (Cambodia)&nbsp;</li><li>Ms Phi Van Nguyen, Chairwoman of Vietnam Angel Network (Vietnam)&nbsp;</li><li>Ms Laurentia Lisa, CEO of Cyber Olympus (Indonesia)&nbsp;</li><li>Ms Deanna Morris, Programme Management Officer, UNESCAP &nbsp;</li><li>Mr Bernard Li, Program Director, APEC Secretariat&nbsp;</li></ul><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>3 September 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)</p><h2>Location</h2><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><h2>Agenda</h2><table><tr><td width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">TIME</span></p></td><td width="464"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">AGENDA</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM</span></p></td><td width="464"><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Welcome Remarks</span></strong></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">2:05 &ndash; 2:35 PM</span></p></td><td width="464"><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Panel Discussion</span></strong></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan (Moderator) -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</span></p><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Speakers:</span></strong></p><ul><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Ms Ratha Chea,&nbsp;Founder &amp; CEO, Khmum Technology (Cambodia)</span></li><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Ms Phi Van Nguyen, Chairwoman, Vietnam Angel Network (Vietnam)</span></li><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Ms Laurentia Lisa, CEO, Cyber Olympus (Indonesia)</span></li><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Ms Deanna Morris,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Programme Management Officer, UNESCAP</span></li><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Mr Bernard Li,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Program Director, APEC Secretariat</span></li></ul></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">2:35 &ndash; 2:55 PM</span></p></td><td width="464"><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Q &amp; A</span></strong></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Mr Ooi Tiat Jin, TJ (Moderator)</span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Founder &amp; Principal Consultant, Curated Connectors (Singapore)</span></p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">2:55 &ndash; 3:00 PM</span></p></td><td width="464"><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular, arial, sans-serif;">Closing Remarks</span></strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/ERIA%20MSMEs%20Webinar%20Talk%204%20Agenda_FIN.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTER NOW" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/women-entrepreneurs-amidst-covid-19-boom-or-bane-tickets-117738716671" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTER NOW</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-09-03";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:5515:"ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #4 - Women Entrepreneurs Amidst COVID-19 â€“ Boom or Bane? ERIA MSMEs Webinar Talk #4 - Women Entrepreneurs Amidst COVID-19 â€“ Boom or Bane? Over the past decade, the number of women becoming entrepreneurs had been increasingly steadily within ASEAN. Digitalisation has been a major enabling factor, empowering many women to start small businesses from the comforts of their own homes. In some cases, what were once remote and traditional female artisans have also jumped onto the digital bandwagon to bring their products beyond their local and domestic shores, to a wider regional and global audience. The pandemic has brought many businesses to a stand-still. Yet, New e-commerce initiatives are being rolled out in several countries, providing more opportunities for women to start small businesses and embark on the entrepreneurial journey. There are obvious challenges in this journey, more in the current environment.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Has the pandemic led to a boom in women becoming entrepreneurs, or has it been a bane? Join us to discuss these issues with three ASEAN women entrepreneurs, as well as two international experts, as they share their thoughts in this fourth webinar of the ERIA MSME Talk series organised in collaboration with Curated Connectors.&nbsp;
Speakers

Ms Ratha Chea, Founder &amp; CEO of Khmum Technology (Cambodia)&nbsp;
Ms Phi Van Nguyen, Chairwoman of Vietnam Angel Network (Vietnam)&nbsp;
Ms Laurentia Lisa, CEO of Cyber Olympus (Indonesia)&nbsp;
Ms Deanna Morris, Programme Management Officer, UNESCAP &nbsp;
Mr Bernard Li, Program Director, APEC Secretariat&nbsp;

Date and Time
3 September 2020, 2 PM to 3 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)
Location
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda




TIME


AGENDA




2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM


Welcome Remarks
Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA




2:05 &ndash; 2:35 PM


Panel Discussion
Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan (Moderator) -&nbsp;Director, Strategy and Partnership, ERIA
Speakers:

Ms Ratha Chea,&nbsp;Founder &amp; CEO, Khmum Technology (Cambodia)
Ms Phi Van Nguyen, Chairwoman, Vietnam Angel Network (Vietnam)
Ms Laurentia Lisa, CEO, Cyber Olympus (Indonesia)
Ms Deanna Morris,&nbsp;Programme Management Officer, UNESCAP
Mr Bernard Li,&nbsp;Program Director, APEC Secretariat





2:35 &ndash; 2:55 PM


Q &amp; A
Mr Ooi Tiat Jin, TJ (Moderator)
Founder &amp; Principal Consultant, Curated Connectors (Singapore)




2:55 &ndash; 3:00 PM


Closing Remarks




PROGRAMME AND AGENDA
REGISTER NOW       Virtual Room Ms Lina Maulidina lina.maulidina@eria.org   2020-09-03 0000-00-00 2020-09-03 3 September 2020 0202 rebmetpeS 3 30-90-0202 00-00-0000 30-90-0202   gro.aire@anidiluam.anil anidiluaM aniL sM mooR lautriV       WON RETSIGER
ADNEGA DNA EMMARGORP

tairaterceS CEPA ,rotceriD margorP;psbn&,iL dranreB rM
PACSENU ,reciffO tnemeganaM emmargorP;psbn&,sirroM annaeD sM
)aisenodnI( supmylO rebyC ,OEC ,asiL aitneruaL sM

)aidobmaC( ygolonhceT mumhK ,OEC ;pma& rednuoF;psbn&,aehC ahtaR sM

noissucsiD lenaP
