4# klaT ranibeW sEMSM AIRE ?enaB ro mooB “€â 91-DIVOC tsdimA sruenerpertnE nemoW - 4# klaT ranibeW sEMSM AIRE";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2020-08-21 21:15:22";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2020-08-26 10:05:36";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"13";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";s:23:"lina.maulidina@eria.org";s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";s:0:"";s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";N;s:16:"meta_description";N;s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";}i:92;O:8:"stdClass":48:{s:19:"article_category_id";s:4:"8829";s:10:"article_id";s:4:"5786";s:11:"category_id";s:3:"243";s:9:"short_des";N;s:12:"article_type";s:6:"events";s:3:"uri";s:145:"asean-on-point-public-forum-1---ensuring-the-resilience-and-sustainability-of-the-agriculture-and-food-sector-in-asean-in-the-context-of-covid-19";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:148:"'ASEAN on Point' Public Forum #1 - Ensuring the Resilience and Sustainability of the Agriculture and Food Sector in ASEAN in the context of COVID-19";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-09-03";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"9";s:7:"content";s:3108:"<h2>Video</h2><p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dbEJOtjGQw4" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><p>In response to the global coronavirus pandemic, the ASEAN Secretariat (ASEC) and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), will co-host a series of public forums &ndash; &lsquo;ASEAN on Point&rsquo; - to address issues of importance to the advancement of ASEAN.<br />The first Forum will focus on the opportunity to reset towards more sustainable growth, highlighting the challenges faced by the agriculture and food sector as well as discussing policy options for the agriculture and food sector in ASEAN to overcome the adverse impact of COVID-19. &nbsp;</p><h2>Speakers</h2><ul><li><strong> Dr Paul Teng</strong>, Managing Director &amp; Dean, NIE International Pte Ltd | National Institute of Education, Adjunct Senior Fellow, Centre for non-Traditional Security Studies, RSIS, Nanyang Technological University Singapore</li><li><strong>Mr Grahame Dixie</strong>, Executive Director of Grow Asia</li><li><strong> Dr Sufian Jusoh</strong>, Director, Institute for Malaysian and International Studies (IKMAS), UKM</li></ul><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>3 September 2020, 9:30 AM to 11 AM Jakarta time (UTC+7)</p><h2>Location</h2><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><h2>Agenda</h2><table><tr><td width="136"><p><strong>TIME</strong></p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>AGENDA</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>9:30 &ndash; 9:35 AM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Welcome Remarks</strong></p><p>ASEAN Secretariat</p></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>9:35 &ndash; 9:50 AM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Dr Paul Teng</strong>, Managing Director &amp; Dean, NIE International Pte Ltd | National Institute of Education, Adjunct Senior Fellow, Centre for non-Traditional Security Studies, RSIS, Nanyang Technological University Singapore</p></td></tr><tr><td width="136">&nbsp;9:50 - 10:05 AM</td><td width="464"><strong>Mr Grahame Dixie</strong>, Executive Director of Grow Asia</td></tr><tr><td width="136">&nbsp;10:05 - 10:20 AM</td><td width="464"><strong>Dr Sufian Jusoh</strong>, Director, Institute for Malaysian and International Studies (IKMAS), UKM</td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>10:20 - 10:40 AM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Moderate Panel</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td width="136">&nbsp;10:40 - 10:55 AM</td><td width="464">&nbsp;<strong>Q&amp;A</strong></td></tr><tr><td width="136"><p>12:25 PM</p></td><td width="464"><p><strong>Closing Remarks</strong></p><p><strong>ERIA</strong></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="/uploads/media/ERIA_ASEC_FORUM_FOR_FOOD_AND_AGRICULTURE_CONCEPT_NOTE_AND_REGISTRATION.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><p><a class="bluebtn" title="REGISTRATION&nbsp;" href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/asean-on-point-public-forum-1-on-food-and-agriculture-tickets-117724586407" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">REGISTRATION&nbsp;</a></p>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:0:"";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:18:"Ms Isabella Italia";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-09-03";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:4541:"'ASEAN on Point' Public Forum #1 - Ensuring the Resilience and Sustainability of the Agriculture and Food Sector in ASEAN in the context of COVID-19 'ASEAN on Point' Public Forum #1 - Ensuring the Resilience and Sustainability of the Agriculture and Food Sector in ASEAN in the context of COVID-19 Video

In response to the global coronavirus pandemic, the ASEAN Secretariat (ASEC) and the Economic Research Institute for ASEAN and East Asia (ERIA), will co-host a series of public forums &ndash; &lsquo;ASEAN on Point&rsquo; - to address issues of importance to the advancement of ASEAN.The first Forum will focus on the opportunity to reset towards more sustainable growth, highlighting the challenges faced by the agriculture and food sector as well as discussing policy options for the agriculture and food sector in ASEAN to overcome the adverse impact of COVID-19. &nbsp;
Speakers

 Dr Paul Teng, Managing Director &amp; Dean, NIE International Pte Ltd | National Institute of Education, Adjunct Senior Fellow, Centre for non-Traditional Security Studies, RSIS, Nanyang Technological University Singapore
Mr Grahame Dixie, Executive Director of Grow Asia
 Dr Sufian Jusoh, Director, Institute for Malaysian and International Studies (IKMAS), UKM

Date and Time
3 September 2020, 9:30 AM to 11 AM Jakarta time (UTC+7)
Location
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda




TIME


AGENDA




9:30 &ndash; 9:35 AM


Welcome Remarks
ASEAN Secretariat




9:35 &ndash; 9:50 AM


Dr Paul Teng, Managing Director &amp; Dean, NIE International Pte Ltd | National Institute of Education, Adjunct Senior Fellow, Centre for non-Traditional Security Studies, RSIS, Nanyang Technological University Singapore



&nbsp;9:50 - 10:05 AM
Mr Grahame Dixie, Executive Director of Grow Asia


&nbsp;10:05 - 10:20 AM
Dr Sufian Jusoh, Director, Institute for Malaysian and International Studies (IKMAS), UKM



10:20 - 10:40 AM


Moderate Panel



&nbsp;10:40 - 10:55 AM
&nbsp;Q&amp;A



12:25 PM


Closing Remarks
ERIA




PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;

Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2020-08-12";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2020";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"8";s:7:"content";s:4836:"<p>The COVID-19 pandemic is strongly impacting the social and economic development in ASEAN. Regional solidarity and coordination are needed for a faster recovery that minimizes future risks. It is against this background that ERIA is organising a webinar to discuss the <em>&lsquo;Economic Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries&lsquo;&nbsp; </em>with four notable experts among ASEAN region.</p><p>Join us in this virtual public discussion, to discuss the challenges and post strategy recovery to ASEAN as a region from the perspective of four countries.</p><h2>Speakers</h2><ul><li>Mr Adrian S. Cristobal Jr., Chairperson of ERIA Governing Board, Former Secretary of&nbsp;Department of Trade and Industry, Philippines (Philippines)</li><li>Ambassador Barry Desker, Distinguished Fellow of S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Nanyang Technological University; ERIA Governing Board Member from Singapore</li><li>Dr Tran Thi Hong Minh, President of Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM); ERIA Governing Board Member from Viet Nam</li><li>Dr Lili Yan Ing, Lead Advisor/ Senior Economist, ERIA (Indonesia)</li></ul><h2>Date and Time</h2><p>Wednesday, 12 August 2020, 2 PM to 3:30 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)</p><h2>Location</h2><p>Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)</p><h2>Agenda</h2><table><tr style="height: 44px;"><td style="height: 44px;" width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>TIME</strong></span></p></td><td style="height: 44px;" width="464"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>AGENDA</strong></span></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 88px;"><td style="height: 88px;" width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM</span></p></td><td style="height: 88px;" width="464"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>Welcome Remarks</strong></span></p><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Mr Koji Hachiyama - Chief Operating Officer</span><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">, ERIA</span></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 259px;"><td style="height: 259px;" width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">2:05 &ndash; 3:05 PM</span></p></td><td style="height: 259px;" width="464"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>Panel Discussion</strong></span></p><p><strong><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Speakers:</span></strong></p><ul><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Mr Adrian S. Cristobal Jr. &ndash; Chairperson of ERIA Governing Board; Former Secretary of Department of Trade and Industry, Philippines</span></li><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Dr Tran Thi Hong Minh &ndash; President of Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM); ERIA Governing Board Member from Viet Nam&nbsp;</span></li><li><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">Ambassador Barry Desker &ndash; Distinguished Fellow, S. Director Strategy and Partnership, ERIA</span></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 37px;"><td style="height: 37px;" width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">3:05 &ndash; 3:25 PM</span></p></td><td style="height: 37px;" width="464"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>Q &amp; A</strong></span></p></td></tr><tr style="height: 44px;"><td style="height: 44px;" width="136"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;">3:25 &ndash; 3:30 PM</span></p></td><td style="height: 44px;" width="464"><p><span style="font-family: sf_compact_textregular;"><strong>Closing Remarks</strong></span></p></td></tr></table><p><a class="bluebtn" title="PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;" href="/uploads/media/Agenda-ERIA-Webinar-12-Aug-20.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">PROGRAMME AND AGENDA&nbsp;</a></p><h2>Video</h2><p><iframe src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/N1FsObqjwuo" width="560" height="315" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p><h2>Related Article</h2><h2><a title="ERIA Hosted Webinar on Economic Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries" href="/news-and-views/eria-hosted-webinar-on-economic-impact-of-covid-19-in-asean-perspectives-from-four-countries/">ERIA Hosted Webinar on Economic Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries</a></h2>";s:10:"image_name";s:0:"";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:14:"COVID-19,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:0:"";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:0:"";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:12:"Virtual Room";s:5:"major";s:17:"Ms Lina Maulidina";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:4:"ERIA";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2020-08-12";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"2020-08-12";s:8:"keywords";s:5173:"Economic Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries Economic Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries The COVID-19 pandemic is strongly impacting the social and economic development in ASEAN. Regional solidarity and coordination are needed for a faster recovery that minimizes future risks. It is against this background that ERIA is organising a webinar to discuss the &lsquo;Economic Impact of COVID-19 in ASEAN: Perspectives from Four Countries&lsquo;&nbsp; with four notable experts among ASEAN region.
Join us in this virtual public discussion, to discuss the challenges and post strategy recovery to ASEAN as a region from the perspective of four countries.
Speakers

Mr Adrian S. Cristobal Jr., Chairperson of ERIA Governing Board, Former Secretary of&nbsp;Department of Trade and Industry, Philippines (Philippines)
Ambassador Barry Desker, Distinguished Fellow of S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Nanyang Technological University; ERIA Governing Board Member from Singapore
Dr Tran Thi Hong Minh, President of Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM); ERIA Governing Board Member from Viet Nam
Dr Lili Yan Ing, Lead Advisor/ Senior Economist, ERIA (Indonesia)

Date and Time
Wednesday, 12 August 2020, 2 PM to 3:30 PM Jakarta time (UTC+7)
Location
Online (link to meeting room to be provided after registration)
Agenda




TIME


AGENDA




2:00 &ndash; 2:05 PM


Welcome Remarks
Mr Koji Hachiyama - Chief Operating Officer, ERIA




2:05 &ndash; 3:05 PM


Panel Discussion
Speakers:

Mr Adrian S. Cristobal Jr. &ndash; Chairperson of ERIA Governing Board; Former Secretary of Department of Trade and Industry, Philippines
Dr Tran Thi Hong Minh &ndash; President of Central Institute for Economic Management (CIEM); ERIA Governing Board Member from Viet Nam&nbsp;
Ambassador Barry Desker &ndash; Distinguished Fellow, S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Nanyang Technological University; ERIA Governing Board Member from Singapore
Dr Lili Yan Ing &ndash; Lead Advisor/ Senior Economist, ERIA

Moderator:
Dr Giulia Ajmone Marsan &ndash; Director Strategy and Partnership, ERIA




3:05 &ndash; 3:25 PM


Q &amp; A




3:25 &ndash; 3:30 PM


Closing Remarks
